story:
Chapter 1: How This Came to Be

It's always been a dream of mine to record a folk Christmas album drawing on celtic music and old carols. This past December during my Celtic Christmas tour the opportunity came up to record a live album at the fantastic Carnegie Music Hall near Pittsburgh, PA, and I jumped at the opportunity! With temporary funding coming directly from a friend, we hired a professional recording engineer to record the whole concert and make this album a reality! I've already done most of the post-production studio time at Innovation Studios in Steubenville, OH and we are close to getting that part of things wrapped up! At this point we just need to start pre-orders to cover the funding of the project so we can get this album out to YOU as soon as possible!

 

Chapter 2: The Artists

Ben-David Warner is a multi-instrumentalist, singer, and songwriter with roots in Celtic, Classical, and Folk music. For four years he was a member of the Celtic Americana Band Scythian, which Nashville's Music City Roots says is "what happens when rock star charisma meets Celtic dervish fiddling." Trained on the classical violin, Ben-David plays the banjo, fiddle, viola, guitar, and mandolin. Ed Helms’s The Bluegrass Situation praises his new Scythian song “Built These Walls” as a “blue-collar ballad we can all get behind.”

Julia Kwolyk has been playing the violin for 27 years and teaching it for 15. Julia studied the violin at the Boston University Tanglewood Institute, served as concert mistress at the Connecticut College orchestra, and earned her B.A. in Music from Furman University in 2007. 

Nolan Ladewski began learning the tin whistle at age 6 and began touring at 12 with the band Kennedy's Kitchen. He added the flute to his repertoire, and honing his craft, Nolan qualified and competed in the All Ireland Competition in 2000 at the age of 13. Since then he has become a veteran on the US Celtic Festival circuit, and is now a full time member of the Celtic/Americana band Scythian. 

Erin Flynn earned a B.A. in Music with a concentration in cello performance at Kutztown University, and studied chamber music under Maria Asteriadou of Manhattan School of Music and the concertmaster of the New York Ballet. She has playing musicals with various companies and has played with the James Madison University Symphony and The University of the Shenandoah Symphony Orchestra.

 

Chapter 3: How YOU Can Make This Album a Reality

Essentially this campaign is a glorified pre-order opportunity. You get to be the first ones to hear the album, and your pre-orders help me cover the cost of the production. It's a win-win:)!

You are the record label, the producer, the advertising team, the art patron, the benefactor, AND the beneficiary:)!

Chapter 4: Every Purchase Counts

In 2015, I was able to raise over $11,000 through the generous contributions of friends and fans who wanted to hear my debut album. I am still as grateful as I was when I would see the pre-orders coming in everyday during that campaign! The costs are much lower on this album due to the nature of doing a live album (one concert verses 2 weeks in a studio) so I hope we can raise this quickly and get the album out!

No matter what package you choose, every order brings us that much closer to being able to release the album! Every person, every purchase is truly indispensable! 

 

 

Chapter 5: Other Ways You Can Help

Step 1: Pre-order the album:)

Step 2: Please let other people know about it! Please help share this campaign with family and friends!

story:
Hey! 

I’m Madge. I’ve been a professional actor in NYC for nearly a decade. I started writing songs in 2017 amidst coming out as a queer woman, coping with a bad breakup and combatting the isolation of life on the road with a Broadway National Tour. What sparked as healing practice burst into flame in 2020 as the world ground to a halt and in newfound isolation, I suddenly had the gift of time to resume writing. 

Beneath the sparkles and spandex, I’m a person who feels deeply. What I can’t share in stories, I put into songs. I started sharing these songs in an online class, virtual open mic nights, and a charity concert live streamed from my bathtub. Friends and strangers emailed, texted, DMed about how my work resonated with them. The songs that helped heal me were healing others too. I soon realized that these songs deserved more than an iPhone voice memo. 

With your help, I’m raising funds to record and produce my first EP. Through your support, I will be able to create a quality, fully arranged recording of my original music in a way that properly compensates all the artists involved in a time when live music as we know it is shut down. I am nothing without the love and care of community and it is my hope that this campaign reflects that. Together, we will create an EP of original music that will bridge the isolation of pandemic life and the grief of heartbreak and growth. Thank you from the bottom of my glittery, sad-song loving heart.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Recording and Mixing time with a producer in an NYC studio 
  • Fair compensation for backing musicians in a time when the live music industry is all but decimated (Piano, Cello, Guitar, and Drums)
  • Paying my arranger/collaborator/musical goofball Drew Wutke
  • Album shoot/Cover Art
  • Printing of physical copies and digital distribution costs
  • IndieGogo Admin Fees
  • We have designated this as a flexible funding campaign which means we will receive the majority of the funds raised (minus an IndieGogo fee) if we fall short of the goal, so any amount helps!

The Impact

The Queer Experience

My songwriting began  around the same time I was coming into the fullness of my identity as a queer woman. As a feminine presenting queer person, I am frequently coded as ‘straight’ and struggled to find representation outside of rigid stereotypes. In fact, I wrote ‘Lipstick’ (a driving pop dance anthem) about the delights of femme for femme romance, something we hardly see represented in queer media. By funding this project you are helping to bring queer stories and queer artists to light 

Personal stories, Universal themes

These songs were  written over the last four years and encapsulate a precious and transformative time in my life. Ripped from my journal and my therapy sessions, these songs chronicle a first heartbreak, relationship foibles and the beautiful, painful journey of walking into my fullest self. 

Although these songs have deeply personal elements, they speak to wider universal themes; the search for love and acceptance, gutting heartbreak, and the joy of owning one’s truth. Writing has helped to liberate me and by sharing these songs, I hope to inspire others to liberate themselves as well.

Risks & Challenges

Asking for money right now can feel audacious. Who am I to ask for support? Over my near decade as an actor in NYC, I have contributed my time and talents to fundraising for others through countless benefits, mutual aid, and charity events. My first bathroom concert in August raised over $2400 for Middle Collegiate Church’s social justice work and theatre scholarships for underrepresented artists at Jen Waldman Studio. This time around, I am taking the vulnerable step to take my turn and ask for your support for this dream project of mine.

By donating you are supporting art and artists, something vital in this time. Telling stories has been a fundamental part of the human experience, something that allows us to make meaning of and process the world around us. If you’ve watched a Netflix show, downloaded a new album, watched a streaming concert over the past year, then you’ve experienced this impact firsthand. 

Finally, we’re still in a pandemic. Once we’ve raised the funds, we plan to abide by the latest COVID-19 procedures once we enter the studio, including regular testing, temperature checks, masks and sanitizing.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow me on social media! @madgeikal on instagram!
  • SHARE SHARE SHARE this campaign with like-minded friends and on your social feeds
  • Hire me! 
    • I'm a teaching artist! I coach singing actors! Want to learn to embrace your unique assets as a performer? Get a handle on pop/rock swagger? Learn more about life as an actor on a Broadway national tour?  I can (virtually) speak to your theatre student, school or performance group about these topics (and MORE)
    • Podcast themes/jingles - Been working on a quarantine pod but in need of a jingle that slaps? REACH OUT! I write them!  I’ve written and self-produced podcast themes for actor/emerging thought leader Carly Valancy (Simple Ideas Taken Seriously) and actor/consultant Christina Pena (forthcoming - Conversations with a Mixed Chick)

I'm a teaching artist! I coach singing actors! Want to learn to embrace your unique assets as a performer? Get a handle on pop/rock swagger? Learn more about life as an actor on a Broadway national tour?  I can (virtually) speak to your theatre student, school or performance group about these topics (and MORE)

story:
WHAT
The Las Vegas Wine and Music Festival provides an intimate, multi-sensory experience repackaged in a new way. We want to bring an awesome collection of the finest musicians and wines to the Las Vegas Valley. 

Redefining the concert experience, LVWMF has a few things up its sleeve. For one, our sommelier-in-residence has paired the wines specifically to the music. Another is that we are deliberately bringing music outside of the traditional concert hall setting to break down the fourth wall between musicians and their audience, bringing cultural appreciation to a diverse audience, creating a unique experience for wine and music lovers in unexpected places, and contributing towards the quality of life in Las Vegas. LVWMF's goals go beyond this concert series. They include:
- Music JuiceBox Series: Introduces young ears to classical music!
- The Mentorship Program: Introducing budding young musicians to the experts in the field... and even giving them a chance to perform with them!
 
WHO ELSE
The inaugural season (June 11-13, 2015) will feature 23 world-class, critically-acclaimed musicians, the assembly of which is unprecedented in Southern Nevada.  They include a nine-time Grammy-award winner (violinist Philip Setzer, of the Emerson String Quartet), three Juilliard music professors (flute, bassoon, and clarinet), two Metropolitan Opera Orchestra musicians (English horn/oboe and horn), and Las Vegas natives who maintain successful musical careers, among others. An intimate and personalized event is in store for audience members as they are encouraged to enjoy a glass of wine with LVWMF’s season artists.  Wines from Terlato Wines International’s luxury portfolio are being paired by LVWMF’s esteemed sommelier-in-residence (Jaime Smith, who has been named best sommelier TWICE by Food & Wine!).

 

WHAT YOU CAN DO
We want to find those of you passionate about culture and ask that you support us. You can contribute to the quality of life in Las Vegas with a donation! We will be eternally grateful and we are providing amazing perks. Get in on the ground floor with our amazing and meaningful Festival to support #lasvegasculture. 

Remember, your contribution is tax-deductible.

If you'd like to be even more of a rockstar, please add just 7% to your donation to help us cover our administrative fees!
 

Stay updated:
Web | www.lasvegaswineandmusic.com 
Facebook | www.facebook.com/lvwineandmusic
Twitter | www.twitter.com/lvwineandmusic

Thanks for your support!

story:
Who are we? GIRLS ROCK OC!

The Rock n Roll Camp for Girls Orange County is a not-for-profit organization that provides a soap box for girls to rock. Through musical instrument instruction, workshops, and music, we aim to provide a space for girls to create, inspire, and thrive. We have grown so much since our first camp in 2013. In 2014 we served 75 girls, doubling in size from our inaugural year. We are entering our 3rd year of programming and expect 2015 to be the biggest yet! 

We are 100% volunteer run and operated. We are dedicated to making our programs accessible to everyone. The Rock n Roll Camp for Girls OC has transformed from a dream to a community, and we are so grateful for all of the love and support we have received. 


The Impact

Our camp is 100% sliding scale, meaning no one is turned away from attending camp or the showcase for lack of funds. We ask for families to pay whatever they can afford. 

  • 94.4% of our Campers take advantage of the sliding scale tuition. 
  • The average price paid per camper was $99.24
  • 37% of campers from Year 1 returned for Year 2!
  • 25 bands have been formed and written original songs!
  • 100% of campers pushed themselves, made new friends, learned new instruments and rocked the showcase!!
  • 100% of our teachers, mentors, assistants, and organizers are non-paid volunteers.
  • 100% of our work is funded by our community

WHAT DO WE NEED?

Since our program has grown, our operating costs have risen and we could really use help making sure we have the necessary expenses covered. This year we are reaching out to our community to help with funds for:

  • Music gear
  • Supplies (paper, printing, walkie talkies, necessary office and art supplies, etc)
  • Facility rental (Includes lunch for campers who request one)
  • Insurance
  • Food for our volunteers 
  • Fingerprinting and background checking volunteers
  • Showcase venue expenses


Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes, monetary donations are not something everyone can do. There are many ways to help out the Rock n Roll Camp for Girls OC that don't involve donating. If you can't donate, consider: 

  • Sharing this IndieGoGo page
  • Donating gear, food, or supplies
  • Loaning us gear the week of camp
  • Sign up to Volunteer Here to with us during the week of camp! 
  • Facilitating a fundraiser show/event in your area on our behalf!
  • Telling a friend about our organization
  • Asking your employer about donating gift cards or other resources

Thank you for taking the time to check out our indie-go-go page, and thank you again to all of our amazing community members who have helped us get off the ground and supported us since day one.

story:
What is Vegan Roadshow

I am Fat Gay Vegan and I am taking a mix of music, food and activism on the road across the UK during summer 2015. My  2015 Vegan Roadshow will include:

  • 10 live music shows in 9 UK cities and towns featuring vegan band Love Like Hate from Brisbane, Australia.
  • Information and merchandise booth run by Animal Equality.
  • Vegan food cooked fresh by local businesses.
  • Each night hosted by Fat Gay Vegan

This is a UK first. You can help me take vegan food, activism and music all over the country. Be a part of vegan history.

Dates and venues for Vegan Raodshow are still being confirmed. The full list can be seen below but please check back for updates:

Saturday July 18, 2015  London Vegan Beer Fest - King's Cross, London

Tuesday July 21, 2015   Sumac Centre - Nottingham, Nottinghamshire

Wednesday July 22, 2015 Wharf Chambers - Leeds, Yorkshire

Thursday July 23, 2015 Painted Elephant - Newcastle, Tyne & Wear

Friday July 24, 2015  Edinburgh - to be confirmed

Sunday July 26, 2015  Stereo - Glasgow, Lanarkshire

Monday July 27, 2015  Glossop - to be confirmed

Tuesday July 28, 2015  The Gardeners Arms - Oxford, Oxfordshire

Wednesday July 29, 2015  Brighton - to be confirmed

Friday July 31, 2015  Kabaret - Wood Green, London (final night party) - Colour Me Wednesday added to bill

We need funds & we want you to join us on the road

Taking a band on the road is costly, so we need your help. Our list of rewards will ensure you have the opportunity to be front and centre of Vegan Roadshow:

  • Costs for Vegan Roadshow include £1000 for van hire, £500 for petrol, £600 for accommodation and £400 for food and additional on-the-road expenses.
  • By donating to Vegan Roadshow you will be able to choose from a list of rewards including a special FGV thank you postcard, Love Like Hate EP downloads, a ticket to a show of your choice plus a physical copy of the Love Like Hate EP, VIP entry to London Vegan Beer Fest for the first show of the roadshow, a one minute jingle written and recorded by Love Like Hate just for you or dinner with FGV and the band following the conclusion of the Vegan Roadshow.
  • All money raised will go to offsetting the costs of the tour. We are hitting the road whether we reach the target or not. If we pass the target, money will go to paying the band and organisers a wage while we are on the road.

Why is Vegan Roadshow happening?

Vegan Roadshow is a platform for veganism and spreading the importance of compassion for animals:

  • It is a way to bring kind people together and strengthen the UK vegan movement through a series of fun events.
  • Each stop of the tour is helping an independent vegan band broaden their audience and an animal activist group spread their message through outreach.
  • As Fat Gay Vegan, I am known for creating exciting and inclusive vegan events including London Vegan Beer Fest, London Vegan Drinks and much more. Taking my brand of community events on the road seems like the right thing to do!
  • Vegan Roadshow is choosing 100% vegan or vegan-friendly venues. By bringing in a crowd at each stop, we are helping to support these compassionate businesses.
  • When a hosting venue does not cater, an independent vegan caterer will be invited from the area to be part of the event. This will help to raise the profile of vegan food providers in the local community.

Risks & Challenges

Vegan Roadshow will not be without its challenges - but we will overcome:

  • Musical equipment can sometimes fail but Love Like Hate are seasoned performers and are ready to change up their live act whenever the need arises. They have a series of sets lined up dependent on available equipment and technical aspects of each venue.
  • Traveling by vehicle can sometimes be dangerous and tiring so we have three people in our group who will be sharing the driving duties. 
  • Love Like Hate, Fat Gay Vegan and Animal Equality members are tough cookies but illness can befall anyone at anytime. Yes, even vegans! All shows will go ahead unless Love Like Hate are unable to perform due to illness. These shows will be rescheduled for the end of the tour.

Want to help us but funds are tight?

We don't just want your money. We also want your love:

  • Please post the link for this page on every suitable online platform... and some unsuitable platforms as well. Twitter, Facebook, vegan forums and message boards are great places to start.
  • Email family and friends to let them know of this awesome opportunity to help get Vegan Roadshow rolling.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Tag big names and vegan influencers on Twitter when posting the link for some valuable retweet action.
  • If the show in your area does not sell out via this Indiegogo campaign, come along on the night and pay on the door.

Vegan Roadshow 2015 love you for your support. Yay for community support!

Follow Fat Gay Vegan on Twitter

Follow Love Like Hate on Twitter

Follow Animal Equality on Twitter

Saturday July 18, 2015  London Vegan Beer Fest - King's Cross, London
Tuesday July 21, 2015   Sumac Centre - Nottingham, Nottinghamshire
Wednesday July 22, 2015 Wharf Chambers - Leeds, Yorkshire
Thursday July 23, 2015 Painted Elephant - Newcastle, Tyne & Wear
Friday July 24, 2015  Edinburgh - to be confirmed
Sunday July 26, 2015  Stereo - Glasgow, Lanarkshire
Monday July 27, 2015  Glossop - to be confirmed
Tuesday July 28, 2015  The Gardeners Arms - Oxford, Oxfordshire
Wednesday July 29, 2015  Brighton - to be confirmed
Friday July 31, 2015  Kabaret - Wood Green, London (final night party) - Colour Me Wednesday added to bill   We need funds & we want you to join us on the road Taking a band on the road is costly, so we need your help. Our list of rewards will ensure you have the opportunity to be front and centre of Vegan Roadshow:  Costs for Vegan Roadshow include £1000 for van hire, £500 for petrol, £600 for accommodation and £400 for food and additional on-the-road expenses.  By donating to Vegan Roadshow you will be able to choose from a list of rewards including a special FGV thank you postcard, Love Like Hate EP downloads, a ticket to a show of your choice plus a physical copy of the Love Like Hate EP, VIP entry to London Vegan Beer Fest for the first show of the roadshow, a one minute jingle written and recorded by Love Like Hate just for you or dinner with FGV and the band following the conclusion of the Vegan Roadshow. All money raised will go to offsetting the costs of the tour. We are hitting the road whether we reach the target or not. If we pass the target, money will go to paying the band and organisers a wage while we are on the road.    Why is Vegan Roadshow happening? Vegan Roadshow is a platform for veganism and spreading the importance of compassion for animals:  It is a way to bring kind people together and strengthen the UK vegan movement through a series of fun events. Each stop of the tour is helping an independent vegan band broaden their audience and an animal activist group spread their message through outreach. As Fat Gay Vegan, I am known for creating exciting and inclusive vegan events including London Vegan Beer Fest, London Vegan Drinks and much more. Taking my brand of community events on the road seems like the right thing to do!
Vegan Roadshow is choosing 100% vegan or vegan-friendly venues. By bringing in a crowd at each stop, we are helping to support these compassionate businesses.
When a hosting venue does not cater, an independent vegan caterer will be invited from the area to be part of the event. This will help to raise the profile of vegan food providers in the local community.    Risks & Challenges  Vegan Roadshow will not be without its challenges - but we will overcome:  Musical equipment can sometimes fail but Love Like Hate are seasoned performers and are ready to change up their live act whenever the need arises. They have a series of sets lined up dependent on available equipment and technical aspects of each venue. Traveling by vehicle can sometimes be dangerous and tiring so we have three people in our group who will be sharing the driving duties. 
Love Like Hate, Fat Gay Vegan and Animal Equality members are tough cookies but illness can befall anyone at anytime. Yes, even vegans! All shows will go ahead unless Love Like Hate are unable to perform due to illness. These shows will be rescheduled for the end of the tour.    Want to help us but funds are tight? We don't just want your money. We also want your love:  Please post the link for this page on every suitable online platform... and some unsuitable platforms as well. Twitter, Facebook, vegan forums and message boards are great places to start.
Email family and friends to let them know of this awesome opportunity to help get Vegan Roadshow rolling. Please use the Indiegogo share tools.
Tag big names and vegan influencers on Twitter when posting the link for some valuable retweet action.
If the show in your area does not sell out via this Indiegogo campaign, come along on the night and pay on the door.   Vegan Roadshow 2015 love you for your support. Yay for community support!Follow Fat Gay Vegan on TwitterFollow Love Like Hate on TwitterFollow Animal Equality on Twitter

story:
I made an error setting this crowdfunder to only run for 5 days. A number of people have been in contact to ask if they can still contribute, so I have set up another: http://igg.me/at/eton

please join this email list for updates about the release - http://eepurl.com/bjZrGr

facebook page https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lets-get-Fck-off-back-to-Eton-to-number-1/1608951279349849

twitter - https://twitter.com/rgrey

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background - I am a musician with a ukulele.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you - This is not about me, it is about bringing to people's attention the outrageous actions of the Tories the last five years.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve - We will keep the Tories out of power and give people hope again.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution? - Hope so.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you- I need £1.5k to record, produce, mix and master the song along with a few others to make up an E.P. then £1.5k for PR and marketing support.
  • Tell people about your unique perks - The perks are are very perky
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal - Just do a less ambitious release or approach a hedge fund to make up the difference with match funding.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world - It will make people smile and help them to see through Tory lies.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one) - I have successfully produced four albums of my songs.
  • Make it real for people and build trust - Would you trust someone with a ukulele who swears in public?

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles - I am a good jumper.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges - Cake, hugs and people power.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign - Tell your friends!
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! - Will do!!

And that's all there is to it - Thanks, that was fun.

story:
Back To Basics

So I'm embarking on recording my first solo project Back To Basics. The CD will consist of original music with real musicians. I need your help in funding this project. I will be donating a small percentage of what is raised to Sickle Cell Anemia. This is a cause is close to home as my wife has it. Those that donate will get copies of the project as well as a thank you credit. Please support this campaign to support this cause .

story:
Wolltest du schon immer mal in einem Musikvideo sein ?

Du bist die Story unseres Musikvideos!

Sende einfach ein originelles Video oder Foto von dir oder zusammen mit Freunden/innen ein. Sobald das erste Material eingeht, beginnen wir Schritt für Schritt mit der Produktion des Videos. Erste Sequenzen werden sofort während der Crowdfundinglaufzeit zum Anschauen und Weiterleiten öffentlich gestellt. So erleben Du und Deine Freunde die Entstehung des Video laufend mit.

So könnt Ihr uns Eure Videos einschicken:

- Dein Video sollte zwischen 1-20 Sek. lang sein (damit wir ein bisschen Auswahl   haben)

- Es dürfen auch Schnitte enthalten sein

- Möglichst hell ausgeleuchtet

- Filme wenn möglich von einem Stativ, um die Kamera ruhig zu halten


G'Culture ist das neue musikalische Projekt von Goar B, der unter anderen für Mambo No. 5 (A little bit of ...) verantwortlich ist:                                            www.goarb.de, www.g-culture.com

G’Culture steht für interkulturelle Verständigung durch die universelle Sprache der Musik. Mit diesem musikalischen Projekt möchte Goar B eine Brücke zwischen den Kulturen bilden. Er bringt Musiker mit unterschiedlich kulturellen Hintergründen zusammen. Beim aktuellen Song “Ciao Ciao” sind das:

der italienische Sänger Vito Lavita

YT : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fgs9SY4sli8

YT : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFiFibrJVRU

FB: https://www.facebook.com/vitolavitamusic

der nigerianische Rapper Toni Tuklan

YT: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vx8YX30tDbw

FB: http://www.facebook.com/toniojis

DJane San-D Tropez mit Wurzeln aus dem Balkan

HP: www.san-d-tropez.com

FB: https://www.facebook.com/SanDTropez

Mach dieses Projekt zu Deinem eigenen!

G'Culture

story:
Short Summary

Hello Average Joe and Peacemaker Nation supporters out there!  We are excited to announce that we are planning to go ON TOUR this Summer 2015, and we need YOUR HELP to make it happen! 

Average Joe is an Island-Soul (Soul music, with a Pacific Island flavor to it!) artist from Seattle who got his professional music career started in 2011, when he collaborated with his brothers, John Phoenix and PoBoxx along with a few of his musician friends and started their Island-Soul band, Peacemaker Nation.  Throughout the years, they have played at numerous performance venues and charity events throughout the Pacific Northwest region including both Washington and Oregon state; creating a reputation as a dynamic band with a soulful sound in the local music scene. 

Within recent years, Peacemaker Nation's lead vocalist and songwriter, Average Joe continued polishing his musical sound by crafting a ten-track solo album Who We Are, which offers an autobiographical concept album geared towards the illustration and proper depiction of Average Joe's ethnic, cultural and social background, as a Samoan-American artist from Seattle.  Average Joe shares his love for Soul, R&B, Hip Hop and Electronica music through each of his tracks. 

It has been many years in the works and, finally, Island-Soul artist, Average Joe is releasing his solo debut album, Who We Are!  What makes this deal so much sweeter is that Average Joe gets to share his debut album on the road touring with his band, Peacemaker Nation!  

We'd like to invite you to participate with us in a DREAM COME TRUE for this band of brothers!

What We Need & What You Get

We are campaigning to $5,000 in the next 35 days. 

Funds will assist us by taking care of some household business items such as copyrights, trademarks and publishing original musical material.  These funds will also help support the completion of the album which needs pressing and packaging, along with creating a website and flyers to help SPREAD THE MUSIC!  

Finally, funds will help with touring needs such as food and lodging, vehicle rental and gas, along with a few airplane tickets for our guys who have job and family responsibilities back home in Seattle. 

Some great PERKS that comes along with your financial contribution include Average Joe & Peacemaker Nation buttons, stickers, Shout-Outs on our social media outlets, t-shirts, music downloads, studio recording sessions, photo shoots, EXCLUSIVE Meet-&-Greet with the band, guest list spots to an upcoming show of your choice on the tour, a private Peacemaker Nation performance at your next event, and MORE! 

If we do not reach our entire goal for this campaign, the funds will still go towards the needs of this tour and the completion of the album.  But, we will continue raising support until we've accomplished what we set out to do, and that is to produce an album and to tour the world and share the love through our MUSIC! 

The Impact

The message that we share with people through our music came at a cost of living life as a Pacific-Islander growing up in the United States, more specifically living in Seattle, Washington.  Our experiences have given us life lessons that tell the story of love and hate, peace and war, rich and poor, all the while highlighting the ethnic, cultural and social conditions of our upbringing.  After years of cultivating our writings and our musical sound, Average Joe & Peacemaker Nation is proud to share our creations with the WORLD by releasing an album along with touring and performing on stages for the masses! 

Risks & Challenges

Some of the risks & challenges that we may face if we do not achieve our financial goal will be the delaying of the Who We Are album release date, along with missing out on this opportunity to tour.  Much of the album is already completed, but there are still some final steps that need to be taken.  We've also been invited by Keep It Litt Records to take part in The Climax Tour, which will go throughout California, Washington, Oregon, Utah, Nevada and Arizona. 

We want to open up the opportunity to as many fans of good music to be a part in the creation of Average Joe's album.  So, whether your bank account allows you to invest a large amount or a small amount, we'd love to have as many PEOPLE to be a part of this movement as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot offer a monetary contribution to our campaign, there are still many other ways to help!  Here are a few:

  • Spread the news and make some noise about the Average Joe & Peacemaker Nation Tour Campaign!
  • Ask your rich relatives and friends if they could check out our Campaign!
  • Like Us on Facebook, Instagram, ReverbNation!  
  • SHARE AND REPOST our Campaign on your personal social media pages!

 Spread the news and make some noise about the Average Joe & Peacemaker Nation Tour Campaign!
 Ask your rich relatives and friends if they could check out our Campaign! 

Like Us on Facebook, Instagram, ReverbNation!  
SHARE AND REPOST our Campaign on your personal social media pages!

story:
English version below

Qui sommes-nous:

L'Association Lune-Plaine est une association à but non lucratif qui a son siège légal à Ste-Croix. Fondée en 2008, elle a pour buts d'organiser des événements musicaux et des arts de la scène. Elle soutient les artistes de tous horizons, visant la rencontre pluridisciplinaire, la promotion de la créativité et le développement culturel dans sa région.

Ce que nous avons fait en 2014:

La Fiestaval 2014, c'était trois scènes musicales en quasi continu pendant trois nuit et 4 jours avec plus de 30 groupes variant du rock à l'électro, en passant par la pop et les musiques du monde, un bar, un camping, une forêt de hamacs, de la restauration, beaucoup d'activités créatives et ludiques à découvrir en famille, un espace bien-être avec des soins, massages, et de nombreux lieux magiques traversés par le Landart.
La Fiestaval « P’tit Festival, Grande Fiesta » s'est réjouit du bouillon culturel qui a été partagé du 10 au 13 juillet 2014 à « La Layettaz » à Ste-Croix et remercie infiniment tous les participants!


La situation actuelle:

La météo catastrophique durant toute la durée du festival, malgré la clémence annoncée et sans cesse repoussée nous a privé de la moitié du chiffre d'affaire prévu...

Nous avons organisé des stands dans divers marchés, un souper de soutien, et les fonds levés ainsi restent modestes et insuffisants pour rembourser rapidement nos créanciers.

Cette situation pèse au quotidien sur nos vies personnelles, et ils nous a été recommander de nous adresser à un large public grâce aux plateformes de Crowdfunding.

Ce que nous souhaitons:

En dehors des aspects financier et météorologique, la fête fût magnifique, les sourires innombrables, aucun incident n'a été à déplorer, le bilan écologique du festival (moins d'un kilogramme de déchets incinérables par visiteurs durant 4 jours) est record et des dizaines de personnes nous interpellent chaque semaine pour savoir quand sera la prochaine Fiestaval. Nous nous réjouissons de pouvoir nous remettre à la préparation d'une nouvelle édition, et pour cela nous avons besoin de vous.

En souhaitant que les contreparties proposées vous donneront envie de nous soutenir et de venir lors de la prochaine édition, en vous remerciant également d'avoir pris le temps de vous intéresser à notre projet, nous vous souhaitons à tous un merveilleux été.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Who are we?

The Lune Plaine Association, organizer of The Fiestaval, is a non-profit organization that has its registered adress in Ste-Croix/Switzerland. Founded in 2008, it aims to organize musical events and arts. it supports artists from all backgrounds to meet multidisciplinary, promotion of creativity and cultural development in its region.

What we organised in 2014:

The Fiestaval 2014 was three music stages playing almost continuously for three night and four days with over 30 bands ranging from rock to electro, via pop and world music, a bar, a campsite, a hammocks forest, restoration, many creative and fun activities for the whole family, a wellness area with healing, massage, and many magical places. The Fiestaval "Little Festival, Big Fiesta" proudly bears his name and was glad of the cultural broth that has been shared from 10 to 13 July 2014 at "The Layettaz" in Ste-Croix.

Our current situation:

The catastrophic weather throughout the festival has deprived us of half the number of expected business...

We organized stands in various markets and thus raised funds remain very modest and insufficient to quickly pay our creditors.   This situation weighs daily on our personal lives and those of our entourages, and it has been recommended to speak to a wider audience, thanks to crowdfunding platforms.   

What we hope:

Exeption made of the financial and meteorological aspects, the festival was beautiful, the smiles countless, no incidents has been deplored and the ecological balance of The Festival (less the one kilogram of waste per visitors during four days) is fantastic. Tens of people challenge us every week about an eventual next edition. We are pleased to put us in the preparation of a new edition after getting out of this mess, and this for, we need you.

The Fiestaval "Little Festival, Big Fiesta" proudly bears his name and was glad of the cultural broth that has been shared from 10 to 13 July 2014 at "The Layettaz" in Ste-Croix.Our current situation:The catastrophic weather throughout the festival has deprived us of half the number of expected business...We organized stands in various markets and thus raised funds remain very modest and insufficient to quickly pay our creditors.   This situation weighs daily on our personal lives and those of our entourages, and it has been recommended to speak to a wider audience, thanks to crowdfunding platforms.   What we hope:Exeption made of the financial and meteorological aspects, the festival was beautiful, the smiles countless, no incidents has been deplored and the ecological balance of The Festival (less the one kilogram of waste per visitors during four days) is fantastic. Tens of people challenge us every week about an eventual next edition. We are pleased to put us in the preparation of a new edition after getting out of this mess, and this for, we need you.

story:
Hip Hop is one of the most living youth Cultures on earth, it is living in TV - Radio - Internet - Clothing so allmost everywhere.

But still people don´t know about the REAL THING and think we are just a bunch of young criminals.

Our idea is to teach this people in real life , whats it all about!

  • Teaching youth and older people about Hip Hop and its way of life and the Motto of " Peace, Love, unity and having Fun! "
  • We founded an organisation for this Task called " Four Elements" http://www.fourelements.at/
  • Now we try to get people moved in to it. We have an once a month happening event in a club called "Thalia". The Event is called "Golden Era - Raw Shit" and we try to get "Writers-Breakers-MCs-Djs and all of the people who know and don´t know the community in to it.

Thats why we need your support, we don´t like money but we need it to get things goin for example:

Pay materials for acts

Having promo stuff ready so that people know whats goin on

Traveling costs for acts

Workshops for the people,

the list goes on :)


Your Money is helping us to keep the culture "Hip Hop" goin!

  • Our Event is once a month so in one year, with 10000 € we may pay all of the travel, material and promo costs
  • We would like to bring local artists on our stage to improve the scene in Graz/Austria but if there is a possibility to bring someone from outer Europe we also would do it if it will be in the budget
  • If we do not get the funding Goal, Money will still be used for the same Thing, the only consequence is that we have to pay the difference ourselves

Why should you support?


  • We got a lot of Events goin on and everything is more or less working without money, for example:
  • Klasse - Free Workshops for all: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZoBw1Tai79I
  • Park Jam - BBQ and Battles: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMrdlVgGfG8&list=PLD0A5816ADF5F5841

But now we are trying not only to get Kids to our events, we want to show the more or less, older Generation that what we are doing is still cool and important:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PIY3P0JBbpw

Please support to make Hip Hop what it was back in the days. One of the most important Cultures for everyone, no matter where he came from or what he looked like!

We already made so much Progress but still need people to wake up, if you wanna know more, Infos are here:

http://www.fourelements.at/

If you cant support us with money, we still count on you if you count on us!


  • If you wanna give us support in other ways like: promo help, connections to other people who want to do the same or just feel the same the connect is right here: manuelpoelzl@gmx.at

We would like to make something big out of this what we already have!

Maybe you will be one Person who can help us?

Thank you for reading so far, and may your support be with us!

story:
Short Summary

We are Modern Day Cure, a contemporary worship band from Saginaw, MI. We get our name from Hebrews 13:8, which says, "Jesus is the same, yesterday, and forever." To us, that makes Him the Modern Day Cure! Our heart is to exalt Jesus, share His truth, and see people changed by His power. We are taking another journey of faith and recording a new EP. Here's the details!

  • We are raising funds to record a new 4-song EP this year. We'll be produced by Tyrus Morgan and Jay Speight of Lift Music Co. in Nashville, TN. Both Tyrus and Jay are great songwriters and talented musicians. We are pumped to partner with them on this record. We had the opportunity to meet them at a show in Michigan a few months ago and we knew from the beginning it wasn't an accident that we crossed paths. After much discussion with them, we knew in our heart that we were supposed to work together on our next project. We believe that God is doing something very special through this partnership.
  • Your contribution will allow us to record the new music God has given us and help us continue to develop as a band. Tyrus and Jay have a wealth of industry knowledge about songwriting, the recording process, and the music industry that will help take our sound and ministry to the next level.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have crunched the numbers and we need to raise $10,400 to complete this project. Here's the breakdown...We need $7,400 to cover studio time, production, and mixing and mastering for the entire project. $1,000.00 will go towards reproduction of the EP and the additional $3,000.00 will go towards travel and marketing for the EP. 
  • For helping us reach our fundraising goals, we are offering our supporters some unique perks! In addition to giving away the new EP, we'll have stickers, posters, wristbands, and t-shirts to give away at certain donation levels. We want you to know that we appreciate your generosity!

The Impact

This opportunity to record with Tyrus and Jay is an answer to prayer and allows us to take the next step professionaly as a band. This record will reflect our growth spiritually and as artists over the past year. 

  • Your donation will help us continue to put out music that exalts Jesus and brings hope and inspiration to others.

Risks & Challenges

We are taking a risk by stepping out on faith and recording this record, but we know the opportunity is from God. We believe God will provide through generous supporters like yourself. 

  • We believe that the lyrics that we sing are true. We believe the God we serve is true. We believe the songs from this record will bring hope and encouragement, and to us, that is worth the challenge. God is faithful!

Other Ways You Can Help

No amount is too small, but if your not able to give at the moment here are some other ways you can help!

  • Help us spread the word about this campaign with your friends and family! We appreciate you helping us meet our goal.
  • Share our campaign  on your social media platforms and use the Indiegogo widgets to help you connect with others.
  • Please pray for us that every need will be met and that this EP will get recorded for God's glory.

Thank you for your support!!

story:
Hello, Fellow Music Lovers!

My name is Laura Ellis.   

I am a vocalist based in Los Angeles.  I’m originally from Overland Park, KS.   I’ve been a professional singer for the past 20 years.  I’ve had a lot of wonderful experiences and worked with some AMAZING musicians.   (you can check out some concert videos in the "gallery section" )  I've performed on shows like Modern Family  and done the Twist with Chubby Checker.  One of the most rewarding experiences I've had is working on the soundtrack for the beautiful video game, Contrast, by Compulsion Games!!!   Click here to hear "Kat's Song" from Contast


For the past several years, I’ve been focusing on touring in the stage shows  "Femme Fatale", "Cinema Sweethearts" and "Kit and The Kats".  I love performing on stage, it is a true joy!  But, I’ve been anxious to get back into the studio.



New CD

You know that time in everyone’s life, when someone has hurt you and all you can do is lay on your bed and listen to the same heart-wrenching songs over and over again?   Well, in my life, those songs  that kept me company, wept with me and finally healed me are the songs  that shaped who I am today.  I wanted to recreate music like that.  Music that "feels your pain"  and heals at the same time.    


What kind of music is this, anyway?

This project will feature a variety of songs that come from different genres.  From jazz standards to re-imagined versions of modern pop, rock and country songs.  As well as an original tune or two.   Think, sultry, sad and soulful.   


Why should I help?

It is a wonderful thing that the music industry today allows for so many artists to create their own work without the necessity of the "Big Label" deal.  But, it does require the funds to do so.     I've enjoyed funding the projects of some of my favorite artists.  It's very exciting to be in on the "magic"!   I'd love for you to be in on our magic, too!  


Who is on board?

Arranger and Pianist Extraordinaire  John Rodby

The man is a musical genius and has worked with everyone from Frank Sinatra to Liza Minelli.  I’ve had the honor of working with him for many years now.  He arranged and played on my two previous CDs.  His arrangements for this project are so beautiful, I can’t wait to share them with you!

We've  lined up some of the finest musicians in Los Angeles to make this a truly amazing project!


What this funds:

Arrangements 

 Licensing

Musicians

Studio Time

Producer

Design, Duplication and Distribution 


If we surpass the goal, we'll put it towards doing a vinyl release!   


How to Help: 

There are many ways to help:   you can pre-order the CD or even host your own private concert!  

Spread the word!  You can also help by telling your friends about this project via email, Facebook, Twitter and other social media.  

With your help, we can make this  a truly beautiful project!!!

Thank you!!!!


Well...that about covers it!  Thank you so much for checking our the page!  

I hope you'll join us!!!!

Please let me know if you have any questions!!!

Love,

Laura Ellis

story:
What We're Up To 

Hey guys! I'm extremely excited to be preparing for our first full-length album! 

A little bit about us -  I started writing songs when I was 14 after teaching myself to play guitar. My dad, Steve Williams, has done his time as an electric guitar and keyboard player in his own punk/new wave band years ago, and we joined forces in 2012 to start playing shows around town in San Antonio, TX. I kept writing songs and teaching them to my dad, and in the fall of 2013, we released our first EP. We took it to our home state of Michigan for an incredibly fun release show, and then brought it back to San Antonio, TX to our favorite venue Imagine Books & Records for an equally amazing show. After a year of writing, recording, and playing shows, I put together a second EP off to the side by myself and the response was very positive and motivating. Now, we are finally ready to take a selection of these songs, plus even more unreleased material, and compile a record to share with you! 

If you would like to hear my previous work you can head to http://alixwilliams.bandcamp.com 

I'm extremely passionate and excited about the songs I write and sharing them is my greatest joy. I believe music can be a vehicle for connection and understanding, bringing love and loads of good vibes to everyone who listens. I am incredibly thrilled to be making this record with you and your help!

What We Need Help With 

All of the funds we raise here will directly help with the costs of professional studio time (includes engineering and mastering), CD production and packaging, and initial t-shirt and poster orders! Here's the low down of the expenses: 

  • Recording at Westfall Recording Company in Austin, TX (Includes Mixing & Mastering):  $5,550
  • CD Production: $1,200
  • T-Shirts: $700
  • Posters: $120

The Perks

Wondering what each perk is exactly? Below are some more detailed descriptions of each item!
  • Digital Download - On the day of release (to be announced), you will receive an email from me with a download code and a link. You will then be able to go to the link and enter the code for an immediate download of the album! Includes cover and insert artwork as photo files (.jpg). 
  • Physical CD - This is the actual copy of the album! While the record is still being recorded and we are not ready to begin production of the CDs, our idea for the physical copy is a matte finished wallet case with a spine, back, and two inside panels, one for liner notes/thank yous and the other with a pocket for the CD. Physical presentation is subject to change, but this is the basic premise! If you choose one of the packages that includes a signed CD, please note that the cellophane wrapping will be removed and the front of the CD will be signed. 
  • Bonus CD - This exclusive bonus CD is something that I'm personally working on myself. It will include alternate versions for three of the songs from the record and one previously unreleased song.
        Alternate versions include:    - "The Curse"                                                                                                                                            - "Crystal Flame"                                                                                                                                    - "I Saw You Standing There"
        Unreleased song:                      - "Follow You" 
  • Poster - This will be one groovy 11" x 17" poster printed with high quality ink and on durable poster stock paper. The design will be posted right here as soon as it is final. I will make an announcement on my Facebook page (www.facebook.com/alixwilliams.tunes) when it is up for you to see! I promise it will be amazing and look great on your wall! 
  • T-Shirt - This will be a multi-colored design printed on quality material for long-lasting durability. Our idea right now includes a dark maroon t-shirt with a design including "alix williams" and possibly the title of the album once that is released. Design is subject to change from this original idea, but dark maroon is my favorite color so I most likely will not be budging on that ;)  Here is a rough draft of the design: 

  • Instant Photo - I have a Fuji Film Instax Mini camera and it works basically just like a Polaroid. The pictures come right out of the top, develop, and look really awesome. An incredibly amazing person gave me the idea of taking some instant pictures throughout the making of the album and including them as perks for the campaign! If you choose the "Groupie + Instant Picture" package you'll receive an instant picture from, for example, the photo shoot for the album cover, in the studio, or a band rehearsal. Each photo will be dated at the bottom and include a notecard from me with a description! They'll look like this: 

Me and my beautiful daughter Molly <3

  • Handwritten Lyrics - For this one, you'll have a chance to listen to the record and then I'll email you and we can work out which song you would like to be handwritten! I'll write it on sturdy card stock paper in the structure of the song (verse, chorus, bridge, solo, etc.) plus doodle and decorate around the paper. It will be mailed to you in something where the paper will not have to be folded to fit in, so you'll get a nice smooth copy of lyrics from your favorite song of mine! 
  • Behind the Scenes DVD - During this whole week (March 7 - March 14) while we are recording and throughout the making of the album, I will be taking videos and pictures of all the different steps in the process. At the end of it all, I'll compile everything onto a DVD where you'll get access to exclusive pictures and videos that haven't been posted anywhere or previously released. You'll get to be a fly on the wall in the studio and at rehearsals. It will be great! 
  • "Thank You" in Liner Notes - A panel (or insert) on the inside of the wallet case will include song credits as well as thank yous. The "thank you" space is where we mention all of the incredible and fantastic people who have helped this record be possible and for your generous donation, you will be graciously thanked with your name forever in the liner notes. 
  • Pages of Notes + Fun Facts About Making the Record - This includes a couple pages of notes that I've been taking about song arrangements, tempos, drums, instruments, etc. They'll come straight out of my personal notebook and be yours to keep! With this will also be a letter from me with little tidbits of information about writing/recording each song, like what it's about, additional voices you may hear on them, cool instruments that show up, and more! 
  • All Three Previous Releases - This includes a physical copy of all three CD releases we've had. The first one being the self-titled EP released in November of 2013. The second is the accompanying Bonus CD for the debut EP with two new songs and three alternate acoustic versions of songs from the EP. The last release is the "I Like You" EP released in August of 2014. There is a very limited supply of these three CDs and more will not be made, so we're offering the last of them to you!   
  • House Concert - This is a big one! We will personally make our way to your house with our guitars and microphones and give you and your friends an evening of music! The way it'll work is we will communicate directly with you about when we can get to your location, we'll plan a date, you'll invite your friends, and we will come jam in your living room (or patio, or deck, or kitchen)! We will only be able to reach areas within the continental United States. If you choose the "Show in Your Living Room" package, we will all have an extremely fun time!                                                                                                                        

The Obstacles

With a project this big that includes as many people as it does, there are always obstacles we may face along the way. Recording may take longer than we expected, designs may not be finalized as quickly as we would like, and production of physical items always has the possibility of taking longer than expected, but we are determined, and this record will get finished! Our projected release month is June, and so far we are well on track to accomplish that goal. We have many ideas for touring with this record during the summertime, and are excited to share these tunes with you! With your help, the little things that may get in our way don't stand a chance! 

Other Ways to Help

While backing us financially in our campaign is incredibly helpful, there are other things equally as helpful you can do that we would be extremely grateful for. Sharing the link to this Indiegogo page on your social media sites and telling your friends is a huge help! Getting as many people to view this page will help us a great deal in reaching our goal. You can use this link to direct your family and friends to the campaign:  http://igg.me/at/alixwilliams/x/9854377

Also, if you aren't a fan, "like" us on Facebook and stay updated with the recording and album making process: http://www.facebook.com/alixwilliams.tunes

Thank you everyone for your continued love and support! We love you, and rock on! 

If you have any questions at all about the campaign or our music, please feel free to leave a comment on the comments page or email me personally at alixwilliamstunes@live.com. I'd be more than happy to answer your questions!

<3

Wondering what each perk is exactly? Below are some more detailed descriptions of each item!



Digital Download - On the day of release (to be announced), you will receive an email from me with a download code and a link. You will then be able to go to the link and enter the code for an immediate download of the album! Includes cover and insert artwork as photo files (.jpg). 

Physical CD - This is the actual copy of the album! While the record is still being recorded and we are not ready to begin production of the CDs, our idea for the physical copy is a matte finished wallet case with a spine, back, and two inside panels, one for liner notes/thank yous and the other with a pocket for the CD. Physical presentation is subject to change, but this is the basic premise! If you choose one of the packages that includes a signed CD, please note that the cellophane wrapping will be removed and the front of the CD will be signed. 

Bonus CD - This exclusive bonus CD is something that I'm personally working on myself. It will include alternate versions for three of the songs from the record and one previously unreleased song.

        Alternate versions include:    - "The Curse"                                                                                                                                            - "Crystal Flame"                                                                                                                                    - "I Saw You Standing There"

        Unreleased song:                      - "Follow You" 



Poster - This will be one groovy 11" x 17" poster printed with high quality ink and on durable poster stock paper. The design will be posted right here as soon as it is final. I will make an announcement on my Facebook page (www.facebook.com/alixwilliams.tunes) when it is up for you to see! I promise it will be amazing and look great on your wall! 

T-Shirt - This will be a multi-colored design printed on quality material for long-lasting durability. Our idea right now includes a dark maroon t-shirt with a design including "alix williams" and possibly the title of the album once that is released. Design is subject to change from this original idea, but dark maroon is my favorite color so I most likely will not be budging on that ;)  Here is a rough draft of the design: 



Instant Photo - I have a Fuji Film Instax Mini camera and it works basically just like a Polaroid. The pictures come right out of the top, develop, and look really awesome. An incredibly amazing person gave me the idea of taking some instant pictures throughout the making of the album and including them as perks for the campaign! If you choose the "Groupie + Instant Picture" package you'll receive an instant picture from, for example, the photo shoot for the album cover, in the studio, or a band rehearsal. Each photo will be dated at the bottom and include a notecard from me with a description! They'll look like this: 



Me and my beautiful daughter Molly <3



Handwritten Lyrics - For this one, you'll have a chance to listen to the record and then I'll email you and we can work out which song you would like to be handwritten! I'll write it on sturdy card stock paper in the structure of the song (verse, chorus, bridge, solo, etc.) plus doodle and decorate around the paper. It will be mailed to you in something where the paper will not have to be folded to fit in, so you'll get a nice smooth copy of lyrics from your favorite song of mine! 

Behind the Scenes DVD - During this whole week (March 7 - March 14) while we are recording and throughout the making of the album, I will be taking videos and pictures of all the different steps in the process. At the end of it all, I'll compile everything onto a DVD where you'll get access to exclusive pictures and videos that haven't been posted anywhere or previously released. You'll get to be a fly on the wall in the studio and at rehearsals. It will be great! 

"Thank You" in Liner Notes - A panel (or insert) on the inside of the wallet case will include song credits as well as thank yous. The "thank you" space is where we mention all of the incredible and fantastic people who have helped this record be possible and for your generous donation, you will be graciously thanked with your name forever in the liner notes. 

Pages of Notes + Fun Facts About Making the Record - This includes a couple pages of notes that I've been taking about song arrangements, tempos, drums, instruments, etc. They'll come straight out of my personal notebook and be yours to keep! With this will also be a letter from me with little tidbits of information about writing/recording each song, like what it's about, additional voices you may hear on them, cool instruments that show up, and more! 

All Three Previous Releases - This includes a physical copy of all three CD releases we've had. The first one being the self-titled EP released in November of 2013. The second is the accompanying Bonus CD for the debut EP with two new songs and three alternate acoustic versions of songs from the EP. The last release is the "I Like You" EP released in August of 2014. There is a very limited supply of these three CDs and more will not be made, so we're offering the last of them to you!   

House Concert - This is a big one! We will personally make our way to your house with our guitars and microphones and give you and your friends an evening of music! The way it'll work is we will communicate directly with you about when we can get to your location, we'll plan a date, you'll invite your friends, and we will come jam in your living room (or patio, or deck, or kitchen)! We will only be able to reach areas within the continental United States. If you choose the "Show in Your Living Room" package, we will all have an extremely fun time!                                                                                                                        

The Obstacles


 With a project this big that includes as many people as it does, there are always obstacles we may face along the way. Recording may take longer than we expected, designs may not be finalized as quickly as we would like, and production of physical items always has the possibility of taking longer than expected, but we are determined, and this record will get finished! Our projected release month is June, and so far we are well on track to accomplish that goal. We have many ideas for touring with this record during the summertime, and are excited to share these tunes with you! With your help, the little things that may get in our way don't stand a chance! 
    Other Ways to Help While backing us financially in our campaign is incredibly helpful, there are other things equally as helpful you can do that we would be extremely grateful for. Sharing the link to this Indiegogo page on your social media sites and telling your friends is a huge help! Getting as many people to view this page will help us a great deal in reaching our goal. You can use this link to direct your family and friends to the campaign:  http://igg.me/at/alixwilliams/x/9854377
Also, if you aren't a fan, "like" us on Facebook and stay updated with the recording and album making process: http://www.facebook.com/alixwilliams.tunes
Thank you everyone for your continued love and support! We love you, and rock on! 
If you have any questions at all about the campaign or our music, please feel free to leave a comment on the comments page or email me personally at alixwilliamstunes@live.com. I'd be more than happy to answer your questions!
<3

story:
And so it goes...

I have always been put off by the saying "YOLO" however we do in fact only live once and sometimes it is very brief. This is an opportunity to make a dream a reality.

Hi, I am Jeremy T McConnaha. For those of you who know me, you've seen me tour and play in several bands prominently as a drummer. However, a few years ago I realized my true passion was writing and performing my own music. Music is something that has inspired me my whole life. At an early age I was influenced so much by what I heard on the radio, friends and relatives records and what I saw on television. Music gives me purpose and is and has been for as long as I can remember what I am most passionate about.

That brings us to present day... I have recently been given the opportunity to record my debut solo E.P. with Mike Marsh of The Avett Brothers. Mike is an incredible musician and producer and has been a major influence on me as a singer and a drummer ever since I first saw him playing drums for Dashboard Confessional. I feel like the fact that Mike will be producing this E.P. makes the process that much more special, as not all artist have the opportunity to work with the people who inspired them to become what they are aspiring to be. This is that opportunity for me and I could not be happier about it. This campaign will help this dream become a reality. Not only will this allow me to work with an amazing producer and an incredible artist but it is the opportunity to work side by side with one of my biggest musical influences and produce my music for the first time.

I have been chasing this dream for a while now and I feel this is finally a shot to do what I have always wanted to do, a chance to bring purpose, passion and meaning to the forefront and most importantly show my kids (I have two kids, haha!) that following your dreams no matter what is what makes this life worth living.

Needs and Wants...

In order to make this dream a reality, I will need to raise 7,000 dollars. This money will allow me to record the E.P. with Mike, have it mastered, pressed and distributed. It will also allow me to pay for any instrumentation I will not provide on the EP such as strings, horns ect.

$3,000-initial production of the E.P.

I will be singing and playing guitar on this record. I will also be playing drums, minus one song because to not have mikes percussive skills on this record would be insanely stupid on my part... However things I do not play well or at all such as piano, strings and horns will be an additional $75.00 per song.

$500.00- additional musicians and instrumentation

$1,000- Mastering the E.P.

$1,000- Pressing and distribution

$1,000- Perk packages

$500- travel and other expenses while in Nashville for the week.

Here are the packages for your contributions:

$5.00- Personalized thank you note from the artist and a free download of one song from the E.P.

$10.00- Digital Download of E.P. and a Personalized thank you note from the artist

$25.00- Thank You Note, Digital Download, Physical pressed copy of the debut E.P.

$50.00- Thank You Note, Digital Download, Physical pressed copy of the debut E.P. and exclusive Jeremy T McConnaha T-Shirt.

$75.00- Thank You Note, Digital Download, Physical pressed copy of the debut E.P., T-shirt, and exclusive poster.

$100.00-Thank You Note, Digital Download, Physical pressed copy of the debut E.P., T-shirt, and exclusive poster., your name in the linear notes. 

$300.00-Thank You Note, Digital Download, Physical pressed copy of the debut E.P., T-shirt, and exclusive poster., your name in the linear notes. and hand written framed lyrics from one of the songs off the E.P.

$500.00-Thank You Note, Digital Download, Physical pressed copy of the debut E.P., T-shirt, and exclusive poster., your name in the linear notes. and hand written framed lyrics from one of the songs off the E.P. and a video concert via the interweb.

$750.00-Thank You Note, Digital Download, Physical pressed copy of the debut E.P., T-shirt, and exclusive poster., your name in the linear notes. and hand written framed lyrics from one of the songs off the E.P. and a video concert via the interweb. Exclusive pics from the studio and Dinner with the artist.

$1,000.00-Thank You Note, Digital Download, Physical pressed copy of the debut E.P., T-shirt, and exclusive poster., your name in the linear notes. and hand written framed lyrics from one of the songs off the E.P. and a video concert via the interweb. Exclusive pics from the studio and Dinner with the artist. An in studio listen of the EP before it is released.

Thumbprints

This project is bringing a dream to life. That is huge! There is nothing else in the world I would rather be doing than playing music, writing music, recording music, listening to music, ect... I feel my soul purpose is creating music, this is my thumbprint to leave on the hearts of others in this world. This is my passion, this is my purpose, this is my opportunity.

Dangerous Business...

These kind of dreams can make you or break you and define who you are, so far I have not much to show for my time with music, but I feel this opportunity is bringing everything full circle. I have sacrificed so much time, money and relationships to do music the way I feel it and I feel that is what will set it apart. However I have 60 Days to raise $7,000.00. I feel confident though! I have some of the biggest supporters in my corner who have encouraged me to chase this dream and make it come true.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am truly grateful for any contributions you can make and so appreciative of all the support this project has received thus far. If you would like to donate to this dream you can do so by choosing from any of the packages. 

Thanks again for all your support and be sure to keep up to date with the progress by liking my facebook page and subscribing to my youtube channel /jeremytmcconnaha or following me on instagram and twitter @jmachonky and pass this around to anyone and everyone you think would like to get behind something like this and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
INTRODUCTION: "Hey friends, fans and supporters! Thank you so much for visiting. I'm raising funds for expenses of my new rock single that I'm doing this Spring. Any support at any of the perk levels is appreciated so much. Without the funding of great people like you I'd never be able to make it up to his point in my musical journey. Every little bit counts and every step leads to new opportunities and opens doors. If you check out what I do and what I'm about you will see "I have no plan B on backing down on my dreams." Music is my life, job, and passion.

  www.frankpalangi.com


STORY: After meeting the band Daughtry at a local acoustic show meet and greet, Frank made contact with Brian the guitarist and soon after started developing plans to do a single. An instant grit and tone surrounds Frank's deep voice molding him recognizable. At the core, he is a singer/songwriter pouring his heart and soul into lyrics based around life experiences. This single will grow his talent, sound and personality to another level.

-"Frank’s natural talent and certifies that he can write songs that compete with the big boys of rock." Jamsphere Magazine.

"This experience is going to be amazing! I can't wait to travel and lay down tracks with one of my influences. Ever since Daughtry's first record, I'm been a big fan! I'm actually in the special thanks on the Baptized record for ordering the fan pack ahah. got to love it! but this single will please my core fans but also jump into a more developed direction. " - Palangi


BIO: This new rock single will be produced, recorded and mixed by Brian at the Cat Room in Charlottesville, VA. Mastering will be done by Grammy winner Brad Blackwood at Euphonic Masters who's worked on countess rock legend albums. Frank has traveled mostly to Nashville, TN in the past where he got his start working with industry players. Fate stepped in catching the ears of Grammy nominated band “Day Of Fire” while attending a local club performance in 2010 in Clifton Park, NY. Few days later, their producer Rogers Masson made contact with Frank and soon after began production on the debut “Frank Palangi EP” 2011. Producer Rob Coates and members from the christian band "Pillar" were involved on his 2nd "I Am Ready EP" release in 2013 which received an L.A Music Award Nomination for "Best Rock Single". It soon after lead to Frank self producing two singles in 2014 "Falling Too, Hope". Since then Frank has been on the raise as an independent artist making waves on this own working toward his dreams. Sharing the stages across the North East U.S with national acts from 3 Doors Down, Aaron Lewis (Staind), Buckcherry, FUEL, TRAPT, Powerman 5000, Candlelight Red, Young Guns, HURT, HEDPE, Jess Malin (Former D-Generation singer) (to name some). Gaining press with GuitarWorld, Revolver, Music Now, Young Celebrity, The Examiner, and more.

Follow here: www.frankpalangi.com www.twitter.com/frankpalangi www.facebook.com/frankpalangisoloartist www.youtube.com/palangistudios

Booking: frankpalangistreetteam@yahoo.com

I put the funding goal limit to $3,000 but I hope to raise over $4,000 with the help from you. Tell your friends about my music and this project! Share the link with your Facebook friends."

story: Your contribution will help to mass duplicate, distribute and create music videos of the songs. This edutainment project is part of an arts initiative to bring fun, educational music back into our communities. The songs' primary function is to teach kids in a way that is engaging. Subjects include bullying, hygiene, good eating habits, seasons, and being active, among other aspects of life.

story:
Who Is Pacific Standard?

We are a hip-hop/bass music duo based in California, comprised of producer Trevor Kelly and vocalist Ro Knew. We met in 2011 as residents at Ritual SF and we've enjoyed working together on several musical collaborations over the years. In 2013, we decided to link on a full-length project. Instead of rushing to keep up with the fickle trends of electronic music, we wanted to make a well-thought out, meaningful, conceptual piece of art that would still hold value to the listener after years or even decades of listening. Thus, we decided to title the album "Timeless," and release it on a 12" vinyl record to give the listener something tangible.

The album features guest appearances from Sacramento MC Task1Ne and Chicago turntablist DJ Limbs. The digital download also includes some stellar bonus remixes from B. Bravo, Le Moti, Caidance, Slagz, and 2Birds.


What We Need & What You Get

We're trying to raise a minimum of $3000 for this project. The cost of recording, mixing, mastering, designing and pressing vinyl is no joke! We're releasing this completely independently with no outside investors and no major label - so we are extremely grateful for anything and everything that our supporters can contribute! Funds in excess of $3000 will be used for the production of music videos, an official website, Pacific Standard merchandise, and the creation of new music.

Anyone contributing through this campaign will receive a download of the single "Dark Sky" in the format of your choice. Please allow 1-3 days for us to send you a download link.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute at the moment, that's okay! Here are some other ways you can help us out on our journey to share this music with the world:
  • Post this campaign to your social media outlets and share it with your friends!
  • Follow us on Soundcloud, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram!
  • Come to our show when we play in your city!

Every last bit of support is helpful! If you have any questions regarding this campaign, or would like to book Pacific Standard for a performance, please hit us up at PacificStandardTimeless@gmail.com.

Thanks for your time and consideration,

Trevor and Ro
