story:
Who We Are & What We're Doing

 Hi Everyone!
                          My name is Mandi Powell and I am a Singer/Songwriter from Houston, Texas.  Five years ago, I picked up my first guitar, and I haven't looked back since.  In 2012, I recorded my first album on a shoestring budget in a small studio.  The album, a collection of 11 songs, 10 of which were written by myself, made a splash around the Texas Music Scene, earning a coveted spot on RadioFreeTexas.org for Album of the Month in September, 2012; a spot only earned by one other female in the history of Radio Free Texas.  These songs also got me a nomination in 2013 for "Best New Female Vocalist of the Year" by Big Star 97 Radio in Fort Worth, Texas. 
                        In the last year,  I have faced many changes in my life.  I have experienced heartache, loss, and sadness and in turn, these feelings invoked my inner muse to write.  I have a new collection of songs, some happy, and others sad, but altogether, they reflect a new chapter for my life, and I hope my songs can inspire others to reach for their dreams.  It is here that I need YOUR help.

What We Need & What You Get

WHAT WE NEED -
  • The tracking for the album has been finished.  This means that the studio time, musicians, and mixing have been paid for; but there are still some things that need to be paid for before the album can be released.  
  • Mastering - Mastering is putting the "topcoat" on the mixed album.  It is the last step in the production process, and costs an estimated $1,000.
  • Replication - This is the copying process for CD's.  To replicate 1,000 hard copies of the album, it is going to cost about $1,800.
  • Radio promotion - This is how we get the music heard!  Radio promotion sends a single from the album out to radio stations across the state, and into the ears of new listeners and fans!  I will also be going out on tour, so you will get to hear and see your donation as it plays out.  A song will go to radio promotion for roughly 12-16 weeks, and this costs about $4,000 per song.  We hope to send TWO songs to radio promotion.
  • Merchandise - I am also hoping to get some new "threads" out to everyone!  One run of shirts costs roughly $500, and I will need both men's and women's sizes. I'll also be ordering koozies, and hats.
  • In the event that my goal is not reached, I will be using your donations to get this bulk of the album finished, copied, and into the hands of all of you - friends and fans.  It means the world to me to have your continued support, and you will get plenty of goodies in return!
WHAT YOU GET - 
If all goes well, and we reach our goal, YOU could pick up:
  • Pre-ordered, autographed album mailed to you before the release date
  • Your name mentioned in the album
  • Merch! Merch! Merch!
  • A Day with ME! And a night at one of my shows!
  • Private House Concert!
  • Be an extra in my music video!

The Impact

If all goes well and we can pull together and fund this album, my songs will get heard across the state of Texas, and hopefully into the ears of publishers in Nashville.  How cool would it be to hear my songs on TV?!:

  • It makes me feel proud to produce something that is going to outlive me.  This album(and every other I make) is my contribution to the world.  This music is for anyone suffering, who wants to feel good about life.  -MP
  • Radio promotion can open doors for my career.  I am so grateful for where I have been, and I am so eager to find out what's in store for me and my music next.
  • Being a woman, I do face some challenges. Some people still like to think of the music industry as a "man's world," but I, for one, don't see a difference in where true artistry comes from, and would love the opportunity to represent women in the Texas Music scene. 

Risks & Challenges:

Just like any business, I do have certain obstacles that could keep me from reaching my goal.  Many of these hurdles will depend on getting the music heard on radio.  There's a chance that my songs may not break the top 100 on the Texas Music Charts.  

  • I will be putting your money to the best use.  I have devised a budget and I have estimates that go with my budget.  I have a great team that will be helping me along the way; a team I can trust with anything.  I will also have YOU on my team.
  • In order to break the top 100 on the charts, we will need YOU to call in and REQUEST our song!  Spreading the word via social networking will help us reach this goal! It is a very sustainable one!
  • Touring will also help spread the word.  I will be playing some AMAZING venues this year and sharing the stage with some other talented artists!  I will be plugging my song at shows and on radio tour!  With your help, we will all reach the stars!

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand that sometimes, you just can't fit anything extra into your budget.  If this is the case, you can STILL do a lot to help out!:

  • Spread the word to your friends via Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram! Tell your family, your neighbors, and your co-workers! Let them listen to a song and ask them if they would like more information on how to donate.
  • Share via IndieGoGo!
  • Come to a live show!  I always love meeting new people and hearing your story.

I am so unbelievably blessed to have such a solid support group.  I love each and every one of you to the moon and back!  -MP
story_txt:
Who We Are & What We're Doing Hi Everyone!                           My name is Mandi Powell and I am a Singer/Songwriter from Houston, Texas.  Five years ago, I picked up my first guitar, and I haven't looked back since.  In 2012, I recorded my first album on a shoestring budget in a small studio.  The album, a collection of 11 songs, 10 of which were written by myself, made a splash around the Texas Music Scene, earning a coveted spot on RadioFreeTexas.org for Album of the Month in September, 2012; a spot only earned by one other female in the history of Radio Free Texas.  These songs also got me a nomination in 2013 for "Best New Female Vocalist of the Year" by Big Star 97 Radio in Fort Worth, Texas.                          In the last year,  I have faced many changes in my life.  I have experienced heartache, loss, and sadness and in turn, these feelings invoked my inner muse to write.  I have a new collection of songs, some happy, and others sad, but altogether, they reflect a new chapter for my life, and I hope my songs can inspire others to reach for their dreams.  It is here that I need YOUR help. Merchandise - I am also hoping to get some new "threads" out to everyone!  One run of shirts costs roughly $500, and I will need both men's and women's sizes. I'll also be ordering koozies, and hats. In the event that my goal is not reached, I will be using your donations to get this bulk of the album finished, copied, and into the hands of all of you - friends and fans.  It means the world to me to have your continued support, and you will get plenty of goodies in return!

Pre-ordered, autographed album mailed to you before the release date
Your name mentioned in the album
Merch! Merch! Merch!
A Day with ME! And a night at one of my shows!
Private House Concert!
Be an extra in my music video!

Some people still like to think of the music industry as a "man's world," but I, for one, don't see a difference in where true artistry comes from, and would love the opportunity to represent women in the Texas Music scene.     Risks & Challenges: Just like any business, I do have certain obstacles that could keep me from reaching my goal.  Many of these hurdles will depend on getting the music heard on radio.  There's a chance that my songs may not break the top 100 on the Texas Music Charts.    I will be putting your money to the best use.  I have devised a budget and I have estimates that go with my budget.  I have a great team that will be helping me along the way; a team I can trust with anything.  I will also have YOU on my team. In order to break the top 100 on the charts, we will need YOU to call in and REQUEST our song!  Spreading the word via social networking will help us reach this goal! It is a very sustainable one!
Touring will also help spread the word.  I will be playing some AMAZING venues this year and sharing the stage with some other talented artists!  I will be plugging my song at shows and on radio tour!  With your help, we will all reach the stars!    Other Ways You Can Help I totally understand that sometimes, you just can't fit anything extra into your budget.  If this is the case, you can STILL do a lot to help out!:  Spread the word to your friends via Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram! Tell your family, your neighbors, and your co-workers! Let them listen to a song and ask them if they would like more information on how to donate. Share via IndieGoGo!

story:
I am not sure how this compares to most of the campaigns launched here that are related to music, but I am not looking for funding for an individual project but, rather, the support of a few new releases courtesy of my two small labels, Fourth Dimension Records and Lumberton Trading Company.

Both of my labels have existed for quite a number of years now, with FD actually having started in 1983 and LTCo commencing as a collaborative one with a friend in 2005 (the friend left it two years later, though, hence my presently operating two labels on my own). They have always remained dedicated to reflecting some of my own tastes in music, which initially stemmed from post-punk/industrial/electronic/etc. areas and subsequently spiralled into those of an often more esoteric nature (tho' I'd contend I continue to remain motivated by those original sparks regardless).
I have also always remained dedicated to physical format releases and prefer to leave the artists I've worked with to their own devices if they want to make their releases available to download digitally. Perhaps this would change if I had more time to think about such matters but, ultimately (and at much risk of criticism), I prefer to keep to what I already know. This being releasing vinyl or CDs by a wide range of contemporary (yet unknown/obscure, or having arrived from such fringes) artists/groups whose work I only want to make available via a release that might also look and feel as good as it sounds.  I have never been interested in profit or running the labels to do anything other than what was originally intended. As such, I've always operated them from my own pocket and ended up in a huge mess as a result on more than one occasion. All the same, I've struggled on and feel, very strongly, that I am supporting the work of truly interesting artists, music by friends whose own work couldn't be anything less than thus by definition, and music that continues to enthrall, traverse new places and actually has something to convey.
However, as you know, times have changed in recent years. Music is often (illegally) free and accessible, plus fewer people than ever seem to actually care about what's behind it, never mind factors such as this art form slowly having the life sucked out of it and its being usurped by bland and idiotic charlatans masquerading as saviours for it as they punch out ideas that even sounded hackneyed by the early 1990s. Fewer and fewer people truly cherish music and many of those that do who support it directly can now likewise be found crouched behind labels so tiny that they only survive on passion, dedication and a determinism only blinded by the sweat, blood and tears shed accordingly.
I operate two such labels and now, having whittled away at whatever was left in my pockets down to the lint and cursory ancient toffee  snagged in a corner, am facing either giving up on my labels or turning to those who equally care about such matters to support them. My dignity in doing this has been long lost. It's about the music and, in turn, supporting someone who at least has some good ideas concerning what to do with it.
The music is why I'm here and I hope you'll now read on to digest my proposal(s).
I am wanting to raise money to release new records by Cindytalk, Martin Kuchen, Sion Orgon, Extnndntwrk, Nick Mott, my own group Theme, a magazine/record package and all manner of others even a small donation might help to realise. These artists can all be found residing on Bandcamp, YouTube and suchlike. They are all remarkably different to each other yet furrow sonic spaces only from their own hearts. These spaces themselves are a melting pot of electronic music, fractured beats, improvisation, Lovecraftian atmospherics, avant-garde sensibilities, signatures simultaneously melodic and uncomfortable, broken bridges, psychedelia, 'outsider' attitude and far more than my own words will ever serve any justice to.
I also harbour a dream to expand into book publishing, as I am additionally presently working on one dedicated to the group Ramleh and prefer to have direct control over anything I turn my hand to (rather than approach another publisher). In the past, I have released records by Circle, Filler, Splintered, Michael Gira, Richard Youngs, Glass Out, KK Null, Stefan Jaworzyn, Andrew Liles, Shifts, Tabata, Sleaford Mods, Brian Conniffe, Mahler Haze, Merzbow, Experimental Audio Research and countless others. I also used to publish Grim Humour fanzine during the 1980s in the UK, plus since relocating to Poland in 2005 have co-organised two small festivals here and organised concerts by Tabata Mitsuru, Theme with Jean-herve Peron & Zsolt Sores, Whitehouse, Hannis Brown, Cut Hands, Andrew Liles and others. 
Anyway, you can find information about some of these activities on my websites: 
www.fourth-dimension.net
www.lumberton-trading.net
www.adverseeffectmagazine.com
Even a small donation will help my labels to continue, whilst larger donations will be rewarded according to the breakdown highlighted in the Perks section. I hope you can help. I should also note that the Perks act as a guideline to what you can get in return for a donation. I'm flexible and, ultimately, want to give whatever I can back to those who donate, according to the size of their donation.
The target figure I am aiming for will help with at least three of the planned new releases. The money will go towards production costs, promotion and extras I wish to include in this campaign, such as a limited edition lathe-cut 10" by Nick Mott and a t-shirt. I'm sure I'll add something else, too.
Thanks for reading this.

Richo

story:
Hello,

*Update: I finished the song! I still need the cost of materials and promotion as well as shipping costs for everything. I need $87.87 to make the cd's, about $25 for the business cards and stickers. As well, I would like to raise about $30 for all the shipping involved and $115 for youtube, radio promotion and itunes distribution. I get all funds raised and this will go on schedule, but the help is necessary if I am going to make the most of this opportunity. Please share if you can't help financially. Listen to my finished song HERE!

I am Cody Farlow a Christian singer/songwriter. I have been given an exciting opportunity in which I may be able to join an amazing Christian tour. Through this great opportunity I have also gotten the chance to send my music and materials for consideration by big music companies and executives. For those of you who don't know, this is an unique and fantastic chance to make my dreams come true. I'll tell you my dream is to be a Christian singer, and create songs that will inspire the entire world. I hope to be a driving force in the ministry of Christian music. I need some money to revamp my song. It is pretty low budget so I am going to do somewhat of an overhaul. I also need to get cds and other materials to send to the event. $500 is far from unreasonable, and a little help can go a long way.

I need the money specifically for music production and the finishing touches which is around $200, as well as the materials for the projects which will be around $300. It would surprise you how much it costs to get cds professionally duplicated. I want to also tell you I am a go getter, and I will get it done. Right now I am a full-time student majoring in mathematics. I have a 3.7 gpa, and am in the honors program with a 4.0 in the last two semesters. In the last few years I went through a horrible depression that never seemed to end. After time I picked myself up and became better then ever.  I will try and do an update with audio of my best take I can't wait to hear what you guys have to say. If you cannot help financially please share on social media, you don't know how much that would mean to me. Thank you for hearing me out and please help me take a step further to completing my dreams.

story:
English version of the campaign video:



Je suis prêt à enregistrer mon premier album complet (10 chansons) avec l'aide d'un réalisateur de renom et d'un super groupe: Johan Strohmeier-guitare solo, David Tavares-basse and Richard Tavares-batterie. Cet album, c'est 2 ans de compositions, d'écriture et d'écoute de musique (Elliott Smith, Nick Drake, Wilco, Bob Dylan, Neil Young pour ne nommer que ceux-là). Je suis arrivé à maturité, avec des chansons qui méritent d’être enregistrées à leur juste valeur.

Je pense avoir le potentiel d’aller plus loin, d’aller chercher un public beaucoup plus large et connaître un succès. La qualité de l’enregistrement fait toute la différence pour un projet musical qui désire attirer les regards et atteindre un autre niveau.
 Pour promouvoir un single de l'album, je voudrais filmer un vidéoclip avec l'aide

d'ACRO STUDIO:  http://www.acrostudio.ca/


J'ai prévu un budget de: 10 000$

6000$: pour la production, le mixage, le mastering du CD

1000$ : graphisme et la duplication du CD

1000$:  la promotion d'un single à la radio 

2000$ :  le vidéoclip et des photos


Présentement, j'ai en banque 2000$ et je l’investis en totalité puisque je crois vraiment à mon potentiel musical. Je suis conscient que 8000$ est une énorme somme d'argent et je suis très reconnaissant à l'idée même d'atteindre cet objectif. 

J'estime que mon album sera terminé au printemps 2016. Il y a toujours une possibilité de retard pouvant survenir tout au long du processus d'enregistrement, mais aucun ne compromettra sérieusement mon objectif de création d’album.

Pour entendre 2 chansons qui feront partie de l'album:
www.florentsivell.com

Merci beaucoup de visiter ma page et de contribuer à mon projet! 
Florent Sivell


I am ready to record my first full-Lenghth album (10 songs) with the help of a renowned producer and a great band: Johan Strohmeier-lead guitar, David Tavares-bass and Richard Tavares-drums. It  has been a 2 year musical adventure of composition, writing and listening to alot of different music (Elliott Smith, Nick Drake, Wilco, Bob Dylan, Neil Young and many others) to create music according to my vision, so as to realize an artistic expression with real integrity. I am confident that my music could reach a wider audience. To promote a single from the album I want to make a music video with the help of ACRO STUDIO:  http://www.acrostudio.ca/

I need your help to finance a professional album because high-quality recording is critical for any music project with aspirations to stand out, to arouse interest from the industry, and to secure air-play.

To achieve this I need a total of 10,000 $
6000$: the costs of the recording,  mixing, mastering
1000$: graphic design and CD duplification 
1000$:  some radio play to promote a single
2000$: for  the music video and photos

I currently have amassed $2000 to invest in this project. I am aware that an additional $8000 is a large sum of money and I would be very grateful for assistance in reaching the full amount. 

I expect that the album will be completed in the spring of 2016. There is always the possibility of a delay during any recording process, but nothing will stop me from delivering the album.

To hear 2 songs that will feature on the album:

www.florentsivell.com

Thanks for visiting my page and contributing to my project!

Florent Sivell

I currently have amassed $2000 to invest in this
project. I am aware that an additional $8000 is a large sum of money and I
would be very grateful for assistance in reaching the full amount. I expect that the album will be completed in the spring of 2016. There is always the possibility of a delay during any recording process, but nothing will stop me from delivering the album.
To hear 2 songs that will feature on the album:
www.florentsivell.com
Thanks for visiting my page and contributing to my
project!
Florent Sivell

story:
Project

Hi! My name is Lorenzo Scoppoletti, I'm a musician and a photographer and I would like to draw your attention to my project: Bicycle Metronome.

A journey that will cover about 5500 km from Italy to iceland, throught Austria, Germany, Denmark, Belgium, Holland, France, Luxembourg and Switzerland, in wich i'm going to record a music album with the help of a digital recorder and other instruments so as to product a sort of sound reportage of the places I will see, Mainly based on the use of samples of ambiental “noises”.

The means I choose will be my father's old bicycle that has already supported and carried me.

I do it because I firmly belive that nobody can do anyting good without moving to other places, so I need to depart and be inspired by what i will find.

Share everywhere Bicycle Metronome; on Facebook, Twitter and in your blogs! Share with who loves travelling but even with ho wants to see what a new scenery could offer.

The aim is to share with you my passion for “unexpected” music, the one that is located in every urban and not urban element .


Why Crowdfunding?

Because it allows me to quickly reach lot of people communicating on different levels, because it can reach you throught many social network and it helps me to show you my intent: give you and unusual journey, so you can see and hear different realities blended into a big collection of images and sounds!


The Indiegogo Campain

The goal of this campaign is to reach an approximate amount, extimated between commuting costs, perks and taxes, wich will allow me to survive during this journey and to produce this album that will be the result of my experience but also the symbol of a personal victory; realizing it will be a test for me and all of you!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

L’obiettivo di questa campagna è riuscire a ricoprire una cifra approssimativa, stimata tra costi degli spostamenti, perks e tasse, che mi consenta di sopravvivere durante il viaggio e di produrre questo album finale che sarà il risultato della mia esperienza ma anche il simbolo di una vittoria personale; realizzandolo mi metterò alla prova e voi con me!


About me

Lorenzo is a musician, a photographer and an artist, born in Rome in 1990 but settled in Umbria from few years, where he works and he dedicated almost entirely to the study of music and sound.

He gets graduated in the high school of art in Orvieto and recently he has produced photographic reports for catalogs and Music Festivals (Terni in Jazz, Jazz Festival in Roccella Jonica) and he collaborated to the cultural event “Tram Jazz” organized by Rome's Town Hall.

His passion for music brings him studiyng several instruments: sax, clarinet, guitar, drums and recently the ukulele (wich will attend him in this project).


Il Progetto

Ciao! Il mio nome è Lorenzo Scoppoletti, sono un musicista e un fotografo e vorrei portare alla vostra attenzione il mio progetto: Bicycle Metronome.

Un viaggio che coprirà circa 5500 km dal Nord Italia all’Islanda, passando per Austria, Germania, Danimarca, Belgio, Olanda, Francia, Lussemburgo e Svizzera, in cui intendo registrare un album con l’aiuto di un registratore digitale portatile e altri strumenti in modo da produrre una sorta di reportage sonoro dei luoghi visti e percepiti che si baserà principalmente sull’utilizzo di campionamenti di “rumori” ambientali.

Il mezzo che ho scelto sarà la vecchia bicicletta di mio padre che più di una volta mi ha sostenuto e trasportato.

Lo faccio perché credo fermamente nell’idea che non si possa fare qualcosa di buono se si resta sempre nello stesso posto, quindi sento il bisogno di partire e lasciarmi ispirare da ciò che incontrerò, a livello musicale e fotografico.

Condividete ovunque Bicycle Metronome; su Facebook, Twitter, sui vostri blog! Segnalatelo a chi ama viaggiare ma anche a chi ha voglia di vedere cosa può offrire un nuovo paesaggio.

L'intento è condividere con voi la mia passione per la musica inaspettata, quella che si trova in ogni elemento urbano e non.


Perchè crowdfunding

Il crowdfunding perché mi permette di raggiungere in poco tempo tante persone comunicando su diversi livelli, perché riesce a raggiungervi tramite social differenti e mi aiuta a presentare al meglio il mio intento: regalarvi un viaggio inusuale, farvi vedere e ascoltare realtà distanti fuse in una grande raccolta di immagini e suoni!



Chi è Lorenzo

Lorenzo è un musicista, fotografo e artista nato a Roma nel 1990 ma stabile ormai da qualche anno in Umbria,dove lavora e si dedica alla musica e  alla ricerca del suono.

È diplomato al Liceo d’Arte di Orvieto in grafica e progettazione e negli ultimi anni ha realizzato reportage fotografici per cataloghi e Festival musicali ( Terni in Jazz, Jazz Festival a Roccella Jonica) e ha collaborato all’evento culturale organizzato dal Comune di Roma “Tram Jazz”.

La sua passione per la musica lo porta a contatto con diversi strumenti: sax, clarinetto, chitarra, batteria e da poco l’ukulele (che lo accompagnerà in questo progetto).



Supporter

Supporter

story:
Short Summary

We're headed back into the recording studio to finish what we started 30 years ago, but we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Long story short, we're trying to do something we were never able to do as teenagers back in the 80's, release an album, go platinum, and make some t-shirts...

YOU can play an integral part in helping us bring this project back to life, and we're going to make it worth your while with some great incentives. If you've ever wanted to be part of the music industry, or play a part in bringing something creative to life, now's your chance! For a small investment YOU can help us make this happen!

Our Master tapes are so old that they need to go thru a restoration process before they can be digitized for todays delivery standards. Once they are restored they will be remixed, mastered, and become "Side A" of our new CD. "Side B" will be new recordings of mostly cover songs from bands that were heavy influences on us, like Metallica, Queensryche, Anthrax, & Dio. The end result will be a shiny new full length CD that will be released in July 2015. 

We are grateful for your help, and we thank you in advance for helping us finish what we started 30 years ago!

The Impact

With your help we will be able to restore our ancient master tapes, have them digitized, remixed & have them digitally remastered. We will record, mix, & master 5-6 new songs, create artwork for the CD & press a limited quantity. We will also print t-shirts, and other various swag, and finally be able to release our music to the world in proper fashion. If you were ever a fan of the band, or 80's metal in general, you will not be disappointed. And if you play your cards right, you can join us for the 30 year reunion in July and party with us like it's 1985...


Thank You For Your Help, You're totally awesome, and We Love You!!!

story:
Who and Why

 Thank you for taking the time to consider donating to our fundraiser. If you've never heard of us, fret not. You are not alone. With your help, we plan to change that. Our band, Veseria, has been winning over audiences in our hometown, Indianapolis, Indiana, for nearly five years and are now poised for rapid expansion into the rest of the U.S. market.
In our time together, we have learned that anything is possible with the support of our community. Our fans have been so very generous to us with their contributions - both financial and emotional - but we need your help one more time to take this next big step in our evolution.
This fundraising effort will coincide with our band's five year anniversary. In celebration of the best years of our lives (so far), we will be releasing a new concert documentary and EP.

What We Need & What You Get

 Touring has been a struggle for us. We all have families, day jobs and people that rely on us financially to support them. Without a reliable traveling vehicle, we have had to rely on rental vehicles to get us out of town. These up-front expenses eat into our performance fees and merch sales, making it difficult to break even and nearly impossible to make a profit on these trips.
Your donation will help to cover the remaining cost of a van for touring purposes, on-the-road expenses and will help alleviate the financial burden these trips have on our families.
In thanks, we have set up a series of "thank you" gifts that we feel will sincerely show our profound appreciation for your support. From private performances, to limited edition merchandise, to corporate sponsorship options, we have carefully selected packages at every price range to meet you where you are.

Why Us?

 We are  passionate about our music. Right now you're thinking "Well, duh..." But when we say that, we mean we put our hearts and souls, time and energy, money, and all of our strengths into the success of this project. While your contribution will jumpstart this endeavor, we assure you, it will be our hard work and drive that will prove your donations were not made in vain.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know, better than most, that financial contributions are not always possible. With your help, we can spread the message even further. Share our music, share links to this project, just please share with everyone you know! Every like, retweet, thumbs up, heart, pin or other forms of social media approval helps. Thank you so much for your help!

story:
Every journey has a beginning and mine is starting with Indiegogo.  I know what my dream is and I have a clear path on how to achieve it!! It has always been to be a singer/songwriter,  I want to be able to hear my songs on the radio and sing my songs to the world, but it will not get there without your help.  Songs are only words on a page till you can hear the heart and soul of the lyrics and beat put to music.  The only way to bring those together is by recording and producing the music.....That is where you come in!!! I have the beat and the lyrics,  Now I just need the funds to make them all come together!

Over the past 3 years I have traveled 2 and from Nashville writing with top HIT song writers and working with top producers to come up with the best 5 songs possible. I am pleased to tell you WE HAVE DONE IT! We have compiled a list of songs that best showcases me as and artist and songwriter! I cannot wait for you all to hear these amazing songs.

I've opened as the lead singer of the Country cover band Bella Cain for some of the biggest acts in country music: Dierks Bentley, Big & RIch, Eric Church, Kip Moore Phil Vasser, and Oak Ridge Boys.   I've played other peoples' songs at some of the biggest venues like Country Thunder, Country USA, Navy Pier, Summerfest, and I've played in Nashville at local hot spots like Blue Bird Cafe, Commodore, and Tootsie's.  

Now I am ready for my songs to take the main stage.  Stand with me at  and lets make music History! 

#BeHappy. 

With Love, 

Brecken :)

www.breckenmilesmusic.com 

Any funds that exceed the Goal of $15,000 will go towards new merchandise, website face-lift and MORE RECORDINGS!! (I have more songs I can't wait for you all to hear!)

story:
Hello, my name is Camilo Toledo. I was born and raised in Antigua Guatemala, Central America. Ever since I was a kid I liked playing musical instruments and when I turned 15, I was already playing in working professional bands. After High School I studied music at the National Conservatory of Music in Guatemala City and later when I moved to the US, I studied music composition at UCLA.  Recently, I completed a certification in music production at UMBC.

I have lived in the area of Washington DC for the last 25 years, and have played and met many talented hispanic musicians that unfortunately do not get the opportunity to record their music and they loose the chance to be heard and get better jobs.

With your generous donations, I will be able to make this possible and do what I do best, music production. My project is to record 12 all original songs for a compilation CD using 4 or 6 of the most talented hispanic bands in the area, and record 2 songs which would be a collaboration from everybody. 

Your donation and contribution to this project will let us pay for arrangements, rentals, recording time, mixing and mastering studio time, and any other cost related to releasing the songs online and pressing 1000 CD's.   

Your donation and contribution will help these bands have a professional recording of their songs but also, you will be contributing to provide assistance to undeserved people in Central America.  We plan to donate 400 CD's (or the proceedings) to a non-profit organization based in Arlington VA, that helps very poor people in El Salvador. 

Your donation and contribution will be very welcome by two causes, musicians in the area, and people in need in el Salvador.

Please let me make this possible, and thank you for all your support.

story:
Salut!

On est Eliza, un groupe de rock progressif établit à Montréal depuis une couple d'année. Notre premier Ep officiel, A Quit Smoking Soundtrack est paru il y a quelques mois, en octobre 2014. Maintenant, on s'apprête à enregistrer notre premier album longue durée (titre à venir)! On est prêt, les chansons sont prêtes, nos corps sont prêts! Mais...

On est pauvre.

Et c'est là que vous pouvez nous aider! On lance notre (première) campagne de financement sur Indiegogo pour que les fans d'Eliza (ça c'est vous) puissent nous aider à réaliser ce grand projet et garder le rock & roll en vie! Après de longs calculs complexes dignes de nos mathématiques du secondaire, nous avons calculé que le montant à atteindre pour produire l'album est de 4,000$ (soit 1,000$ par 'ti bum).
Évidemment, nous savons qu'on ne peut pas tout simplement vous demander 4,000 piastres sans vous offrir quelque chose en échange. C'est pourquoi nous avons monté un magnifique système de récompense avec des prix à la grandeur de votre générosité. Plus vous donnez, plus vous recevez! La liste des prix va comme suit :

5$ : UNE SURPRISE!!! Attendez-vous à un petit quelque chose absolument incroyable à la fin de la campagne de financement.

15$ : L'ALBUM COMPLET UNE SEMAINE AVANT LE LANCEMENT! Recevez par la poste une copie physique de notre premier album longue durée avant tout le monde (la date de sortie de l’album n'étant pas encore défini, il est impossible de dire quand ce prix sera reçu).

40$: CAMISOLE À L'EFFIGIE D'ELIZA! À la fin de la campagne de financement, une camisole réservée en votre nom va vous attendre à notre prochain spectacle. (On peut aussi vous l'envoyer par la poste si vous ne voulez pas venir au spectacle parce que vous n'aimez pas notre musique, mais le tout serait un peu paradoxal.)

75$ : PASSE V.I.P. À TOUS LES SPECTACLES D'ELIZA PENDANT UN AN! À l'exception possible d'une grosse production non organisé par Eliza, venez gratuitement à tous les spectacles du groupe pendant un an, à partir de la fin de la campagne de financement.

150$ : SPECTACLE ACOUSTIQUE PRIVÉ! Appréciez un répertoire adoucis et acoustique du groupe dans le confort de votre chez vous (nous prendrons contact avec vous pour déterminer la date du dit spectacle).


Gardez en tête que les prix sont CUMULATIFS, c'est-à-dire que si vous donnez un grand montant, vous recevrez aussi les prix des montants plus petits. PLUS TU DONNES, PLUS TU REÇOIS.

EX : Vous donnez 75$. Vous recevrez la passe V.I.P. ET la camisole ET l'album complet avant le lancement ET la surprise!!!

Il est très important que vous donniez votre contributions en commandeant une des contreparties, situé du côté droit de la page. SI vous contribuez à la campagne avec les gros bouton rose écrit CONTRIBUEZ MAINTENANT, alors bien aimable à vous mais nous ne saurons pas quel prix vous visiez à avoir.


Bon, là vous êtes en train de vous dire « C'est bien beau tout ça mais 4,000$ c'est de l'argent en titi. Elle va aller où? » Eh bien une majeure partie de cette argent va nous servir à payer l'enregistrement de l'album au mythique studio qu'est La Petite Église de Farnham. Il s'agit de l'église que le fameux groupe Arcade Fire a transformé en studio d'enregistrement en 2006 pour y produire deux de leurs albums, soit Neon Bible et The Suburbs. Ils ont ensuite vendu le studio à un investisseur et depuis, plusieurs autre groupes iconiques y ont enregistré leurs projets, comme Timber Timbre et Beirut. Si l'objectif est atteint, nous pourrons aussi payer les autres frais reliés à la production de l'album, soit le « mixing », le « mastering » et peut être même l'impression des CD.

La campagne va se clore le 5 mai, avec un super gros spectacle à la Casa del Popolo. Ce qui veut dire qu'on a un peu plus d'un mois pour ramasser l'argent, imprimer vos belles camisoles (parce que vous allez tous en vouloir une), et monter le show le plus trippant que vous aurez vu cette année! Sur ce, donnez généreusement, et on se voit au prochain spectacle!

Eliza vous aime.




Crédit Photo : Jean-Philippe Sansfaçon
story_txt: Salut!On est Eliza, un groupe de rock progressif établit à Montréal depuis une couple d'année. Notre premier Ep officiel, A Quit Smoking Soundtrack est paru il y a quelques mois, en octobre 2014. Maintenant, on s'apprête à enregistrer notre premier album longue durée (titre à venir)! On est prêt, les chansons sont prêtes, nos corps sont prêts! Mais...On est pauvre.Et c'est là que vous pouvez nous aider! On lance notre (première) campagne de financement sur Indiegogo pour que les fans d'Eliza (ça c'est vous) puissent nous aider à réaliser ce grand projet et garder le rock & roll en vie! Après de longs calculs complexes dignes de nos mathématiques du secondaire, nous avons calculé que le montant à atteindre pour produire l'album est de 4,000$ (soit 1,000$ par 'ti bum).Évidemment, nous savons qu'on ne peut pas tout simplement vous demander 4,000 piastres sans vous offrir quelque chose en échange. C'est pourquoi nous avons monté un magnifique système de récompense avec des prix à la grandeur de votre générosité. Plus vous donnez, plus vous recevez! La liste des prix va comme suit :5$ : UNE SURPRISE!!! Attendez-vous à un petit quelque chose absolument incroyable à la fin de la campagne de financement.15$ : L'ALBUM COMPLET UNE SEMAINE AVANT LE LANCEMENT! Recevez par la poste une copie physique de notre premier album longue durée avant tout le monde (la date de sortie de l’album n'étant pas encore défini, il est impossible de dire quand ce prix sera reçu).40$: CAMISOLE À L'EFFIGIE D'ELIZA! À la fin de la campagne de financement, une camisole réservée en votre nom va vous attendre à notre prochain spectacle. (On peut aussi vous l'envoyer par la poste si vous ne voulez pas venir au spectacle parce que vous n'aimez pas notre musique, mais le tout serait un peu paradoxal.)75$ : PASSE V.I.P. À TOUS LES SPECTACLES D'ELIZA PENDANT UN AN! À l'exception possible d'une grosse production non organisé par Eliza, venez gratuitement à tous les spectacles du groupe pendant un an, à partir de la fin de la campagne de financement.150$ : SPECTACLE ACOUSTIQUE PRIVÉ! Appréciez un répertoire adoucis et acoustique du groupe dans le confort de votre chez vous (nous prendrons contact avec vous pour déterminer la date du dit spectacle).Gardez en tête que les prix sont CUMULATIFS, c'est-à-dire que si vous donnez un grand montant, vous recevrez aussi les prix des montants plus petits. PLUS TU DONNES, PLUS TU REÇOIS.EX : Vous donnez 75$. Vous recevrez la passe V.I.P. ET la camisole ET l'album complet avant le lancement ET la surprise!!!Il est très important que vous donniez votre contributions en commandeant une des contreparties, situé du côté droit de la page. SI vous contribuez à la campagne avec les gros bouton rose écrit CONTRIBUEZ MAINTENANT, alors bien aimable à vous mais nous ne saurons pas quel prix vous visiez à avoir.Bon, là vous êtes en train de vous dire « C'est bien beau tout ça mais 4,000$ c'est de l'argent en titi. Elle va aller où? » Eh bien une majeure partie de cette argent va nous servir à payer l'enregistrement de l'album au mythique studio qu'est La Petite Église de Farnham. Il s'agit de l'église que le fameux groupe Arcade Fire a transformé en studio d'enregistrement en 2006 pour y produire deux de leurs albums, soit Neon Bible et The Suburbs. Ils ont ensuite vendu le studio à un investisseur et depuis, plusieurs autre groupes iconiques y ont enregistré leurs projets, comme Timber Timbre et Beirut. Si l'objectif est atteint, nous pourrons aussi payer les autres frais reliés à la production de l'album, soit le « mixing », le « mastering » et peut être même l'impression des CD.La campagne va se clore le 5 mai, avec un super gros spectacle à la Casa del Popolo. Ce qui veut dire qu'on a un peu plus d'un mois pour ramasser l'argent, imprimer vos belles camisoles (parce que vous allez tous en vouloir une), et monter le show le plus trippant que vous aurez vu cette année! Sur ce, donnez généreusement, et on se voit au prochain spectacle!Eliza vous aime.Crédit Photo : Jean-Philippe Sansfaçon

story:
Short Summary

NEMPAC awards over $5,000 each year in children's need-based music scholarships. Each year, these scholarships provide an opportunity for over twenty children to participate in private lessons, after-school music classes, or experience week-long intensive music camps during the summer! The scholarships are a reduction in tuition for any student or family who qualifies for need.

This year - we are celebrating this exciting campaign by hosting a special "NEMPAC Scholarship Event Event" on Saturday, April 11th at the St. Stephen's Church in the North End. The event will include a Student Perform-a-thon from 11:00 a.m. to Noon, and a Faculty Benefit Concert from Noon - 1:00 p.m. Our students and faculty will perform their favorite musical numbers for a great cause and will show their support for the NEMPAC Children's Scholarship Fund. And YOU can sponsor their performances!

The experience a child gets from learning music is invaluable. NEMPAC believes that every child deserves music education. We aim to give every child an equal opportunity to experiment, create, and potentially influence our future with a musical experience. Your donation brings music to a child's life - Thank You for your support!

What We Need & What You Get

We Need:

  • To raise $2,500 this year before June 30, 2015. We have been fortunate enough to raise funds last year through our Keys for Kids campaign where over $9,400 was raised by our own students, families, and supporters! A portion of these funds helped provide scholarships this year to students, and we are in need of an additional $2,500 to make up our full budget of $5,000 this FY15.
What You Get:
  • Understanding that a child that might not otherwise have the opportunity to experience music - will now have that opportunity because of your support. 
  • Celebrate with us! NEMPAC Scholarship Benefit Concert, Saturday, April 11, 2015 at St. Stephen's Church in the North End, Boston MA. The event will be fun, will include a reception, and a small craft table for children.
  • Knowing that your gift is sponsoring one of our AWESOME instructors who is dedicating their time and performance for their own students!
  • Making a great example to our community by saying, YES! Arts programming is VITAL to our community and to a child's education!

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference:

  • Arts Education makes a difference in the academic success of a child in school
  • The arts provide an avenue of creativity for youth who are going through a tough developmental point in their lives 
  • Performance gives students a chance to build their self esteem and self confidence, therefore challenging them to set goals and commit to their study. 

Risks & Challenges

As a non-profit arts organization, we face challenges with funding every day. We believe giving to Arts organizations, such as NEMPAC, is a strong investment. Every dollar given to our scholarship fund can truly make a difference and bring music into a families home and a child's life. 

"I began studying private voice lessons in 5th grade. I never had an interested in sports. Since my first voice recital at a community music school in Hartford, CT- music became a very large part of my life. Studying and performing music gave me something to feel confident about, it built my self esteem, and it became my niche - a place where I belonged and felt I could succeed.  And today, I aim to ensure other children get the same opportunity that I once had ." - Sherri Snow, NEMPAC Executive Director.  

Other Ways You Can Help

A larger option: MATCH our online earnings of this campaign! If you'd like to match what NEMPAC can raise for this Scholarship Fundraiser - we would be GRATEFUL!

A smaller option: Help us run an awesome NEMPAC Scholarship Benefit Concert on Saturday, April 11, 2015! We need baked goods, juice, and snacks to help celebrate our fundraising success and appreciation for our student & faculty performers!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Thank you so much for visiting Suzann Christine's campaign. If you're reading this, we will assume you are interested in what she is raising money for and how your donations will be used. 

Make the decision to back Suzann Christine's "Save Me" R&B project and your contribution will allow her to finish recording and release her very first project. A 10 - 12 track R&B album putting Suzann Christine in a position to become a voting member with the Recording Academy.

Stretch goals will allow Suzann Christine to pay for her marketing and promotional materials, go on a small tour, hire a publicist, shoot a professional video and, most importantly, share her success with the people who supported her from the beginning. Imagine this, you will be responsible for elevating Suzann Christine's voice and message to heights that will make her movement undeniable.

The end result of this campaign will be a commercial project built for the Billboard charts, but driven by concepts relatable to the core of America.  Heartfelt lyrics with depth and metaphors combined with power house vocals and emotion will give you chills. Suzann also brings music with catchy phrases and memorable hooks that will be running through your head after the first listen.

Suzann Christine is dedicated to creating a full album experience where you won’t want to skip a single track due to the concepts and stories being threaded together. Plus, you will just plain feel good about yourself and about life. Suzann's music will give you an outlet that can ease the stress of the everyday grind and the ups and downs of love.

In short, what are your donations going towards:

- Production

- Producers

- Studio Time

- Artwork

- Mixing

- Mastering

-Video

-Marketing Team

-Promotions

-Photos

-Tour (out of state shows)

story:
CARRY HER HOME ALBUM + TOUR

Hello There You Beautiful (Potential) Patron of the Arts- 

(And by art, I mean this loosely, of course.) 

All funds raised in these 20 days will be spent on finishing the EP I began in the Redwoods of Northern California, the one that is now being mixed on the Lower East Side of NYC. (God Bless Technology and the believers who continue to work alongside me for trades of beads and smiles.) Also, to update copies of my albums into physical download cards, and my forthcoming memoir into an ebook. Yes San Francisco has taught me to embrace the new wave. 

I see this as a pop up gallery. As a telethon, a pre-sale extravaganza of services and products that I make by hand. I am curating the next five months of my life, (with your help) in order to focus on all the right places. By booking me in any capacity, over the course of these next five months, you will help me curate this structure- one that I have found significant to my mental health. 

In some ways I have been a mystery over the years, to the world and to myself, yet recently the mask has been coming off. San Francisco has been good in this regard, and I hope you agree with this new body of work. I think this is what they mean when they talk about age and art and the freedom that comes with giving far less of a shit... 

Over the last few years, the music industry has shifted into something and I have shifted into something else. For the past year I have survived on humble terms- busking my little heart out on the streets and subways of San Francisco and NYC. Selling prints in tiny galleries and art markets. Teaching the practice of music. And documenting as much as I can, with words and film... 
I have sold out of all physical copies of any and all copies of my albums, and will use these funds to create new download cards. Also to put the finishing touches on the newest baby on the lot- the CARRY HER HOME EP, recorded in the Redwoods of California with Kyle Lesley, an extraordinarily patient producer and guitarist with a Buddhist bent. Being mixed now by Kenevan McConnon in the Lower East Side of NYC...

By pre-purchasing a print, EP, photo shoot, you will be allowing me the ability to continue to create in an independent fashion (and also to get there). So far I have shoots with Maya Love (Salt Lake City),  

Tiare Helberg (Stockholm), 

and Daisy Denby (Hudson Valley). 

On to Berlin to visit the site where my grandmother was raised. Somehow the building was not destroyed and a gold brick was lain to commemorate those who once rested there peacefully before the war began. She passed at 100, still trying to run away from those bastards, and I think its time I see where my story really started.

CARRY HER HOME, the debut track on the little EP I recorded with Kyle Lesley in the redwoods of Northern California, commemorates the life of my Omi.

Looking forward to add you to my calendar along the way... 

Available Dates for PHOTO SHOOTS, HOUSE CONCERTS, MUSIC LESSONS are as follows. 

* SAN FRANCISCO, CA: April 10- April 30

* SALT LAKE CITY, UTAH: May 2-7

* NYC: May 10-May 25

* HUDSON VALLEY, NY: May 25-May 30

* STOCKHOLM/BERLIN/COPENHAGEN: June 1-July 31

* BOSTON, MA: August 1- August 15

* HUDSON VALLEY, NY: August 15-August 31


Your support means the world. Thank you so much.

XO

DB

April 9, 2015

Cafe Revolution, SF 94110

11:26 AM

story:
GOLD QUARTER TOUR

Champaign Native and passionate Emcee KLEVAH has been spreading her sound throughout the last year, drawing a diverse crowd of admirers. KLEVAH has released two full-length projects, GOLDEN & The W8, accompanied by visual work and performance. She has opened up for artists such as XXYYXX, Lil Bibby, Big Sean, Tink and has performed at SXSW, Summer Camp and Pygmalion Music Festivals. Her work can be accessed via klevahninja.bandcamp.com and soundcloud.com/klevah. 


After turning 25 years of age only a few weeks ago, KLEVAH is determined to drive her success forward and has solidified plans to spread her influence beyond the region. This will be an individual journey, however she is supported by a network of musicians, family and friends in each city she is scheduled to travel to. So far she has performances booked in Champaign and Chicago and planned appearances in Denver and St. Louis. She will utilize the next few weeks of downtime to book more shows and polish her presentation. 

This time is critical for her, and must be used wisely. She is not looking to profit from this tour, but to expand herself and take authority over her artistry. Any contributions to these efforts will ensure her security on the road and will boost her likely hood of being recognized nationwide. She is a brave soul and intends to bring more back with her than she left with. Her first scheduled performance is on July 8th, 2015 at SubT Lounge in Chicago, Illinois.


What I'm Asking For

I will need $2500 to cover my expenses through August. It will be broken down between travel, equipment and promotional materials.

  • Travel ($1500) - This will get me back and forth between Chicago and Champaign during the month of July. From Chicago to Denver at the end of the month, and from Denver to St. Louis and LA in August. As well as back home to Champaign-Urbana for Pygmalion in September. I will be traveling in my Dad's Volvo, so aside from gas, this portion of the money will only be used for emergencies.
  • Equipment ($500) - This will allow me to provide my supporters with a constant flow of media & music while on my journey. Although I have some equipment, I will need to purchase a new microphone & mic stand. If I have enough, I will consider purchasing a GoPro camera as well. 
  • Promotional Materials ($500) - This includes posters, stickers, t-shirts, pressed CD's and website expenses. Much of these I have already been designing and selling on my own, but additional funds will allow me to put more into my brand and have quality presentation.

In addition to performance, new music and building a network - I will also use Hip-Hop along my travels to support community organizations fighting for causes I believe in and against oppression. Feel free to connect me to any groups or leaders that you know personally in the states I will be traveling to.

I greatly appreciate your consideration and will be happy to answer any questions or concerns that you may have. Peace

story:
Who is "Les Gars D'en Bas"?

We are a multi-genre, multi-lingual, travelling almost-gypsy band with big dreams. Based partialy in France and partially in the Czech Republic, we often travel to play in both of those countries and elsewhere, across the whole Europe. Our music is acoustic, energic and often surprising, and varies form simple dancing tunes or slow contemplative ballads to frenetic almost-freejazz collective improvisations. Our main influences are french chanson, gypsy swing, and french folk, but also klezmer and other traditional musics of eastern Europe, and sometimes even modern jazz and funk. Double bass, guitar, accordion,  clarinet and soxopohone are our tools and our best friends on the big travel through life and music. With the help of these time-tested acoustic instruments, we try to make something new from the old and beloved. 
What is "Nous partons au matin", and why do we need money for it?

"Nous partons au matin" will be our first publicly released live recording. We recorded it in the February of 2015 in Brittany, France, in "Au Trousse Chemise" a famous local "café concert". The place was crowded that night, and the atmosphere was so warm and welcoming, that it made us give everything we could. This cd is a precious memory of these great moments , and we hope, that listening to it can bring at least a glimpse of all the emotions we and and the audience had that night. But in order to bring it to you, and to sell it on concerts and on the street, we need to make the acctual cd's in the factory, and to pack them nicely. And this is when you all play a crucial role, bacause cd printing and package making is a rather expensive thing. So, if you want this little musical wonder forever conserved on thousands of compact discs, packed nicely, and being spread all around the world, please support us!

What exactly will happen with the money?

We will use it to pay the czech cd printing factory, Fermata a.s., and also the cd cover designers. We will also use some of the money to print some more of our old studio recording. Also we have to count the indiegogo and money transfer fees, as well as the cd and other gift's shipping costs. And If we have any money exceeding the budget, we will use it either to print even more cd's, or we will keep it in the band's fund, to finance the next cd, which might be coming next year. 

Why should you support us?

Because we are independent, original, and talented young artists, trying to survive. And that's one of the parts of our society that really deserves support. What would we do without all these young energic people with visions, that keep on inventing and spreading all those new fragile bits of beauty? Life would be so sad and boring.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money to spare, or you just don't want to help us financially for some reason, you can help us at least by spreading the word about this site and this band. That's a great help too!

Who is "Les Gars D'en Bas"?
We are a multi-genre, multi-lingual, travelling almost-gypsy band with big dreams. Based partialy in France and partially in the Czech Republic, we often travel to play in both of those countries and elsewhere, across the whole Europe. Our music is acoustic, energic and often surprising, and varies form simple dancing tunes or slow contemplative ballads to frenetic almost-freejazz collective improvisations. Our main influences are french chanson, gypsy swing, and french folk, but also klezmer and other traditional musics of eastern Europe, and sometimes even modern jazz and funk. Double bass, guitar, accordion,  clarinet and soxopohone are our tools and our best friends on the big travel through life and music. With the help of these time-tested acoustic instruments, we try to make something new from the old and beloved. 
What is "Nous partons au matin", and why do we need money for it? "Nous partons au matin" will be our first publicly released live recording. We recorded it in the February of 2015 in Brittany, France, in "Au Trousse Chemise" a famous local "café concert". The place was crowded that night, and the atmosphere was so warm and welcoming, that it made us give everything we could. This cd is a precious memory of these great moments , and we hope, that listening to it can bring at least a glimpse of all the emotions we and and the audience had that night. But in order to bring it to you, and to sell it on concerts and on the street, we need to make the acctual cd's in the factory, and to pack them nicely. And this is when you all play a crucial role, bacause cd printing and package making is a rather expensive thing. So, if you want this little musical wonder forever conserved on thousands of compact discs, packed nicely, and being spread all around the world, please support us!   What exactly will happen with the money?
We will use it to pay the czech cd printing factory, Fermata a.s., and also the cd cover designers. We will also use some of the money to print some more of our old studio recording. Also we have to count the indiegogo and money transfer fees, as well as the cd and other gift's shipping costs. And If we have any money exceeding the budget, we will use it either to print even more cd's, or we will keep it in the band's fund, to finance the next cd, which might be coming next year. 
    Why should you support us?
Because we are independent, original, and talented young artists, trying to survive. And that's one of the parts of our society that really deserves support. What would we do without all these young energic people with visions, that keep on inventing and spreading all those new fragile bits of beauty? Life would be so sad and boring.

    Other Ways You Can Help If you don't have any money to spare, or you just don't want to help us financially for some reason, you can help us at least by spreading the word about this site and this band. That's a great help too!

story:
Building our own servers to continue broadcasting live!

Hello all, Helk here! We've been busy continuing to deliver music to all of you 24/7/365, and also attempting to integrate streaming video with it. However, this continues to take it's toll on my wallet.

After having issues with shipping signs for donation, we basically broke even, and the radio costs continue monthly. Since I had a business line set up for our cable connection at home (I work from home a lot), it's now plausible to set up some physical servers, and maintain them locally. However, it's always money.

Anyways, we've received numerous contributions already, and this amount would put us in to a couple new server builds, one for the radio, the other for streaming video.


I appreciate all of the support from all of you, and even if you don't contribute, know you're a valued listener. Take care! - Helk

story:
Fire in the Rainstorm - Marketing and Promotion

    Who am I exactly and WHAT is my story?

    My name is Kori Linae Carothers.  I am a wife, mom AND I am a concert pianist/composer and I live in Southern California.  Ever since I could remember I have always wanted to record, release and perform my music. I compose instrumental, electronic and contemporary solo piano. My music is similar to Bill Evans, Phil Aaberg, Mannheim Steamroller, Bernward Koch to name a few. 

    Story time: 

    When I was young "experts" told my parents and I that I could never be a concert pianist due to severe hearing loss in my left ear. These were people that did not know me and because of this, did not understand my dream to create incredible music!  I didn't listen to these "experts".  Neither did my parents. They knew I was very talented and encouraged my dream by giving me the gift of piano lessons!


    What do I want to do?

    Fast Forward to the present:  In 2009, I met and worked with one of my influences, Grammy Winning Guitarist and Founder of Windham Hill Records:  Will Ackerman.  A mutual friend, thinking I would benefit from meeting Will, introduced us. 

    As Will recounts:

    Photo by Irene Young

    "Kori Linae Carothers and I have been friends and musical collaborators for six years.  Kori’s music has evolved in its complexity and richness over the years, but the strength of her artist voice is powerful and singular enough to unify all of her work as purely her own.  In her latest work “Fire in the Rainstorm” there is a freedom and expansiveness that is the product of an artist who has come utterly into her own with poise and confidence.  I honestly believe this is her finest work yet and that we’re watching the unfolding of a very important player on the contemporary musical scene." 

    Great music has always come to life through the collaboration of muses, patrons, and musicians. You, my internet muses, my internet patrons, have inspired me, supported me, and collectively, we have brought my first solo piano album "Fire in the Rainstorm" into being in 2014. We had producer Will Ackerman along with us at the helm.

    I was not able to release "Fire in the Rainstorm" then because of health issues: I was in pain for most of the year and ended up having surgery.

    Now I am healed and ready to take this album to the world!!

    In coming together to create "Fire in the Rainstorm", we have already proved we are a generous group. I am confident that none of us entered this effort just for ourselves. We have worked together to create this music for everyone to enjoy. To give everyone the opportunity to enjoy what we created, they must first hear it. 

    As you know, marketing even great music does not happen without professional help. I will be working with a fantastic group of individuals that will help promote and market this album worldwide!  I am confident they are the team we need to share "Fire in the Rainstorm" with the world.

    Seems like you have it all set, why do you need an IndieGoGo campaign?

    The funds for recording Fire in the Rainstorm were used towards recording, studio time, producer time, graphics artist(s), and manufacturing. I am an independent musician, which means I am self-funded with the help of my friends. As a result, musicians like me put every cent we make into our next music projects.

    We have the product: additional funds are needed to market and promote the album.  

    I'm asking you to help finish our journey by continuing to be my muses and my patrons. At the end of our journey more people will be enjoying the music we created. Additionally there may be a nomination and win at the 58th Grammy Awards, the industries ultimate recognition for a journey well traveled.

    With your generous help, we will be able to promote and market "Fire in the Rainstorm" to the world!  

    Breakdown of funds: 

    •  $3600 for Marketing and Promotion
    •  $3000 for Western States Tour in 2016
    •  $1000 for videos production
    •  $1000 for t-shirts, posters, and wristbands

    What are the perks being offered and what happens if you fall short of the goal?

    I have some great perks to give for your generosity: 

    • Digital downloads of tracks that are not on the album
    • Past albums "The Road Less Traveled", "The Journey" and "Trillium" - all signed
    • A limited number of Will Ackerman's Grammy winning album: “Returning” - signed by Will
    • Artwork from a very talented friend of mine
    • A Skype concert
    • A Skype call with me
    • Hand made jewelry from a fantastic artisan here in California personally selected by me for you 
    • Handmade baby blankets - from me 
    • High Resolution Photo of Haleakala Crater from my friend Sarah
    • Two very special pieces of clothing from my cousin who works in fashion design  (I want them... but you can have them! )
    • A high res photos of me signed
    • House concerts at your home with your family and friends 
    • Lunch with me with a group of your friends

    Unlike other crowdsourcing campaigns, if we fall short of our goal, not to worry: the funds we DO raise will go to Broadcast and Radio promotion and you still get the perks listed! 

    Awesome new music!  Tell me more!  

    Fire in the Rainstorm is a collection of stories told by solo piano. I wrote this album between 2010 -2013. It is about my challenges and those of my friends. I even wrote a song for my sweet puppy Marvin. We rescued him... however, as time has gone by, I feel that he rescued us.   

    Music is the international language and each of these songs are filled with hope, love, and inspiration for all of you.  We are not alone and this album expresses this!

    What are your challenges and why would you risk doing something like this?

    I am inviting you to be a part of something very special.  I have overcome very huge odds to get to this point: people telling me I cannot do this, hearing loss, and a vocal disorder that can potentially take away my ability to talk.  I know we can come together and do this! There are always pot holes in this road we call life: still, I have taken this road less traveled and I am better for it!

    I can't help contribute.. but can I help in other ways?

    No problem, I have been there myself!  Here is what you CAN do:

    • Share this campaign with your friends and family, make some noise about it!
    • Remember IndieGoGo makes it very easy to tell your social network what we are doing!

story:
This January I signed a publishing deal with Song Placement International. I set the goal to submit to them four songs this year. I have already submitted one I self-funded, but due to a spark of inspiration I have three I want to complete. :

  • I have been playing music professionally for five years now. This is the first step I've had into the actual industry with the publishing deal so I want to make the most impact with it as possible.
  • By helping me achieve this funding goal, you will help expedite the recording process and start the process of the songs being pitched for placement in TV and Film. Ultimately, your help will offset some of my out of pocket expenses, which I'm happy to incur, just not in large sums :) 

What I need and Why I need it

To break down how this money is to be used, here are the details:

  • $1380 = $225 per studio musician x2 (A steal in Nashville for A-listers) $750 for the producer (fraction of a penny in Nashville) $180 for Neve preamps to record drums (likely means nothing to most but want to be transparent).
  • If I do not reach my entire goal I will be responsible for the remainder.

The Impact

By helping, you are not just donating money to an aspiring musician, you're investing in the belief in my talents and dreams. I have never been so close with such good material to being able to make music my career as I am now. This is just another step, but finally we're walking rather than crawling. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but wish to still help, please spread the word! You can use the Indiegogo share tools, as well as copy/paste the URL to all your social media! 

Track Listing (Working Titles):

  • Whirlpool
  • Wanna Believe
  • Home

I love you guys and thank you in advance for everything!!

Kevin Crafton
