story:
Das sind ADD ONE

ADD ONE ist, mit Verlaub, das kleinste Vokalorchester der Welt. Sie vertonen die Welt direkt beim nächsten Spaziergang. Dabei singen sich die drei gerne durch die verschiedensten Genres, sind mal Rockband, mal Streichertrio, mal Opern – oder Jazzchor. Sie finden Töne für obskure Kriminalgeschichten sowie Reiseanekdoten und erschaffen im nächsten Augenblick Klangsphären so weit wie der Horizont.

ADD ONE nehmen "Jazz" wörtlich, verimprovisieren dabei Alicia Keys und Michael Jackson, TokTokTok oder Miles Davis genauso schwungvoll wie ihre eigenen Kompositionen. Wieviel Groove, Soul, Herzblut, Energie, Humor und tiefe Momente diese drei kreativen Stimmen auf die Bühne bringen können – das sollte man (nicht nur) einmal erlebt haben.

This is ADD ONE

100% voice * 100% ourselves * 100% groovy * 100% loveable
ADD ONE – "The Voice thing", maybe the smallest vocal orchestra in the world (of more than one person) – able to walk on right away and improvise on the world on their journey. Style is no question: Rock band, string trio, opera choir or jazz choir. Music to strange mysteries, mini road movies or sonic spheres as wide as the horizon.

No a cappella comedy in German sense, but Jazz in pure improvisational form, occasionally "tongue in cheek".
ADD ONE try on Michael Jackson, Alicia Keys, Tok Tok Tok and Miles Davis as well as on our own compositions.
ADD ONE – 100% an authentic sonic event. Join and enjoy it!

........

Was haben wir vor?

Seit 2012 gibt es uns, seit 2015 sind wir zu dritt.

3 Jahre harter Arbeit und viele aufregende Konzerte liegen hinter uns,

jetzt möchten wir unsere erste Longplay-CD produzieren.

So wie auf dem Bild zur Kampagne zu sehen  könnte sie aussehen und heißen. 

"Twilight tones" ist ein wunderbarer Ausschnitt einer der Stimmungen die wir besingen.

Aber eine CD ist nicht nur harte Arbeit,  sie will auch finanziert werden.

Und dafür brauchen wir EURE Unterstützung! Damit wir euch und alle treuen Fans nicht nur live, sondern auch mit einem hand-und ohrfesten Produkt belohnen können.

What are we up to?

Since 2012 we exist as a band,  since 2015 as a trio.   There´s been 3 years of hard work, and a lot of exciting gigs,   now we want to produce our first longplay CD.

It may look like the campaign picture  and may be called "Twilight tones",  since this a very good example of the moods we sign about. 

But a CD is not only hard work,  it needs financing. This is where YOUR support would come in! So we can give back our fans and supporters  a "handy" product on top of your live concerts.

..........

Was muss finanziert werden?

Zu einer CD-Produktion gehören nicht nur die Aufnahmen im Tonstudio,

zusätzlich möchten wir auch ein Studiokonzert veranstalten, um vor Gästen Songs direkt durchzusingen und Live-Stimmung zu haben.

Dann müssen die Aufnahmen abgemischt, gemastered (sozusagen endveredelt) und auf CD gepresst werden, 

aber natürlich gehören auch Hülle, Cover und das Booklet dazu, von Fachkräften gestaltet,

und ansprechende Fotos von uns.

Nicht zu vergessen, dass die CD dann auch beworben, vertrieben (Label) und bei der GEMA registriert werden muss.

Mit insgesamt 6000€  haben wir sicher noch nicht alles beisammen, kämen aber ein großes Stück weiter.

What needs financing?

A CD production not only comprises recording in the studio,

we would like to ADD ONE  with a studio concert  to perform before guests  and sing the songs in live atmosphere.

Next, the recordings need to be mixed, mastered and pressed on CD. 

But of course there´s also package, cover and booklet, all designed by specialists,

as well as presentable photos.

Not to mentioned, the promotion, label and registration at the GEMA.

6000€  altogether will not cover everything,  yet we would be a big step forward.

..........

 

Was bekommen unsere Unterstützer?

 

Das Produkt von ADD ONE ist:  Bisher unsere Musik,  die live einen (auch stets für uns) spannenden Mix aus Soul, Jazz, Funk, Latin, Pop  und jeder Menge Improvisation darstellt, wir haben von Songfragmenten á 20 Sekunden  bis ausufernden Klangcollagen schon alles improvisiert.  Und das a cappella.

Das geben wir Euch zurück für Euren Beitrag zu dem was unsere CD werden soll:

  • 125 x   einen a cappella - Klingelton,  umgehend zugesendet
  • 50 x eine handsignierte neue CD
  • 25 x ein Konzertticket zu einem (eintrittspflichtigen) ADD ONE - Konzert eurer Wahl
  • 20 x eine handsignierte neue CD  plus Ticket
  • 10 x  eine Einladung zum Studiokonzert in Essen  (Juni 2018), um für Live-Atmosphäre zu sorgen
  • 15 x  die Chance, einen Begriff den ihr uns nennt, in einer Improvisation auf CD wiederzufinden und im Booklet erwähnt zu werden
  • 4 x ein Wohnzimmerkonzert mit ADD ONE bei Euch zu Hause

Über jeden Betrag  der einfach so kommt, von Herzen, ohne Perk, sind wir ebenfalls sehr dankbar.

 

What can we give you for your support?

 
  • 125 x   an  a cappella ringtone,  to be sent to you once it is recorded
  • 50 x    a new CD with autographs
  • 25 x  a concert ticket for a (non-free-attendance) ADD ONE concert of your choice
  • 20 x  an autographed CD  plus concert ticket
  • 10 x  invitation to our studio concert in Essen  (June 2018), to be part of the live atmo
  • 15 x  send us a word  and we will include it in an improvisation on CD  and mention you             in the booklet
  • 4 x  a living room concert with ADD ONE at your place

.And we´re very thankful for every amount that will reach us without a perk.

...........

 

Was bewirkt ihr mit Eurem Beitrag?

ADD ONE spielen gerne live, weil es Spaß macht. Wir singen unsere eigenen Arrangements nicht nur herunter, sondern fügen jedes Mal etwas Neues hinzu.  ADD ONE eben.

Wer uns nicht live gehört hat, dem fällt es jedoch unter Umständen schwer  sich vorzustellen wie das funktioniert.  Und das müssen wir vermitteln, denn neben allem Spaß  leben wir von der Musik.

Darum wollen wir den Schritt ins Studio gehen; um unsere Möglichkeiten bei optimalem Sound und optimaler Betreuung weiterzuentwickeln  und hörbar zu machen.

Ihr tut uns einen riesigen Gefallen wenn wir diese CD realisieren können; auf dass wir gehört werden, für unsere Entwicklung und unser Vorankommen - denn wir bleiben ja bei der CD nicht stehen.

Wir möchten Euch gerne als Dank ein auditives, erwerbbares und online und in den Medien auffindbares Stück (mit mehreren Stücken darauf) von uns mitgeben.

What does your support do for us?

ADD ONE love to play live, because we are musicians and it´s fun.  We add something new to our arrangements every time - which means ADD ONE.

Still;  we live by our music as professionals.  So, we need to explain what we do  also to those who never heard us sing live. 

That is why we need the step into the studio;  to explore our possibilities with an optimum of sound and care,  to make it audible.

So;  you´re doing us the greatest of favors  to help us realise this CD;  so we get heard,  we develop and make further steps forward.

We would love to give you an audible, acquirable  and media-presentable piece (including several pieces) of our work.

.............

Andere Wege  uns zu unterstützen

Ihr habt natürlich auch noch die Möglichkeit

  • alle Freunde auf unsere Kampagne aufmerksam zu machen
  • ADD ONE bei Facebook zu verlinken   oder Twitter
  • und allen Kontakten in sozialen Netzwerken den Link zu schicken

Wir freuen uns über jedes Feedback!  Und jede Frage wie das funktioniert.

Other ways of supporting

Of course, you can also

  • tell our campaign to all your friends and relations
  • link ADD ONE via  Facebook    or Twitter
  • send the link to all social network contacts

We´re glad for every feedback  and question!

 

Vielen Dank im Voraus für Euren Support! 

Thank you so much in advance!!

Singcerely,

ADD ONE
story_txt:
Das sind ADD ONE
ADD ONE ist, mit Verlaub, das kleinste Vokalorchester der Welt. Sie vertonen die Welt direkt beim nächsten Spaziergang. Dabei singen sich die drei gerne durch die verschiedensten Genres, sind mal Rockband, mal Streichertrio, mal Opern – oder Jazzchor. Sie finden Töne für obskure Kriminalgeschichten sowie Reiseanekdoten und erschaffen im nächsten Augenblick Klangsphären so weit wie der Horizont.
ADD ONE nehmen "Jazz" wörtlich, verimprovisieren dabei Alicia Keys und Michael Jackson, TokTokTok oder Miles Davis genauso schwungvoll wie ihre eigenen Kompositionen. Wieviel Groove, Soul, Herzblut, Energie, Humor und tiefe Momente diese drei kreativen Stimmen auf die Bühne bringen können – das sollte man (nicht nur) einmal erlebt haben.
This is ADD ONE
100% voice * 100% ourselves * 100% groovy * 100% loveableADD ONE – "The Voice thing", maybe the smallest vocal orchestra in the world (of more than one person) – able to walk on right away and improvise on the world on their journey. Style is no question: Rock band, string trio, opera choir or jazz choir. Music to strange mysteries, mini road movies or sonic spheres as wide as the horizon.
No a cappella comedy in German sense, but Jazz in pure improvisational form, occasionally "tongue in cheek".ADD ONE try on Michael Jackson, Alicia Keys, Tok Tok Tok and Miles Davis as well as on our own compositions.ADD ONE – 100% an authentic sonic event. Join and enjoy it!
........
Was haben wir vor?
Seit 2012 gibt es uns, seit 2015 sind wir zu dritt.
3 Jahre harter Arbeit und viele aufregende Konzerte liegen hinter uns,
jetzt möchten wir unsere erste Longplay-CD produzieren.
So wie auf dem Bild zur Kampagne zu sehen  könnte sie aussehen und heißen. 
"Twilight tones" ist ein wunderbarer Ausschnitt einer der Stimmungen die wir besingen.
Aber eine CD ist nicht nur harte Arbeit,  sie will auch finanziert werden.
Und dafür brauchen wir EURE Unterstützung! Damit wir euch und alle treuen Fans nicht nur live, sondern auch mit einem hand-und ohrfesten Produkt belohnen können.
What are we up to?
Since 2012 we exist as a band,  since 2015 as a trio.   There´s been 3 years of hard work, and a lot of exciting gigs,   now we want to produce our first longplay CD.
It may look like the campaign picture  and may be called "Twilight tones",  since this a very good example of the moods we sign about. 
But a CD is not only hard work,  it needs financing. This is where YOUR support would come in! So we can give back our fans and supporters  a "handy" product on top of your live concerts.
..........
Was muss finanziert werden?
Zu einer CD-Produktion gehören nicht nur die Aufnahmen im Tonstudio,
zusätzlich möchten wir auch ein Studiokonzert veranstalten, um vor Gästen Songs direkt durchzusingen und Live-Stimmung zu haben.
Dann müssen die Aufnahmen abgemischt, gemastered (sozusagen endveredelt) und auf CD gepresst werden, 
aber natürlich gehören auch Hülle, Cover und das Booklet dazu, von Fachkräften gestaltet,
und ansprechende Fotos von uns.
Nicht zu vergessen, dass die CD dann auch beworben, vertrieben (Label) und bei der GEMA registriert werden muss.
Mit insgesamt 6000€  haben wir sicher noch nicht alles beisammen, kämen aber ein großes Stück weiter.
What needs financing?
A CD production not only comprises recording in the studio,
we would like to ADD ONE  with a studio concert  to perform before guests  and sing the songs in live atmosphere.
Next, the recordings need to be mixed, mastered and pressed on CD. 
But of course there´s also package, cover and booklet, all designed by specialists,
as well as presentable photos.
Not to mentioned, the promotion, label and registration at the GEMA.
6000€  altogether will not cover everything,  yet we would be a big step forward.
..........
 Was bekommen unsere Unterstützer? Das Produkt von ADD ONE ist:  Bisher unsere Musik,  die live einen (auch stets für uns) spannenden Mix aus Soul, Jazz, Funk, Latin, Pop  und jeder Menge Improvisation darstellt, wir haben von Songfragmenten á 20 Sekunden  bis ausufernden Klangcollagen schon alles improvisiert.  Und das a cappella.
Das geben wir Euch zurück für Euren Beitrag zu dem was unsere CD werden soll:


125 x   einen a cappella - Klingelton,  umgehend zugesendet

50 x eine handsignierte neue CD

25 x ein Konzertticket zu einem (eintrittspflichtigen) ADD ONE - Konzert eurer Wahl

20 x eine handsignierte neue CD  plus Ticket

10 x  eine Einladung zum Studiokonzert in Essen  (Juni 2018), um für Live-Atmosphäre zu sorgen

15 x  die Chance, einen Begriff den ihr uns nennt, in einer Improvisation auf CD wiederzufinden und im Booklet erwähnt zu werden

4 x ein Wohnzimmerkonzert mit ADD ONE bei Euch zu Hause

Über jeden Betrag  der einfach so kommt, von Herzen, ohne Perk, sind wir ebenfalls sehr dankbar.
 
What can we give you for your support? 

125 x   an  a cappella ringtone,  to be sent to you once it is recorded

50 x    a new CD with autographs

25 x  a concert ticket for a (non-free-attendance) ADD ONE concert of your choice

20 x  an autographed CD  plus concert ticket

10 x  invitation to our studio concert in Essen  (June 2018), to be part of the live atmo

15 x  send us a word  and we will include it in an improvisation on CD  and mention you             in the booklet

4 x  a living room concert with ADD ONE at your place

.And we´re very thankful for every amount that will reach us without a perk.
...........

ADD ONE spielen gerne live, weil es Spaß macht. Wir singen unsere eigenen Arrangements nicht nur herunter, sondern fügen jedes Mal etwas Neues hinzu.  ADD ONE eben.

.............

Ihr habt natürlich auch noch die Möglichkeit

alle Freunde auf unsere Kampagne aufmerksam zu machen
ADD ONE bei Facebook zu verlinken   oder Twitter 

und allen Kontakten in sozialen Netzwerken den Link zu schicken

Wir freuen uns über jedes Feedback!  Und jede Frage wie das funktioniert.
Other ways of supporting
Of course, you can also

tell our campaign to all your friends and relations
link ADD ONE via  Facebook    or Twitter 

send the link to all social network contacts

Vielen Dank im Voraus für Euren Support!  
Thank you so much in advance!!
Singcerely,

story:
Preorder the new Miketon and the Nightblinders album, The Guiding Light, for the low, low price of $20! Do you like the warm sound of vinyl? Are you mad all the cool kids are buying 8-tracks now? Are you worried that the inevitable collapse of society will eliminate your ability to listen to digital music and you only want analog recordings? Than this is for you!

If you want to donate more than $20, feel free! We’ll find an extra special way to thank you. Maybe Bastek will hug you, which is normally something he reserves only for his mother, and even then just on her birthday. Maybe Miketon will buy you a drink. Maybe Cameron will give you a prison tattoo on your neck. Roll those dice!

story:
Olivia and the Creepy Crawlies

 

Olivia and the Creepy Crawlies are an award-winning six-piece folkpop band formed in London, Ontario who currently reside in Toronto ON. Their quirky songs will tug at your heartstrings with themes of love and loss, and tickle your imagination with mad kings, super-villains, and literary lovers. Wielding anything from ukuleles to glockenspiels, they are sure to entertain all of your whimsical fantasies and put words in your mouth to sing a long. Pursuit of Happiness frontman Moe Berg, says "The Creepy Crawlies are the real deal!" Olivia and the Creepy Crawlies currently are currently creating new music, and consist of: Olivia Borkosky, Chris Denise, Aurora Evans, Connor Grieve, Trevor Dubois, and Kelly Samuel.

This Campaign


As this is our first full-length album, we are cutting no corners in effort to create the highest quality record we possibly can. We're launching this campaign because our expenses for the new album were larger than expected - we need $7.8K to reach our goal! 

Cost Breakdown

 

Vinyl: $3,425
CDs: $1,390 
Production: $3,500 
Recording/Mixing/Mastering: $9,300 
Marketing: TBD

= $17,615

Already Covered: $9,736

Currently Short: $7,879



This is where we ask for YOUR help. By selecting one of our original perks or packages, YOU are helping US achieve our goal, with a little something in it for yourself as a token of our appreciation. So take a gander through our options, and see if there is something that catches your eye. We appreciate your love and support! Every donation, no matter how big or small, helps.

THANK YOU

story:
We are Solar Sound Band.  We all grew up together, and three of us are siblings.  We’ve been playing music our whole lives.   We are all under 16 years old yet music means everything to us.  Even though we’ve been a band for 4 years and have played over 50 gigs we are just getting started.

Our new EP, Trippple Greeen is coming out and we are really proud of it.  But we want to make really great videos that go with the songs on the EP.  We see the videos as extensions to our songs, giving the story and emotions of the song lasting images. 

Our songs are about climate change, environmentalism, Alice in Wonderland, and being wordless when we have a crush. With help from you we can hire a professional videographer who understands and loves our music and puts their expertise and passion into making awesome videos.  

We want to create several videos that highlight the songs on the new EP, Trippple Greeen and help bring the band good attention.  

Our goal is to raise at $3,000.

Supporting Solar Sound Band will enable us to do the thing we really want to do: make music.  The videos will help us reach more people.    

We know that it’s a hard business and that you have to work tirelessly.  But we love creating music.   

We’d love your suppor. Listen to Trippple Greeen, go to our website--www.solarsoundband.com—come to a gig, and spread the word.  Use indiegogo share tools.  Get our music on i-tunes and Spotify. 

Solar Sound Band hopes you will support us so we can live our dream.

story:
Michele Rosewoman & New Yor-Uba's Creative Journey Continues! Join our 35th Anniversary Celebration. Help us complete a new CD to be released in 2018

New Yor-Uba is a Musical Celebration of Cuba in America, led by pianist/composer Michele Rosewoman and featuring masters from the worlds of contemporary jazz and Cuban folkloric music. The name "New Yor-Uba" reflects the progression of the music of the ancient Yoruba people from Nigeria through Cuba to present day New York.

With this group of amazingly creative and tradition-drenched voices we are on a journey to discover all that is possible within the concept of this ensemble-- a concept that is constantly expanding. I am endlessly intrigued and excited by these two profound musical idioms- the worlds of Jazz and Afro Cuban folklore are bottomless wells of possibility.

Thanks to so many of you, four years ago we recorded and released our 30-year anniversary debut recording as a double disc CD. Many of you graciously shared with me that you were personally and deeply moved by the music. We received great press and numerous awards including NPR's #1 Latin jazz recording of the year.  

These days, we are deep in a new phase of our journey. Through this campaign I am seeking your support to help fund the completion of a new CD, half of which was was recorded in late August with support from a prestigious catalyst grant from Chamber Music America (CMA). The monies raised through this campaign will enable us to go back in the studio and complete the recording at the end of this month (October).

To conceive a thoroughly uncompromised synthesis of spiritually based Cuban Folkloric music and contemporary jazz concept, I have spent a lifetime immersed in the essence of these two profound musical traditions.  Recently, the deepening of my approach prepared me on multiple levels to manifest a new and challenging composition.  Commissioned by CMA, my latest work, "Oru de Oro" has been well-received by audiences at an array of venues including festivals, cultural centers and clubs such as the D.C. Jazz Festival and Dizzy’s at Jazz at Lincoln Center and was recorded in the studio in late August.

This extended new work honors the mastery of folkorist Roman Diaz, a featured member of the New Yor-Uba ensemble since 2008.  A body of music, built around a sacred sequence of rhythms known as the Oru Seco, "Oru de Oro", roughly translates as "room of gold" or "sacred room." Compositionally, the work is anchored in the rhythmic patterns associated with various  Orishas (deities), endowing them with unique musical content, while  integrating featured soloists and master drummers. As you will hear from my esteemed colleagues in the video, the work is  considered adventurous and pioneering. "Oru de Oro" will be presented on the CD as separate tracks, although artistically it can be heard as one uninterrupted rhythmic suite.

Other repertoire for the recording will include "Alabanza" (a recent composition for which I received a Latin Grammy as pianist and composer as represented on Arturo O'Farrill's ALJO recording). We will also be recording an arrangement of a sequence of traditional rezos (prayers) and cantos (songs) featuring Nina Rodriguez on lead vocals--a voice of true beauty.

For this upcoming second and final phase of the recording, we are scheduled to return to the studio in late October. But for this, we need your help!

In honor of my mentor and inspiration, New Yor-Uba works are dedicated to celebrating the legacy of master folklorist Orlando 'Puntilla' Rios who nurtured the birth of the ensemble and was an integral member for 25 years-- from our 1983 debut until his passing in 2008.

Our extensive history was amply documented in our previous Kickstarter campaign video which you can view if interested. (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/micheleros...

The CMA commission covered the costs of the first phase and we need your support to finish it. Creating a high quality CD with a large ensemble is an expensive endeavor. Below, I offer an explanation of how your resources will be used to support the recording. 

Funds raised will be used for:

* Artist fees for rehearsals and studio time.

* Sound engineer fees

* Studio rental and associated expenses

*Producer, mixing and master fees

* Transportation of necessary equipment

* Session meals

* 15% of your contribution will go to  UNIDOS, a disaster relief fund for recovery In Puerto Rico and Mexico. 100% of the proceed to this organization go to those in need.

Perks for your contributions will include, among others:

(Note: No shipping costs in the U.S., minimal shipping costs in rest of world)

* Advance digital download of new CD

* Signed copy of new CD

* Critically acclaimed 30th anniversary double disc, "New Yor-Uba, 30 Years!"

* Limited edition poster

*Tickets to 2018 CD release event

* Private piano and/or composition lessons (with me)

 

Risks and Challenges:

1) As regards budgeting to complete the recording:

We are committed to producing this album and should any costs exceed our estimated budget, we will ensure that they are attended to without delay to the project.

 

2) As regards assuring timely delivery of the product:

We have allotted extra time to the process to ensure that we deliver our product to you within the time promised - that any delays due to printing or manufacturing will not affect the delivery time frame.

story:
Short description

 

My name is Alhousseini Mohamed Anivolla a.k.a. Anewal, which means 'walking man' and I am the lead singer and guitarist of the internationally known Desert Blues band ANEWAL and former bandleader of Etran Finatawa from Niger. Since 2004 I have toured around the globe sucessfully. All over the world the audience loves my music: "Anivolla’s undulating pulse rhythms, ringing guitar accompaniments and smoothly raspy voice aim straight for the heart, and the effect was immediate." (Afropop 12/17)

In 2017 I performed in Addis Ababa. The audience loved our desert blues and  I had the chance to meet Girum Mezmer, a world famous jazz guitarist and founder of the Addis Acoustic Project. His style is famous for the  intoxicating, charming blend of sounds that Mondomix.com called "a gentle groove with carefully rounded edges." Girum and myself, we discovered so many similarities between desert music and ethiopian pentatonic. We were overwhelmed. The idea of a common project was born: We want to spend more time together, discover common roots and traditional instruments, create together and enrich african soundscapes -an ethio-saharan fusion.

We will meet beginning of march for a week in Addis Ababa and rehearse intensively. Girum will invite some of his musician friends from Addis to join the project. We will record some tunes. An exclusive performance in a music club will be the highlight of this meeting and a start for further concerts.

This project will happen and with your support we will be able to enrich the african music scene with new dynamic soundscapes. We need your support to finance flights,accomodation, food and a small fee for the musicians.

You have already supported  my recent campaign to record my 2nd album "OSAS-It´s time" that Songlines qualified as "expansive and panoramic as the Sahara itself"  (Songlines 6/17)

Support our project and share it on indigogo and your social networks!

​

story:
Hello world! We are ‘Johnny Powell and the Seasonal Beasts’, a band from Hebden Bridge, nestled in the Pennine hills of northern England. We are looking for some help to ditch soulless plastic CDs and produce a hand-crafted package, an ambitious project involving time, love and a higher than normal budget. We are not looking to produce any CDs at all in fact.

This album will be released in two formats; firstly as a pay-as-you-feel download on Bandcamp and secondly as a beautiful handmade book containing our lyrics in poem form, with specially commissioned artworks alongside them from creative people we have connected with or had an association with during the songwriting process. It will be hand bound and finished by a wonderful local maker, Sarah Quick, using sustainably sourced materials. The illustrations come from 9 artists including Alan Coulson the portrait artist and a 14 year old, Taylor Campbell, whose illustrations we loved on Instagram.

In addition we asked 5 poets and 7 photographers to contribute a response to, or interpretation of the lyrics. We appreciate everyone's work incredibly.

The idea is to make something that really values the efforts of everyone involved, something special that people will love to hold for years to come. A physical way of expressing and sharing the joy we’ve experienced through our first year and a half of making music together. Rehearsing and recording in Rog’s little blue cabin on the moors, forming lasting friendships, eating a LOT of veggie chilli and visiting strange, hilarious and wonderful people and places.

To give you an idea of our sound, here is what people have kindly said of our last release. Piccadilly Records: “Johnny Powell and co. smash out another pastoral suite of off-kilter folk melodies, psychedelic twisting instrumentals and organic electro-acoustic breakdowns, all topped by warped and emotive vocal flourishes. Brilliantly eccentric, but eminently listenable outsider indie for the soul.” BBC Introducing: “Absolutely haunting”,  “Incredible songwriting”.

 

So what are we raising money for exactly?

We’re hoping to raise money to give to the generous artists who’ve spent time producing some really excellent and thoughtful original work, to pay for the materials, printing (Lambert Print and Design) and creation of the book itself, the recording, mixing and mastering of the songs and the careful presentation of the artwork and photography as an exhibition at the album launch. 

The perks for contributing start from £5 for a handwritten thank you postcard, or for a bit more you can pre-order one of the handmade books! Each one comes with download codes for the 9-track album and spoken word recordings. We will also be producing high quality prints of the photographs, lyrics and artwork.You can see all of the options in the Perks section.

 

The kind artists are:

Deedee Biott - instagram
Raven Rossetti
Julia Ogden - website
Sam Leeming
Domenique Brouwers - instagram
Alan Coulson - website
Charlotte Mellor Meecham - website
Alice Mill - instagram
Taylor Campbell

 

The kind photographers are:

Rob Lycett - website
Carla Daly - instagram
Linda Hodges - website
Laura Powell
Ffion Atkinson - website
Martha Moopette - website
Leena Gustovska 

 

The kind poets are:

Fiona Brehony
Winston Plowes - website
Kate Radford - website
Celine Delal Kart
John G. Hall - work

 

Track Listing

  1. The Last Door
  2. If It’s All That You Wanted, Why Didn’t You Stop?
  3. Let’s Dance in the Fire
  4. In the Dark Room
  5. Heave-Ho
  6. Knowing
  7. Spiders
  8. Almost a Normal Song
  9. Bring Back the Dying to Life

 

If you can’t donate, don’t worry!

Don’t worry if you can’t support us financially! Caring enough to read this far means a lot, and we would be delighted if you could share this campaign with other people who might be interested. You can also follow us in our musical endeavours at the links below. Every little thing helps.

Thank you so much for your time and support. We can’t wait to share the results with you.

Johnny, Roger, Paul and Ffion

 

Website: www.johnnypowell.com

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/johnnypowellseasonalb...

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/johnnypowellmusic/

Bandcamp: https://johnnypowell.bandcamp.com/

 

Video credits: The clip of us playing Heave-Ho in the cabin was filmed by Steve Smith. The poet shown during a recital is Kate Radford. The artist shown sketching is Domenique Brouwers. The artists whose illustrations are featured in the video (in order of appearance and left to right) are Domenique Brouwers, Alan Coulson, Sam Leeming, Julia Ogden and Deedee Biott. The photographers whose work is featured in the video are Linda Hodges and Rob Lycett. See the text above for the full list of artists, poets and photographers involved in the project and links to see more of their work.

 

Three photos above by Sarah Mason - website (taken at The Grayston Unity in Halifax)

story:
WHO IS GIO NATION?

Gionatan Niro (a.k.a. Gio Nation) is an American singer-songwriter, dancer, and fire artist. 

Though he has been performing since he was a child, it wasn't until 2014 that Gio packed up everything he owned and moved from Richmond, Virginia, to Los Angeles. Since then, he has developed a reputation as one of LA's (literally) hottest performers. With his new single "Gymnast" coming out this May, Gio is finally ready to unleash his personal creative vision and establish himself as a major recording artist. 



WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE "GYMNAST" COME TO LIFE

Our music video is a passionate chase across three different locations: An intimate cabaret, a Burning Man-style desert camp, and a rollicking house party overlooking Los Angeles. These diverse settings eventually collide, with Victorian chorus girls brushing up alongside fire-eating ravers and WeHo club kids. In order to realize this concept completely, we need your donations to help our budget cover the following: 

  • Camera/Lighting Equipment Rental ($2,000)
    We would never create anything that is less than the best, which means shelling out for some expensive tech. Two thousand immediately goes to covering our lighting equipment, our Steadicam, and an array of speciality lenses for filming in slow-motion and low-light settings. 
  • Cast & Crew ($2,000)
    Though almost everybody involved in "Gymnast" is working for free due to their passion for this project, we still need to pay certain crew people: Our Steadicam operator, gaffer, grip, best boy, and more. Additionally, we need to both feed and transport dozens of extras during the shoot.
  • Post-production ($1,000)
    Once filming is complete, we've already lined up some incredible sound engineers and color correction specialists to make sure "Gymnast" looks/sounds as good as anything you might see on MTV...or in this day and age, Vevo.  
  • Location Rentals ($4,000)
    Our biggest outright cost is locations. We are filming "Gymnast" at some astonishing locales: An elite Hollywood nightclub, a beautiful desert vista, and a hilltop mansion. But rental and permit costs run high, even for our jam-packed shooting schedule. Every last penny of what we spend will be obvious on screen. 

OUR TEAM

Leland Frankel (Director)
Leland is an LA-based, award-winning playwright, screenwriter, and director. His projects have been produced across the country, from New York City to Kealakekua. He is also the Artistic Director and co-founder of Shinbone Theatre Company. Leland is currently in pre-production for his feature debut Frontera, to be filmed in 2019. LelandFrankel.com



Gemini Musiq (Producer)
Gemini Musiq is an LA-based producer with 25 years of experience and multiple platinum-selling albums to his name. He has won a Grammy Award for his sound engineering collaboration with Justin Bieber, and is credited on projects by Lil John, Christina Milian, and many more. GeminiMusiq.com


John Ros (Cinematographer)
John is a co-founder of Subplot Entertainment. He has shot concert footage for Rihanna and Kendrick Lamar, music videos for artists like Will Haynes and D'Cipher, commercials for Time Warner Cable and 7-Eleven, and television shows like "KMG! Show" and "Jet Set! Philippines!" InPlotWeTrust.com

WHY SHOULD YOU DONATE?

Maybe you want to support the creation of dynamic multi-ethnic music. Maybe you love electric jazz positive pop jams that are equally awesome in the car, on the speakers at a party, or on your headphones at the gym. Maybe you're secretly in love with Gio and for some reason this is the only way you can think of to express your uncompromising desire. Or maybe you caught a glimpse of our locations/performers and needed to see this video come to life:

Location 1: The Crazy Sexy Cabaret

Location 2: The Fire Festival

Location 3: The Quintessential Hollywood Hills Party


Looks pretty amazing, right?! Who wouldn't toss a few bucks our way?!

So donate today for a chance to be in the music video or even receive a private concert from Gio Nation and his band! We can't wait to share our art with you!

THANK YOU FOR DONATING!

story:
Who the heck is Karen Wheelock? 

Madison’s 2015 New Artist of the Year Karen Wheelock burst into the local folk and americana scene in 2013, armed with a guitar and a ukulele. A Wisconsin farm girl from the small town of Delavan, Wheelock’s gentle heart and forthright nature are surprisingly disarming to even the most jaded audience.

Romantic at its core, Wheelock’s music has a sound all its own, but one could draw connections to A Fine Frenzy, Lisa Loeb, Cat Power with just a hint of the Moldy Peaches' spirit. Hidden within her songwriting is a deep love for the Foo Fighters and other hard rock bands. Wheelock's repertoire ranges from light-hearted ditties to deeply profound ballads; these are clearly the result of personal reflection, the stuff of all good art.

Why does Karen need this campaign?

Because making a record is not cheap! Besides paying for the EP to be recorded and produced, I need to pay for merch, marketing, copyrighting, etc. Also, I'd love to be able to compensate the talented musicians backing me up on this EP - they deserve it! 

I feel like the experiential perks are the most exciting and memorable! A private concert, a spot on a radio show, your favorite cover song...these aren't things you see every day! :)

Obviously, I hope to reach the goal of $1500, but if I don't, I will put the money into the production of the album first and compensate my backup musicians before making the merch. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of you might not be able to financially contribute to this campaign, but you can help get the word out! Please share this with others! Word of mouth can work wonders :) 

Thank you SO MUCH for the support! <3

EP RELEASE SHOW WILL BE ON 12/27 AT BOS MEADERY. WE WILL HAVE THE ITEMS AVAILABLE FOR PICKUP THEN. PLEASE SPECIFY IF YOU CANNOT MAKE IT AND WE CAN MAKE ARRANGEMENTS OR MAIL YOUR ITEMS.

**Edit: I had put shipping charges on the perks with physical products, thinking it was an optional check box (if you wanted to pick it up from me, I obviously wouldn't charge shipping), but I've realized the charges became mandatory, and I can't undo it on some of them. If you see something you like and know that you will be able to pick it up from me, please make a general contribution, tell me which perk you want and I'll get it to you!! (That way, you'll avoid shipping fees). If you already paid shipping fees and come to pick up your merch, I can reimburse you! Thank you!

story:
'Felabration 20 Years On: Promoting, Preserving & Protecting the Legacy of Fela Anikulapo- Kuti'.

Welcome to Phase Two* of our Crowdfunding Campaign: Second Base Jare!

This year marks 20 years since Fela passed and we want to make 2017 the very best Felabration yet to truly honour his legacy for this generation and the next. We plan to raise $128,000 by Fela’s birthday on 15th October 2017, so we need your help!

The last few years have been a challenge financially for the organisation, as festival related costs have increased due to a number of complex factors. As the year has gone on, we have continued to plan for the festival, however, it’s become apparent that we will be unable to fully achieve our goals without the help and support of Fela’s global community. 

We do however feel optimistically confident that within this global community there are the resources to achieve our goal. No donation is too small or too large, all support is truly welcome.  

Your donation will help defray the costs associated with artists’ travel, lodging, sound, security, and all other festival associated expenses as well as seed the development of an archive for Fela in Lagos, Nigeria.

 

Phase Two- Second Base Jare

We ran our very first Crowdfunding campaign on IndieGogo from 15th July-11th September 2017. Our phase one campaign can be viewed at: https://igg.me/at/CrowdfundFela

We were fortunate to have gained support from a total of 22 individual backers, who together raised a total of $2122 for our campaign! To the inaugural backers of our campaign, we salute and thank you for your belief in our mission. In fact we'd like to thank you personally, each and everyone of you. Drum roll please!

Anonymous $5, Anonymous $20, Hamida Yusufzai $25, Erin Glasco $61, Adelaide Bannerman $32, Anonymous $35, Anonymous $108, Jaime Delmer $100, Brenda Langton $61, Shilps2 $10, MaryBeth Szeles $61, Aya Ifakemi Yem $20, Rob Eagle $15, Conyemelukwe $40, Sophie Akehurst $32, Hannah Ishmael $17, Anonymous $10, Dotun Adebayo $150, Stephen Hendel $1000, Page and Jay Cowles $300, Anonymous $10, Ayodeji Soboyede $10. 

We raised a total of $2122 (before platform fees) from our first phase and it’s spurned us on even further to reach our ultimate goal. That means we would still like to raise $128,000. So we've launched phase two and are calling upon you to support our campaign. 

Please visit our image gallery for images from our phase one campaign. 

 

The Archive

Your donation will ensure the preservation of the existing Fela Anikulapo-Kuti archive, which is currently held at The New Afrika Shrine and The Kalakuta Museum both based in Ikeja, Lagos, Nigeria. 

Fela’s collection includes, photographs of family members pre-dating his musical career, charting his musical career at home and abroad, a variety of musical ephemera including recordings and album art, personal correspondence and hand written/typed lyrics, clothing and musical instruments.

Your support will enable the delivery of a much needed assessment, that identifies preservation priorities of the Fela Anikulapo-Kuti collection. We will be addressing the urgent issues the collection currently faces, as it deteriorates under a number of factors including weather, limited intervention and collection management.

 

Felabration

Felabration was a tribute conceived by Yeni Anikulapo -Kuti, Fela’s eldest child, as a festival celebrating the life of her father. Established in 1998, the year after he had passed away; Felabration has grown from a day of celebration and remembrance into a week long Superfest, which was recognised and listed by Fest300 in 2016/17. In 2011 Felabration was endorsed by Lagos State Government and was included on their events calendar. 

Each year we host an audience of over a million people globally, including 30,000 in Nigeria who get to see us live!

Each year Felabration includes:

A street carnival (1 day) - music, DJ's, decorated floats, parades by Lagos State Troupes

Musical concerts (7 days)- venues include New Africa Shrine, Freedom Park

Musical concerts (1 day) - venue Teslim Balogun Stadium (TBS)

Fela week Partners (7 days)- exhibitions, film festivals, book reviews, performances

Symposium (1 day)

Senior Secondary Schools Debate (1 day)

Our events take place primarily at the New Afrika Shrine, with satellite events taking place at Freedom Park, our primary partner in Lagos, currently the site of a unique multi use arts, culture and leisure space built on the site of the old ‘Broad Street’colonial prison.

Previous acts and visitors to Felabration have included:

Hugh Masekela, Angelina Kidjo, Lucky Dube,Third World, Tuface Idibia, D’Banj, Wizkid, Kwam, King Sunny Ade, Lagbaja, Nneka, Asa, Ade Bantu, Chocolate City Boiz (MI, Jessy Jagz, Ice Prince), Flea (Red Hot Chilli Peppers), Olamide, Tekno, Oritsefemi, Mavin All Stars,Mr Eazi and Patorankin. 

 

The Team

This crowdfunding campaign is being headed by our Project Historian Kiera Adegbite (London) , a long time friend of the Kuti family and our Project Archivist Ego Ahaiwe Sowinski (Minnesota); members of the FOC. 

Our campaign is supported by the Felabration Organising Committee (FOC), the New Afrika Shrine, Kalakuta Museum, Freedom Park and the estate of Fela Anikulapo-Kuti, alongside Trace magazine Nigeria.

 

Thank you for taking time to read about our campaign for Felabration 2017 and the development of an archive fit for FELA. 

Please help us spread the word, 'Everybody say YEAH YEAH!!'. 

 

www.facebook.com/CrowdfundFela

@CrowdfundFela

 

Please email crowdfundfela@gmail.com with any comments, queries or questions.
story_txt:
'Felabration 20 Years On: Promoting, Preserving & Protecting the Legacy of Fela Anikulapo- Kuti'.
Welcome to Phase Two* of our Crowdfunding Campaign: Second Base Jare!
This year marks 20 years since Fela passed and we want to make 2017 the very best Felabration yet to truly honour his legacy for this generation and the next. We plan to raise $128,000 by Fela’s birthday on 15th October 2017, so we need your help!
The last few years have been a challenge financially for the organisation, as festival related costs have increased due to a number of complex factors. As the year has gone on, we have continued to plan for the festival, however, it’s become apparent that we will be unable to fully achieve our goals without the help and support of Fela’s global community. 
We do however feel optimistically confident that within this global community there are the resources to achieve our goal. No donation is too small or too large, all support is truly welcome.  
Your donation will help defray the costs associated with artists’ travel, lodging, sound, security, and all other festival associated expenses as well as seed the development of an archive for Fela in Lagos, Nigeria.
 
Phase Two- Second Base Jare
We ran our very first Crowdfunding campaign on IndieGogo from 15th July-11th September 2017. Our phase one campaign can be viewed at: https://igg.me/at/CrowdfundFela
We were fortunate to have gained support from a total of 22 individual backers, who together raised a total of $2122 for our campaign! To the inaugural backers of our campaign, we salute and thank you for your belief in our mission. In fact we'd like to thank you personally, each and everyone of you. Drum roll please!
Anonymous $5, Anonymous $20, Hamida Yusufzai $25, Erin Glasco $61, Adelaide Bannerman $32, Anonymous $35, Anonymous $108, Jaime Delmer $100, Brenda Langton $61, Shilps2 $10, MaryBeth Szeles $61, Aya Ifakemi Yem $20, Rob Eagle $15, Conyemelukwe $40, Sophie Akehurst $32, Hannah Ishmael $17, Anonymous $10, Dotun Adebayo $150, Stephen Hendel $1000, Page and Jay Cowles $300, Anonymous $10, Ayodeji Soboyede $10. 
We raised a total of $2122 (before platform fees) from our first phase and it’s spurned us on even further to reach our ultimate goal. That means we would still like to raise $128,000. So we've launched phase two and are calling upon you to support our campaign. 
Please visit our image gallery for images from our phase one campaign. 
 
The Archive
Your donation will ensure the preservation of the existing Fela Anikulapo-Kuti archive, which is currently held at The New Afrika Shrine and The Kalakuta Museum both based in Ikeja, Lagos, Nigeria. 
Fela’s collection includes, photographs of family members pre-dating his musical career, charting his musical career at home and abroad, a variety of musical ephemera including recordings and album art, personal correspondence and hand written/typed lyrics, clothing and musical instruments.
Your support will enable the delivery of a much needed assessment, that identifies preservation priorities of the Fela Anikulapo-Kuti collection. We will be addressing the urgent issues the collection currently faces, as it deteriorates under a number of factors including weather, limited intervention and collection management.
 
Felabration
Felabration was a tribute conceived by Yeni Anikulapo -Kuti, Fela’s eldest child, as a festival celebrating the life of her father. Established in 1998, the year after he had passed away; Felabration has grown from a day of celebration and remembrance into a week long Superfest, which was recognised and listed by Fest300 in 2016/17. In 2011 Felabration was endorsed by Lagos State Government and was included on their events calendar. 
Each year we host an audience of over a million people globally, including 30,000 in Nigeria who get to see us live!
Each year Felabration includes:
A street carnival (1 day) - music, DJ's, decorated floats, parades by Lagos State Troupes
Musical concerts (7 days)- venues include New Africa Shrine, Freedom Park
Musical concerts (1 day) - venue Teslim Balogun Stadium (TBS)
Fela week Partners (7 days)- exhibitions, film festivals, book reviews, performances
Symposium (1 day)
Senior Secondary Schools Debate (1 day)
Our events take place primarily at the New Afrika Shrine, with satellite events taking place at Freedom Park, our primary partner in Lagos, currently the site of a unique multi use arts, culture and leisure space built on the site of the old ‘Broad Street’colonial prison.
Previous acts and visitors to Felabration have included:
Hugh Masekela, Angelina Kidjo, Lucky Dube,Third World, Tuface Idibia, D’Banj, Wizkid, Kwam, King Sunny Ade, Lagbaja, Nneka, Asa, Ade Bantu, Chocolate City Boiz (MI, Jessy Jagz, Ice Prince), Flea (Red Hot Chilli Peppers), Olamide, Tekno, Oritsefemi, Mavin All Stars,Mr Eazi and Patorankin. 
 
The Team
This crowdfunding campaign is being headed by our Project Historian Kiera Adegbite (London) , a long time friend of the Kuti family and our Project Archivist Ego Ahaiwe Sowinski (Minnesota); members of the FOC. 
Our campaign is supported by the Felabration Organising Committee (FOC), the New Afrika Shrine, Kalakuta Museum, Freedom Park and the estate of Fela Anikulapo-Kuti, alongside Trace magazine Nigeria.
 
Thank you for taking time to read about our campaign for Felabration 2017 and the development of an archive fit for FELA. 
Please help us spread the word, 'Everybody say YEAH YEAH!!'. 
 
www.facebook.com/CrowdfundFela
@CrowdfundFela
 
Please email crowdfundfela@gmail.com with any comments, queries or questions.

story:
Before the story, please have a look at the estimated allocations of funds:

10 university level competitions: $50,000

5 major concerts in provincial and federal capitals: $150,000

5 major concerts - video-graphy: $30,000

5 major concerts - 50 audio tracks: $37,500

Administration charges @ 10%: $26,750+

Indiegogo charges @ 5% of $325,000: $16,250+

International bank/transfer charges @ 5% of $325,000: $16,250+

With the above, total calculations comes at $326,750.

AND now the story of resilience of the Pakistani Rock against the odds:

Pakistan once sang and danced. Quite contrary to what a larger part of the world believes, Pakistanis once loved singing and dancing. Pakistan was created out of the Indian Subcontinent (1947), and inherited its part of the artistic and aesthetic traditions that assisted creating a social environment of openness, particularly among the youth. 

Dictators and terrorists snatched the music and shattered us. The political instability and a continuous effort by the military regimes molded the society for worse. Discontinuity of democracy badly affected the country and its people. Dictators' shortsightedness and obscurantist ideologies destroyed the fabric of our society.

People: we have suffered over 80,000 deaths and countless are wounded/maimed. The relentless and horrific terrorism that the religiously motivated terrorists unleashed on the people after tragic incidents of 9/11 in New York, created an atmosphere of fear and danger. The Pakistani nation fought back via various forms of expressions wherever and whenever it could, but there hasn't been any consistency in reclaiming the lost public and social space, particularly by the youth of Pakistan. This is because there are hardly any means available to revive a society, culture and people to what they once were in the past.

Rock once rocked Pakistan for better. Pakistan in the 1990s had a robust mainstream and underground Rock Music circuit. There were dozens of bands releasing their albums, and few of them were well on their way to becoming a regional, if not global, phenomena. But it started going down the drain from late 1990s, and whatever was remaining was first snatched, and then destroyed by the terrorists. 

With democracy, there is a hope. With continued democracy since 2013, Pakistan is opening up and a couple of multinational corporations have been sponsoring a couple of music ventures. But that's not enough, and the Rock Music that comes naturally to the Pakistani bands, is nowhere in the mainstream. Rock in the 1990s created a range of constructive narratives for the society and it shall do it again.

Help us, please. Help us revive the rock music. Help us in making Pakistan sing and dance again. Help us letting rock, rock the society and youth for better.  Help us creating a Rock Circuit for the struggling artists. Help us in holding music workshops, events and concerts. Help us in creating a society that is open and restarts loving arts, cultural and musical expressions. Help us making Rock Music a strong way of expression. 

Help. Pakistan. RockOn!

story:
Hailing from a small town in the Southwest Region of Cameroon, the power of Stanley Rubyn’s music is a product of his intense upbringing on the streets. Rising swiftly above his surroundings Stanley’s passion for music and dance led him to Lagos, one of the largest Cities of Africa where he worked as a dance instructor in many dance institutions and later founded his own dance crew “space unlimited”. “Space unlimited” was the first B-Boy/Hip Hop dance crew from Africa that made it to the breakdance World championship in France and in Germany. After performing in front of 40000 people, the crew got international recognition. 



In 2008, Stanley was invited to Frankfurt Germany where he blossomed with a scholarship for the Academy of Dance. It was not long before he found himself in Berlin and becoming well known through his passionate performances and his heartfelt song craft. Stanley has played with such popular artists as “Irie Révoltés” and lots more.

The motivation, why Stanley become a Musician, is his love for music and dance since his childhood and of course to talk about equal rights and fairness in the world.

2011 Stanley was signed by a Record Company in Berlin, with whom he did several projects including a short film for the German Choir. Later he decided to work independently and set up his own team and management. His first EP “Little by little” was released 2013 and got a lot of attention. In 2014 his deput Album “Simple truth” came out, and a lot of CDs were sold around the World.Currently Stanley is working on his new solo album “World citizen”, a culmination of many years of honed experience, and immense upheaval for this talented young songwriter and performer.  

Music is always influenced by the environment that we are encased in. Some of the greatest music of all time are influenced by a plethora of varying factors, heart break, tumultuous relationships, etc. In that sense World Citizen is no different. Influenced by the ever changing element of Love,i have written songs  combination of parallel sounds and feelings.

Crowd Funding this album will help to cover:

I have funded a portion of the recordings on my own which is featured on the crowdfunding page, "My Own Story" is one of them. I aim to make quality music and music videos and being able to gain help through funding will allow me to do so for my fans both old and new alike. 

The challenge we face at the moment is being able to complete and release the album on the date originally set which is March 2018, however, to build up interest and keep the album and myself as an artist concreted in peoples minds we will release singles leading up to the album release date.

‭Promoting the World Citizen Album will need prestige promotion and organization are you a Promoter? If so, I need you.
 

My musical journey

Music is my life. When the regulations changed, I started having a hard time making decent money on the streets.

That's why I decided to bring my music to the next level. I recorded new songs and shot music videos with my friends back home in Africa. 

Little by little (2013):



My own story (2017):

You can also contribute by sharing this project with friends and family alike.Thank you for your help and your time in reading my campaign.

story:
All-Night Yahtzee

Welcome to All-Night Yahtzee's Indiegogo page!

All-Night Yahtzee is Florida State University's premier, Co-Ed a capella group, founded in 1998. We are a group of passionate and purpose driven individuals with dreams of making our next album our biggest one yet!

As many of you may know, college is extremely difficult and expensive as is, which is why we've made this IndieGogo page to help fund our next album. No matter how small the donation, we will have the greatest appreciation for your support and confidence in All-Night Yahtzee. We have all worked so hard this past year, winning 2nd place at the SoJam a cappella competition in North Carolina, performing in the first ever All Roads music festival in Miami, taking home "Best Choreography" in both quarterfinals AND semifinals, being featured in PopTV Network's Pitch Perfect reality-inspired docuseries, "Sing It On", and the list goes on and on.
We cannot wait for the world to get a taste of All-Night Yahtzee's sexy, sassy, and unattainable style of music. 


The Impact

We need YOUR help! All -Night Yahtzee's EP will break a cappella norms, push boundaries, and go where no a cappella group has gone before. Our hard work and dedication is what made this album flourish, and we cannot wait to share it with you guys. Any donation, big or small, will not be taken for granted, and we will appreciate anything you donate!

If we happen to go OVER our $5,500 goal, we will be putting the rest of the money towards a new sound system! After being a group for almost 18 years, All-Night Yahtzee still does not have their own sound system. The more you help us pass our goal, the closer we can get to finally being able to rehearse for gigs and performances with an actual sound system!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, no problem! We have attached information below under the section "Find This Campaign On.." to all of our social media and would absolutely love if you liked and followed our pages. We also added the link to Sing It On's website! Please share this with your friends, families, enemies, children, grandma, grandpa and that one person that's obsessed with the game Yahtzee. We appreciate all of your help, love, and support! 

Sing It On's Website

Sing It On's Facebook Page

Sing It On's Twitter



#diceordie

story:
Hi! I'm Christopher Marcus, a singer-song writer living in Amherst Massachusetts. I play a variety of instruments including guitar, piano, bass guitar and drums and I'm very passionate about music. I'd love to compose choral music and movie scores someday but I've got to start somewhere!

I'm heavily influenced by and/or inspired by a variety of artists including Muse, the Dear Hunter, Emery, Margot & The Nuclear So and So's, Radio Head, Bayside, Pendulum, Queen, Protest the hero, Between the Buried and Me, Nobuo Uematsu, Yasunori Mitsuda, Yoko Shimamura, Bach, Alexandre Guilmant, Shostakovich, John Williams, and lots more.

About this project -

I've been writing music for about 7 years and have yet to make an album! I've written a wide variety of different types of music over the years and it would mean the world to me to finally share it.

The album is so far unnamed and will have 13 songs. It tells a story about love, loss, moving backwards and forwards through grief and attempting to grow through adversity and enjoy the potential of an exciting future.

In helping me fund this project you'll be making it possible for me to hire professional string and woodwind players to play my compositions, and to spend time in a professional studio recording my songs, and mixing/mastering the album so I can turn my rough compositions into finished products that sound pretty!

Where is the money going?

In order to make this happen I'll need this funding for a variety of things including

- Working with a variety of musicians including guest singers, string and woodwind players

- Recording, Mixing Mastering at Northfire Studio,

- Distributing the album when its finished, and making it look pretty as well


What makes the album special?

I've got a variety of different types of songs on this album with different styles that are a little bit difficult to define with a genre. The best I can do is say that there's music inspired by classical, jazz, rock, folk, indie, and video game/movie scores.

I'll be playing acoustic and electric guitar, electric bass, ukulele, piano, bells, harp, and drums, and there will be other musicians playing guitar, classical bass, cello, viola, violin, oboe and flute.

Writing these songs has been a great way to move through struggles with mental health, death and grief, and the processes of self discovery and reflection, excitement, forgiveness and moving on.

How else can you help if you can't contribute?

Just spread the word and wish me luck! It's going to be a lot of work but I'm so excited to make this happen!

story:
Hi there!

I AM VERY EXITED 
to present my NEW Music Project !!!

Here is the presentation of what is going to be a very exciting
adventure for me and for the people involved

A very important step for my carreer of Songwriter and Performer.

I have decited to convey all the passion the feeling the dreams and
the goal of a lifetime in to this original PLAY and I really hope that
also You will be a part of it!

The reason why I am working on it  is to spread positive and uplifting messages to touch the heart of human beings like me and you! and to express my heart through

                                                 Music  Visual Art and  Poetry
                                                        

                                                       ****    ****    ****    ****

WHO AM I

I spent my whole life performing in Theatre singing Music and Dancing
I had my debut on theatre at 22 with some of the most famous Actors in Italy such as Mariangela Melato and Tony Servillo in the Play Tango Barbaro ..

I've been working as Actress Dancer Singer for almost 10 years 

A few years ago I wrote my first song Whats Life? inspired by the message of Ambassador of Peace Prem Rawat

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Vrjqor8eig

this song was played on Radio all over Europe from Spain to Romania and people loved it... ! but the full Record wasn't quite launch in the appropriated way
and some very nice songs like

Harmony  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PoUW6rxj0ns


Like Raindrops

Higher Skies ..

remained unknowned....

                    

NOW finally after a period of deep meditation on my life
I have took all the courage I have and decide to start a New Project with
Visual & Original Video Images to present LIVE and then made it available worldwide through the web !

This is gonna be my very first ORIGINAL MUSIC PROJECT
and You are invited to be a part of it by helping me realizing it!

HOW AM I GONNA USE THE FUNDS ?

I just need a concrete help to be able to

  • Produce and Record all the tracks in a Professional Studio with the help of one of the TOP world Producer

    the tracks will be at list eight including some brand

    new unpublished song

  • Produce a series of wonderful images and original visual Art

    to add to the Live Concert

  • Cover the cost of the Creation of Costumes and Scenography

  • Photography 


THIS IS GOING TO BE VERY VERY EXITING to know that so many people will have contribute to my new work.
  • It will make all the challanges worth taking... and I am sure that you will Love the outcome !

THE PERKS I AM OFFERING are unic one by one .. so pick up your favorite and please  PLEASE help me fulfilling this dream by sharing this campaign to your friends ! :-) and if you like my songs and the concept of the Project feel free to partecipate. DONATE EVEN A LITTLE BIT CAN MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE!!!
...

THANK YOU VERY VERY MUCH  from the bottom of my heart!
with Love and friendship..... Corinna    <3

NOW finally after a period of deep meditation on my life I have took all the courage I have and decide to start a New Project with  Visual & Original Video Images to present LIVE and then made it available worldwide through the web !
This is gonna be my very first ORIGINAL MUSIC PROJECTand You are invited to be a part of it by helping me realizing it!


HOW AM I GONNA USE THE FUNDS ?
I just need a concrete help to be able to


Produce and Record all the tracks in a Professional Studio with the help of one of the TOP world Producer
the tracks will be at list eight including some brand new unpublished song




Produce a series of wonderful images and original visual Art
to add to the Live Concert 

Cover the cost of the Creation of Costumes and Scenography 

Photography 

THIS IS GOING TO BE VERY VERY EXITING to know that so many people will have contribute to my new work. 
It will make all the challanges worth taking... and I am sure that you will Love the outcome !

THE PERKS I AM OFFERING are unic one by one .. so pick up your favorite and please  PLEASE help me fulfilling this dream by sharing this campaign to your friends ! :-) and if you like my songs and the concept of the Project feel free to partecipate. DONATE EVEN A LITTLE BIT CAN MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE!!!... 
THANK YOU VERY VERY MUCH  from the bottom of my heart! with Love and friendship..... Corinna    <3

story:
Hey all!

My name's Matt, and my friend Nick recently had his guitar stolen. He absolutely loves nothing more than to shred his guitar, and to play music in general. However, he isn’t in a position where he can afford a new one. To see his instrument taken from him is absolutely heartbreaking. Not only does it deprive my friend of one of the things he loves most in the world, but it deprives the world of awesome guitar playing.

So, in order to provide the world with awesome guitar playing again, I thought I would start this and raise money to get my friend, a truly gifted guitarist, a new guitar.

What we need is approximately $750. Above that would be awesome! All the money, whether we reach the target or not, will go to Nick for his new guitar. Even if we don’t manage to reach the goal, it’s still a start, and will provide so much hope.

Nick loves nothing more than bringing joy to this world through this guitar playing.

So please contribute to getting a young musician back on his feet.

Check out the video to get a sample of Nick’s guitar playing. For more check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZespRYIvCORwFQvVeEQFog

And for more check out his Sound cloud channel:

https://soundcloud.com/galaxy-exploding-nick

story:
OKAY SO HERE IT IS.....

Basically, not nearly enough people are donating to the previous crowdfunding. 

The big reason is WE ARE ASKING FOR A LOT! 

That amount is what will be spent over the next year or two to promote the album. So I am asking for a MUCH MORE ATTAINABLE amount in the short term so we can kick this album off right. $3000.00 (300 people buying the album at $10.00ea) 

WE CAN DO THIS

PLEASE CONTRIBUTE!!!!

We need this money to get the album released PROPERLY!

We cannot release the HUGELY Anticipated album without it.... seriously. 

THIS IS THE BIG PUSH

THIS IS THE ONE TO FUND RIGHT NOW! 

THANK YOU AGAIN!

-Ricky Deschamp (DESCHAMP)



WHO IS DESCHAMP?

Hi everyone! I'm RICKY! Deschamp. Some of you know me as the lead singer of Head Casket or even (as seen on tv) American Idol Season 11, or you might not know me at all, but thats okay, here’s a bit about myself. I was born in the Philippines and grew up in Santa Cruz, CA. I was raised on Sinatra, and skateboarding, but my love for all things music pushed me to write songs, play guitar, and form bands. 

Now i live in the amazingly talented and supportive Spokane/Coeur d'Alene area, and in the past two years i branched out on a solo career. Teaming up with the record label FM Inc. and the amazing music scene we have here, I am about to release my DEBUT (full length) ALBUM “Hilarious, Fun, and Sexy.” featuring SUPER CATCHY, hilarious, fun, and sexy songs that will keep you humming along during your week.

WHY FUND ME?

I love doing this! And I do it for YOU, MY FANS. I want to get my music to more fans, and to see them all in person, sooner than later, so that’s where you come in.

I need your support….. Being signed to an indie label is amazing but its also a lot of work on my end. FM Inc. is funding the FULL PRODUCTION of the album (studio time, producing, mastering, studio musicians, and copyrights) which is awesome! However, I am responsible for getting my record out to YOU and the nation.

To get a successful album going, it takes more than a tour and a catchy song alone, it takes:

- Advertising

- Full PR

- Physical Duplication of the CD

- Music Videos

- More Advertising

- Merchandise (shirts, hoodies, stickers, buttons)

- Digital Distrubution 

- Magazine Interviews

- Album Reviews

- Touring Expenses (gas, cheap food, lodging, or I can crash on you couch;-) )

- And yes MORE ADVERTISING

If WE hit this goal of 27k, the faster I can be with YOU, in YOUR town, playing YOUR FAVORITE venue, eating at your favorite RESTURANT, and even SKATING your favorite park. Without your help, we are still doing all of this but that would  take much longer. 

I love playing music for all of you. I love new audiences singing along without ever hearing my song before. I am determined to give the audience an experience they can take home with them. Hilarious, Fun, and Sexy, is who I am and I want the world to be Hilarious, Fun, and Sexy too.

THE BREAKDOWN!

So why 27,600 you ask? Well this is where YOUR funds will go:

-Digital Release $100

-CD Duplication $1,000 (first run)

-Music Videos $3,000 (4 of them)

-PR $5,000

-Advertising $5,000

-Tour Costs $10,000 (200 shows this year nationally)

-Other Merchandise $3,000 (shirts, hoodies, etc)

-Photography $500

GRAND TOTAL $27,600.

Every contribution counts! I know with your help we can achieve this goal!

MERCH!!

-Skelly DESCHAMP t shirt Mens/Womens

-DESCHAMP on-the-side  tee with bandage heart Mens/Womens

-Womens DESCHAMP Spaghetti strap tank top

-DESCHAMP unisex zip-up Hoodie

-DESCHAMP Dickies Jacket

-DESCHAMP Skelly beanie

-Stickers, Buttons, Patches

THIS IS WHAT I DO!

I am driven. I wake up everyday telling myself i will reach my goals and do well. i practice and rehearse daily. Even while I work my day job I still push for music and shows, often excusing myself to answer calls. I want this to be my job. I want to wake up and plan what show i will play next. I want to meet the fans and make them laugh and sing. I will not stop even if the goal is not met.

When i was with Head Casket in 7 months time, I did TWO tours and  released a 6 song EP, funded entirely by shows and Head Casket ourselves. I received an AWESOME review from HORROR-PUNKS.COM saying the album was "Romantic" and had "A lot of Class". Even had a song placed on a MOVIE SOUNDTRACK.

I am built to do this, to play music, and entertain audiences everywhere.

GIVING.

I am humble and respectful. I will always take my successes and give back as much as i can. A local young musician opened a show for me recently, and he had a broken guitar. I let him use mine. Then with the pay from a show that week I bought him a new acoustic with a pick up. He plays it everyday and since has formed a band. I will always share my successes with the people around me. 


THANK YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this. Talk to your friends. Like www.facebook.com/deschampmusic

Word of mouth can be as powerful as money.

THANK YOU!



Other Ways You Can Help
Share this. Talk to your friends. Like www.facebook.com/deschampmusic
Word of mouth can be as powerful as money.

story:
Even though this Indiegogo campaign has now closed, you may still donate towards this project via www.ianoakley.com/donate.html


All perks are still valid!!!!


Imagine this...

An iconic studio...
A world class orchestra...
An award-winning team...


The piano in the picture above is where my musical journey started when I began playing the piano at the age of four. "Twinkle Twinkle Little Star" was my first song. That piano is still at my parents' home in London, England and very, very out of tune. 
Beneath that is a picture of one of the highlights along this journey: conducting the London Symphony Orchestra at Abbey Road Studios. 
My music has taken me literally around the world and I have now travelled to more than sixty-five countries. 

PLEASE HELP ME TO MAKE THIS DREAM A REALITY


About three years ago I began working on this project which is the fulfillment of the dream of a lifetime. The album, It Is Well with My Soul, will feature myself at the piano accompanied by eighty members of the incredible London Symphony Orchestra. There are also a number of award-winning special guests who are collaborating on this album which is a cinematic-style journey through songs of the Christian faith. Two years ago, we recorded the orchestra’s performances at the most famous studio complex in the world, Abbey Road Studios in London, England.


We need your help to finish this project

This is by far the most ambitious endeavour that I have ever been a part of and we are now approaching the final stages. My team and I hope to finish production towards the end of this year. Through various sources of funding, we have managed to get this far in the project and now we are asking for your help. 

As you can imagine, recording a stellar 80-piece orchestra at such a famous venue is quite a tall order. The sum of $9,500 that we are aiming to raise through Indiegogo is a significant portion of the remaining budgetary needs of this production and will go a long way towards helping us complete the rest of the production. 

There is still much to be done. 


Recording the orchestra was just one part of this project.The most urgent need now is to finish recording the guest artists in order to complete the album in time for this year's holiday season. Here are some of the areas where the money will be spent:

  1. Guest artist performances
  2. Instrument overdubs and programming
  3. Mixing
  4. Mastering
  5. Graphic Design
  6. CD manufacturing and duplication 

Your donation of any amount would help meet these needs and help with the outstanding production costs as we near completion.


Thank you for your support

When you give towards this project, we would like to offer you some exciting rewards ranging from autographed, limited edition CDs to private concerts to custom musical arrangements and many, many more.  Perks will also be added throughout the campaign, so please come back for updates!  If you are unable to donate at this time, please share this project with others. With your help we can spread the word and reach our goal. 

Every dollar that is raised will go towards the completion of this project.  If we fall short of our goal at this time, we will have a "soft release" of a few songs to build momentum towards a later release of the completed project.

 Our motto is Aude Somniare which, translated from Latin, means Dare to Dream. This project is certainly a dream come true.  Music has the ability to inspire, entertain and comfort. I hope you are able to sense the excitement and will help us in seeing this dream come true.  Your donation of any amount will help share this music with audiences around the world. Please join me on this journey today. Thank you!

The video below has now been orchestrated and will be one of the tracks on the upcoming album. Enjoy. 

You can also preview track selections via Soundcloud

story:
Hello,
My name is Michael Adair.

I am an entrepreneur and am always looking for new and innovative ways in which to take products and add new twists to them.

These new color glowing music buds is one of those ideas. Take earbuds and add rope light to them. Simple, yet cool and different.

The holidays are just around the corner and these would make a perfect gift for someone who loves their music.

These color glowing music buds will come in

  • Blue
  • Green
  • Red

Your contribution today will help to jump start this campaign to get these color glowing music buds into buyers homes just in time for the holidays.

I am attempting to raise $5,000 in order to promote these color glowing music buds.

If I meet this goal, I will donate 500 pairs of these color glowing music buds to various charities that provide holiday gifts for less fortunate children, during the holiday season.

If you cannot contribute today, that's ok to. I would ask that you please share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you in advance for your donation or your sharing of this campaign.

Happy Holidays To You.

Michael Adair
