story:
Beautiful News...

Dear friends, my name is Zéna and I play the Kora, a 21-string harp from West Africa. For the past eight years I have followed a journey that has led me around the U.S., Africa and Europe, to learn the classical string music of my ancestors. 


From the beaches of the Gambia to the streets of Paris, I have studied with  Kora masters from around the world, most recently including Grammy Award winning Kora master Toumani Diabate of Mali. It is through these  teachers that I am continuing to learn the Jaliyaa tradition of storytelling through music.  

For ten years I didn't sing. 

...and I rarely played music publicly. I judged myself harshly and didn't like my voice, so I decided not to share it. Privately, my Kora kept me inspired and connected to music. In 2013 I finally began to believe again that I had something of value to give and, although imperfect, it was mine. 

My first Kora album "Beautiful News" is an assemblage of lullabies: sounds and stories of finding my place in geography, memory and resilience, that I have written in my travels and kept in my heart for safe keeping all of these years. Composed in English, my native language, Bambara, to explore my West African ancestry, and Swahili, my music is a tapestry woven from the fabric of the many places I've been and people Ive met. My songs are about migration and movement...what we accumulate in our journey from one point to another, how we change and what we lose in the crossing. This album is my chance to share them with the world...                      

I hope to remind people that there is immense beauty in this life, magic is real and that their gift, no matter how small or imperfect, is worth tending to.


The Project

I  will be recording "Beautiful News" at Tiny Telephone Studios in San Francisco from October 12-15 with conductor Minna Choi, composer Schuyler Karr and members of the Magik Magik Orchestra that include an upright bassist, cellist, violinist and clarinetist Natalie Parker (Principal Clarinet of the San Francisco Ballet).


For the past four months, I have been collaborating with two brilliant composers: Minna Choi  (founder of the Magik Magik Orchestra) and Schuyler Karr ( Principal Bassist of the San Francisco Youth Orchestra). They have created string quartet arrangements for all of my music on this album that weave together the traditional elements of East and West African Classical string music and folk together with American folk and Soul.

We will be recording exclusively to analog tape ( Tiny Telephone doesn't do computers except as a backup), that will catch the beauty and imperfection of each moment. And just as the tradition of Classical music goes, I will have a wonderful conductor in the studio leading the chamber orchestra through each song. I think when you treat music with this amount of attention and love, it shows and you will feel it when you listen!

My Costs

My budget to cover the costs of the five-day recording session, string quartet arrangements of my songs and musicians fees is $6,000. I've saved $2,000, so I'll need to raise a minimum of $4,000 with this campaign to afford the first phase of the project. And the more you contribute, the more support I can give to the project as a whole. 

The stretch goal is $8,000, and the max is $10,000 (that's what it will take to produce the album, create album artwork, release a limited edition vinyl press and CD's, shoot a music video and hire a PR/marketing firm to help me)!  These funds go 100% toward the completion of this record. Your contribution covers:

• Studio time and production fees

• Live musician fees (Cello, Violin, Clarinet, Upright Bass)

• Mixing and mastering of final project

• Production of a limited edition hard copy CD and Vinyl album

• Original album artwork created by Hsiao Ron Cheng

• Original string arrangements written by composers Minna Choi and Schuyler Karr

• Music video production

• PR/Marketing campaign to get the word out!


For you

Along with my deepest thanks for your contribution, I've got some lovely perks for you to enjoy (listed on the right): autographed CD, House Concerts, Handwritten Thank you notes with my original artwork, Kora lessons, and lots more. There is something for everyone, so pick a perk!

I don't view your contribution as just a donation. You'll be joining my production team—and breathing life into this music.

It's time to go for it. Every dollar helps.  I deeply appreciate even the smallest donation if that's all you can manage.  And if you can't do that, please keep me in your thoughts and share the vision with people you love.

It is a humbling and terrifying thing to ask for help. But I genuinely believe that I am making something beautiful and want you to be a part of it. Thank you for supporting me to realize my dream and share music with the world.

Love,

zéna

And just as the tradition of Classical music goes, I will have a wonderful conductor in the studio leading the chamber orchestra through each song. I think when you treat music with this amount of attention and love, it shows and you will feel it when you listen!


My Costs
My budget to cover the costs of the five-day recording session, string quartet arrangements of my songs and musicians fees is $6,000. I've saved $2,000, so I'll need to raise a minimum of $4,000 with this campaign to afford the first phase of the project. And the more you contribute, the more support I can give to the project as a whole. 
The stretch goal is $8,000, and the max is $10,000 (that's what it will take to produce the album, create album artwork, release a limited edition vinyl press and CD's, shoot a music video and hire a PR/marketing firm to help me)!  These funds go 100% toward the completion of this record. Your contribution covers:
• Studio time and production fees
• Live musician fees (Cello, Violin, Clarinet, Upright Bass)
• Mixing and mastering of final project
• Production of a limited edition hard copy CD and Vinyl album
• Original album artwork created by Hsiao Ron Cheng
• Original string arrangements written by composers Minna Choi and Schuyler Karr
• Music video production
• PR/Marketing campaign to get the word out!
   
For youAlong with my deepest thanks for your contribution, I've got some lovely perks for you to enjoy (listed on the right): autographed CD, House Concerts, Handwritten Thank you notes with my original artwork, Kora lessons, and lots more. There is something for everyone, so pick a perk!I don't view your contribution as just a donation. You'll be joining my production team—and breathing life into this music.It's time to go for it. Every dollar helps.  I deeply appreciate even the smallest donation if that's all you can manage.  And if you can't do that, please keep me in your thoughts and share the vision with people you love.It is a humbling and terrifying thing to ask for help. But I genuinely believe that I am making something beautiful and want you to be a part of it. Thank you for supporting me to realize my dream and share music with the world.Love,zéna

story:
Short Summary

My name is Connor Roy. I am a 20 year old Contemporary Christian Singer/Songwriter born in Arizona, raised in Downriver Michigan, and currently majoring in Music Production at the University of Valley Forge in Phoenixville, PA! I have always had a passion for music and most importantly my relationship with my Lord & Savior Jesus Christ! 

God gave me inspiration as to what my next album would be and He told me to record a Hymns album! 

I want YOU to be a part of what could be the next great set of worship songs for the church to sing! What YOU can do is help by supporting this project through any amount of money. The most important thing you can do is pray for this project to reach those who need to hear these songs. 

I realize I have done this in the past and it has not worked out but I am approaching this differently. This money is ultimately helping me to advance the Kingdom of God. The glory goes to God! John 3:30 says, "He must become greater; I must become less." This project is not about me. It's about bring glory to the Creator of the universe. It's about a new approach to worship.

I have come to realize that many modern-day churches have, for the most part, forgotten about the worship songs of the past. These songs were called, "hymns." These have some of the greatest and deepest lyrics of any worship songs that have been written. This project is about taking those great lyrics and expanding on them with modern worship music and a modern feel and bringing some of our greatest worship songs back to life again. It's time for the church to wake up! To sing a new song! Some of the songs on this project will have some new lyrics added. Some will stay the same but with a new melody line. Nonetheless, it's time for these songs to be sung again. 

"There's a new song arising in the hearts of God's children," as Darrel Evans said.

"He put a new song in my mouth, a HYMN of praise to our God. Many will see and fear the Lord and put their trust in Him."       Psalm 40:3

What I Need & What You Get

I realize $8,000 is a lot of money these days. This money is going to go to the expensive costs of recording an album. This money will also cover the expensive costs of production which will help the CD to look its very best and as professional as it can look. I will be offering some unique items which you can get in return for your support. If I don't reach the entire goal, I still plan to use as much as possible for recording this new project. But in any case, I need your help to spread the word to your friends and family. If lets say 600 of my Facebook fans were to donate $10 that would be $6,000. In other words, a little goes a long way. Don't feel bad if all you have is $1. Every little bit helps. If you cannot donate at all, that's ok with me. Ultimately, all glory goes to God! And if you read this then thank you for your time. What you can do is spread the word to others.

The Impact

Like I said, every bit helps. You could be helping to support the next great set of worship songs for the church to sing. But I cannot record the songs without the funds needed!

Risks & Challenges

To make the most out of your dollar(s), I will be sure to spend as much time working on this project as possible to make it the best not only for God but for you as well as all who hear the songs I've been working on. I'm currently writing for this album what I think are some of my strongest songs yet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ultimately, prayer is the best thing. On top of that, help spread the word to your friends and family! You can also use Indiegogo's Sharing Tools and share this project on Facebook, Twitter, and/or any other social media sites which you use regularly.

Logamp has been growing rapidly . Logamp needs your help to create a iPhone app for it ! What's logamp you say
 "Logamp is a website where artists such as photographers, designers, bands, and writers can share their creative material with the world or just with friends. This website acts as a medium for artists to connect with other types of artists and to create a new type of forum together, all for free."

Why you should donate, instead of writing a essay going to show you a list of things logamp could do and if logamp get's the amount of money donated we make sure the iphone app your able to do the same things as the website.

*unlimited space
*share your music, art and literature
*logamp is all about the users
*discover great artist
*send private messages to artist
*comment on great creativity
*everyone is welcome

Logamp is all about the users and being social .

 
http://logamp.com


As your reading this the app for android is getting build :).

story:
Times are tough and promoters cannot risk to put on the small but perfectly formed gems that make it so wonderful to be out and about and to discover new bands.

So we try to :D


Ad:Rem is going to happen, no matter how little or much we will collect from now on (Sep. 14th 2015) The date is set, the bands are booked but you can still make a difference in showing your support early on. 

No money will go to the event organisation itself, no profits but we have to provide the artists with accommodation, flights and catering. It is a DIY event and we will do as much as we can by ourselves.

Please help us to make it a success on all levels and I promise you those bands are all fantastic!

Last year snowwy funded the Stompa event, We had 4 spectacular EBM bands who came from Germany and from Sweden in order to make us dance. This year we have extended the styles and we have already booked bands from different backgrounds and different genres.

50% funding will mean that we can afford to pay every flight needed and airport transferral.

60% funding means that everything we can afford at 50% plus the local bands will get their taxis to go home in after they gave their everything to entertain.

70% funding means we probably break even after buying the food and drink

90% funding means the bands get hotel rooms

100% funding means that the bands get paid, even if the amount is only a very modest fee. And we will do something special (like a raffle or a CD give away or t shirts give away or patches.)

But please remember:


We want to pay the artists (or at least pay for their travel costs and accommodation)  and this is where you come into it.

Please help by choosing from the "Perks" or donate either additionally or as supporter to be a part of it all.


Thank you to everyone who has already contributed and we (the bands, the DJs and snowwy) are looking forward to seeing you all and celebrate together!

We have a 40th Birthday party going on too ... 

Please bring a tin or a box of cat food to donate to the cats charity of your choice!

(we will put down a suggestion sheet as to where it should go to)



Line up

- Andrew King
- No sleep by the machine
- Gubbjävel
- INSTITUTION DOL
- Invasion Of Female Logic
- Black Light Ascension
- Vera Bremerton
- Retarder
- Pantser Fabriek
- lizard Smile
- K-BEREIT

story:
Short Summary

My name is Danny Hallis. I am a singer/songwriter from the DC area. Recently, I've been presented with an amazing opportunity to go down to Nashville and record with multiple Dove award-winning and Grammy-nominated Producers Ed & Scott Cash. They have worked with many of the top artists in Christian music today, including Chris Tomlin, David Crowder, tobyMac, Kari Jobe, and Needtobreathe.

This will be a solo venture for me, I'll be working on 6 songs birthed out of the wrestlings of life and the hope and redemption only found in Jesus. For me, the goal of these songs would be to share my story in a way that encourages and impacts those who hear it, and spur further conversations about a great Creator who pursues and saves.

In order to head down to Nashville and work with Ed and Scott, I will need to raise $10,000. This covers all pre-production, recording, studio musicians, mixing, and mastering. Once finished, I will have songs ready to share! I have put together unique perks for those who would like to donate money to this campaign, including a house show, "behind the song" explanations, and opportunities to receive my EP before anyone else!

I'd like to ask that you consider supporting me through prayer and/or financially as I look to use the gifts God has given me to pursue the calling on my life of impacting others by sharing my story through music. 

I know this is a big request, but I have faith that God will provide, and through this experience so far I am learning to trust Him in his perfect timing as He continues to lead me.

Thanks so much for your willingness to check out this project and for your support! Please feel free to share this with all of your friends & family!

story:
Universal Recording artist J Ross Parrelli has teamed with Sacramento’s award-winning Element Brass Band and Guerrilla Artist Andru Defeye for a one-of-a-kind pop-up tour through the birthplace of Second Line. New Orleans.

Recognized as the “Opening Act of the Year” at this year’s Concerts in The Park in Sacramento, Element Brass Band along with J Ross Parrelli and Andru Defeye have been invited to feature at Open Your Heart To The Children, a fundraiser for Hedge Funds Care | Help for Children organization to prevent and treat child abuse in Atlanta. While in Atlanta, the crew will be providing free entertainment to the public via pop-up performances throughout the city.

Inspired by the deep-rooted soul of New Orleans Second Line Jazz, it is a dream of Element Brass Band’s members to represent Sacramento in the French Quarter alongside the locals and put their Second Line to the test. Whether you are a fan of Element Brass Band, J Ross Parrelli, or Sacramento’s guerrilla arts movement, please consider donating to help realize this dream.

Thank you from the very bottom of our hearts.

Hella Love.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Noah Vargas. I am from Los Angeles, California. I am 23 years old and I have been playing guitar since I was 12. It has always been my ultimate passion and a way to express myself, a place to take out my sadness, and pain. I've known what I wanted to do in this world since a young child and that has always been to make music. To help me with this Campaign would mean the world to me, any little you can give will help. I plan on using the money for recording at Clear Lake Studios in North Hollywood, as well as using it for the production of music videos. If I could attain the money to do this it would be such a huge help! My dearest appreciation goes out to all of you, thank you.

What We Need & What You Get

    I am looking to raise 5,000 dollars in the next 2 months, most of that will be used for recording at Clear Lake Studios in North Hollywood. It will cover recording, mixing, and mastering, as well as the production of making the hardcopy CD and record. The rest of it will be going to the production of music videos, to help get the word out about my music. People love to see visuals with what they are hearing, and both will be a huge help to spreading my music around the world.

The Impact

I believe that my project is valuable to you the contributor as well as to the world because I make music that inspires people. That lifts them up when they are sad or down. I believe that music is one of the most powerful medicines on earth. It brings people together, and it heals you when you are going through rough times. I truly believe the world will love my music, please help me share it with them.

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges I will face on this journey is basically not attaining enough money to finish the project. To face these hurdles I will take on a second job or third job. I will never give up, but you can help a lot by contributing.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can not contribute, but you can always help by spreading the word about my music, thank you!

story:
Who builds these things?

I do. My name is Scott Gorsuch, and I've been building guitars and tube amps for almost 40 years. My musician friends have always told me I ought to get into the custom guitar market, and I've always shook my head and replied, “no, too many guys doing the boutique guitar thing already”. That was, until the apple fell out of the double neck tree, and hit me on the head.

Now I've got something unique to offer: the Magnetic Double Neck.

Whoa! Sean Lennon checking out the Magnetic Double Neck!

As seen on                                 

What is it?

My Double Neck is actually two guitars that connect together in seconds (patent pending), and is the coolest thing your guitar friends, and your audience will ever see! Play the main guitar – play the mini – then hook 'em together and blow everyone's mind!

Tell me more

Great guitars have to be more than cool looking, they have to play like butter and sound amazing – these do! 12 strings are my thing, it's what I play with my own band. They're like the perfect effects pedal - your super-lush secret weapon!

The Gorsuch Magnetic Double Neck isn't just some novelty (although it is fun to see a whole audience go "WTF!" at once!), it's a first class, hand-built, tour-ready machine!


*shot with an iphone with unedited sound - this is a real deal demo*

Guitar specs:

  • Bodies: chambered Cherry backs for light weight and resonance/Maple tops (figured Maple on sunburst/natural - mini bodies un-chambered)
  • Necks: bolt-on, reclaimed old-growth Port Orford Cedar from the Pacific Northwest (the stiffness of Mahogany at a fraction of the weight!)
  • Fingerboards: Indian Rosewood, 12" radius, Mother of Pearl dots, and white side-position markers
  • Scale: 24 3/4" (Gibson scale), 22 frets
  • Fretwire: medium wire for 12 strings .084" wide x .039" tall -- wide-medium wire for 6 strings .103" wide x .046" tall
  • Pickups: Ohio-made Brandon Wound Pickups P90s and PAF Humbuckers - old-school and gorgeous!
  • Bridges: Gotoh hardtails, 6 string bridges are through-loaded, 12 strings have through-loaded low strings, and rear-loaded octave/unison strings and are fully intonatable
  • Tuning Keys: Gotoh vintage-style, keystone knobs on the 6 strings, and alternating keystone/nickel knobs on the 12 strings, which really makes tuning a 12 easier!
  • Knobs/Switches: Switchcraft 3 way pickup and neck-select switches, CTS pots for volume (Standard models have a tone pot in place of 'neck-select' switch)
  • Cases: Hardshell case comes standard with every guitar
  • Finishes: Super tough-yet-thin catalyzed nitrocellulose lacquer topcoat over these fun colors*:

Trans Red, 

Trans Yellow, 

Trans Blue, 

Cherry Burst, 

Amber Burst, 

and Natural.

Please specify color and pickup preference with the 'contact' button below our video.
*Subtle variations in wood grain, color and opacity can occur, making your handmade Gorsuch Guitar even more unique.


~A word about guitar pricing:
The other day, as I waited for my son to get out of his piano lessons at a local music store, I sat there playing a new $129 big-name guitar. $129?!  Increasingly, guitar companies move their production overseas, to countries with questionable human rights and unfair wages, resulting in very low prices (and sometimes, quality). I do every operation by hand, using as many locally-sourced materials as possible; my prices reflect that. Just something to keep in mind.

What your contribution means

What I've got is a great invention, and mad guitar-building skills. What I don't have so much, is money - that's where you come in.

I've set this Indiegogo goal at $10,000 with one objective in mind: To obtain permanent patent status on my exclusive design.
  • I have legal "patent pending" status on the Magnetic Double Neck, but with your help, I will be able to file for a permanent patent, which is amazingly expensive.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to buy or contribute, you can still help:

  • Share this campaign with every guitar enthusiast you know!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! They're those little social media buttons at the bottom.

And so...

Be a part of guitar history! Buy a guitar from me if you can, or just make a contribution, and years from now when Gorsuch Guitars is a big established company, you can brag to your friends, "I actually helped that guy get started" - and that would be the truth.

Thank you!

Scott Gorsuch - Founder, Gorsuch Guitars

Scale: 24 3/4" (Gibson scale), 22 frets

Fretwire: medium wire for 12 strings .084" wide x .039" tall -- wide-medium wire for 6 strings .103" wide x .046" tall
Pickups: Ohio-made Brandon Wound Pickups P90s and PAF Humbuckers - old-school and gorgeous! 

Bridges: Gotoh hardtails, 6 string bridges are through-loaded, 12 strings have through-loaded low strings, and rear-loaded octave/unison strings and are fully intonatable
Tuning Keys: Gotoh vintage-style, keystone knobs on the 6 strings, and alternating keystone/nickel knobs on the 12 strings, which really makes tuning a 12 easier!
Knobs/Switches: Switchcraft 3 way pickup and neck-select switches, CTS pots for volume (Standard models have a tone pot in place of 'neck-select' switch)
Cases: Hardshell case comes standard with every guitar

Finishes: Super tough-yet-thin catalyzed nitrocellulose lacquer topcoat over these fun colors*:

Trans Red, Trans Yellow, Trans Blue, Cherry Burst, Amber Burst, and Natural.Please specify color and pickup preference with the 'contact' button below our video.
*Subtle variations in wood grain, color and opacity can occur, making your handmade Gorsuch Guitar even more unique.


~A word about guitar pricing:
The other day, as I waited for my son to get out of his piano lessons at
a local music store, I sat there playing a new $129 big-name guitar.
$129?!  Increasingly, guitar companies move their production overseas, to
countries with questionable human rights and unfair wages, resulting
in very low prices (and sometimes, quality). I do every operation by
hand, using as many locally-sourced materials as possible; my prices
reflect that. Just something to keep in mind.
What your contribution means

What I've got is a great invention, and mad guitar-building skills. What I don't have so much, is money - that's where you come in.I've set this Indiegogo goal at $10,000 with one objective in mind: To obtain permanent patent status on my exclusive design.
I have legal "patent pending" status on the Magnetic Double Neck, but with your help, I will be able to file for a permanent patent, which is amazingly expensive.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you are unable to buy or contribute, you can still help:


Share this campaign with every guitar enthusiast you know! 
	


Use the Indiegogo share tools! They're those little social media buttons at the bottom.



And so...
Be a part of guitar history! Buy a guitar from me if you can, or just 
make a contribution, and years from now when Gorsuch Guitars is a big 
established company, you can brag to your friends, "I actually helped 
that guy get started" - and that would be the truth.

Thank you!
Scott Gorsuch - Founder, Gorsuch Guitars

story:
We are Daedric Tales, a female fronted symphonic power metal band from Vienna. In 2013 we released an EP titled Hircine's Call and in May 2016 our new single Sleepers Awake was released. Currently, we are working on a two CD release to tell you guys and gals a fantastic tale with beautiful, yet epic and heavy music. Our saga that consists of the EP Cult Of Ashes and the album The Divine Menace will be released, no matter what the outcome of this campaign might be. But the more you help us out with funds, the better the final product will be! Your help will, in fact, decide upon the quality of mix and mastering - two very important phases of music production. In return, you will receive exclusive merchandise and downloads. Take your time and look at all the amazing perks or read the story of the saga down below.

Just to make it clear: We are not asking you to completely fund our two new recordings. We invite you to help us out and ease the burden on our shoulders (or/and purses). Regardless of the outcome of this crowdfunding campaign, we are going to pay the recording from our own finances. In fact, we are already in the process of recording.

The big thing that is yet to come is the final mix and mastering. Mixing and mastering are two processes of music production that add even more power and personality to the overall sound by boosting certain frequencies and arranging the tracks in a way that they are enjoyable for the listener. Obviously, these services are quite costly.

This is where we really do need your help! We are being honest here, with our remaining budget we cannot afford the high quality sound that we aim for - and you people deserve the perfect mix too! With 4,000€ from this campaign we would be able to pull this whole thing off in a very satisfying way. If we made less than that amount, we would have to go for a cheaper engineer than desired. On the other hand, if you help us to raise even more, the mix will be absolutely top notch and beyond our own imagination.

Of course, you will get great items in return. For hours (if not days) we gathered ideas and came up with this outstanding list of compensations. Take your time and pick your favorite perk!

You want to help us, but don't want any goods in return? This is your perk! Thank you very much, every little bit helps.

The release of the EP "Cult Of Ashes" is scheduled for October 2016.
  • By picking the perk Digital "Cult Of Ashes" you will get a download code for the full EP.
  • By picking the perk Physical "Cult Of Ashes" you will get the download code in addition to the physical copy of the EP.

The release of the album "The Divine Menace" is scheduled for February 2017.
  • By picking the perk Digital "The Divine Menace" you will get a download code for the full length album.
  • By picking the perk Physical "The Divine Menace" you will get the download code in addition to the physical copy of the full length album.

  • By picking the perk Digital Saga you will get the download codes for the EP "Cult Of Ashes" and for the album "The Divine Menace".
  • By picking the perk Physical "Cult Of Ashes" you will get the download codes and the physical copies of the EP "Cult Of Ashes" and the album "The Divine Menace".

You will receive an exclusive bundle! This bundle contains:
  • 1 Artwork Poster
  • Full Digital Saga
  • A personalized thank you video
  • Guitar Pro 5.2 files of all the songs on both the EP and the album
  • Digital full resolution artwork by Alexey Rudikov

You will receive a limited bundle for real fans! This bundle contains:
  • 1 Artwork Poster
  • 1 T-Shirt
  • Full Digital Saga
  • A personalized thank you video
  • Guitar Pro 5.2 files of all the songs on both the EP and the album
  • Digital full resolution artwork by Alexey Rudikov
  • Full set of promo photos

A limited package of daedric awesomeness for diehard fans! This bundle contains:
  • 1 Signed Artwork Poster
  • 1 T-Shirt
  • Full Physical Saga
  • A personalized thank you video
  • Guitar Pro 5.2 files of all the songs on both the EP and the album
  • Digital full resolution artwork by Alexey Rudikov
  • Full set of promo photos
  • Digital Lyric Book
  • Making Of Video (45 Minutes)

The Daedric Fan Pack is the ultimate with strictly limited and indiegogo exclusive items for the most loyal fans! This bundle contains:
  • 1 Signed Artwork Poster
  • 1 T-Shirt
  • 1 exclusive Necklace (only on indiegogo.com)
  • Full Physical Saga
  • A personalized thank you song + video
  • Guitar Pro 5.2 files of all the songs on both the EP and the album
  • Digital full resolution artwork by Alexey Rudikov
  • Full set of promo photos
  • Digital Lyric Book
  • Making Of Video (45 Minutes)
  • Personal Skype Call
  • Digital Booklet
  • You will be mentioned in the booklet and on our website

You want all the cool digital content, but don't feel like adding another T-Shirt or CD to your collection? Then enjoy this awesome shipping-less environment-friendly gluten-free and purely digital perk. You will get:

  • Full Digital Saga
  • A personalized thank you video
  • Guitar Pro 5.2 files of all the songs on both the EP and the album
  • Digital full resolution artwork by Alexey Rudikov
  • Full set of promo photos
  • Digital Lyric Book
  • Making Of Video (45 Minutes)
  • Personal Skype Call
  • Digital Booklet

Wow, you really care about the band! By picking this perk you'll always be in our hearts. In return you will receive:

  • Full Daedric Fan Pack
  • 2 Tickets for the release party in Vienna in March
  • Early entry to the venue

You truly deserved this title. By picking this perk you'll always be in our hearts. In return you will receive:
  • Full Daedric Fan Pack
  • 2 Backstage Tickets for the release party in Vienna in March
  • Early entry to the venue
  • Lifetime free entry to all events hosted by Daedric Tales
  • We will confer a daedric knighthood on you on stage

Either you are a drummer or you sure love collecting unique gear. This perk will grant you:

  • Full VIP Pack
  • Lifetime free entry to all events hosted by Daedric Tales
  • A snare drum head used in the recording, signed by our drummer Jakob Griller

We will force our guitarist Aryan to cut his hair. You ruined his looks, but you helped the band a lot! Wow, we hope you are happy now. This perk will grant you:
  • Full VIP Pack
  • Lifetime free entry to all events hosted by Daedric Tales
  • Video of Aryan's torture

You contributed a lot to this project and we are very grateful for that. You are one of three protectors of our people, a godly part of the Tribunal. We will compensate your noble deeds by giving you:
  • Full VIP Pack
  • Lifetime free entry to all events hosted by Daedric Tales
  • Your Name and Logo will be displayed in a special showcase in the booklet and our website
  • You will get a special mention on our release party

You want to make sure the album and the EP will become the best possible product with only one contribution. Many big thanks, you saved the day. In return you will get:
  • Full VIP Pack
  • Lifetime free entry to all events hosted by Daedric Tales
  • Our keyboarder Gonzalo will tattoo your name on his skin
  • You will get a special mention on our release party


You really want to be a part of this huge thing and support Daedric Tales in producing Cult Of Ashes and The Divine Menace, but don't have any coin to spare? Or have you purchased a perk already, but want to help even more? Either way, we appreciate your effort. By sharing this campaign and spreading the word - especially in forums, groups and on social media - you help us in an unimaginably effective way! Indiegogo has some very useful share tool for this purpose. This way of support is so valuable, it can't even be compensated with merchandise.

Photograph by Radka Klein / Nachtfrost Photography

In this section, we would like to guide you through the story of the saga. Cult Of Ashes and The Divine Menace will tell the tale of three powerful ancient Elves and their people. As they fought a fierce battle against the dwarfs, a former companion turned against them, corrupted by a godly artifact. Defeated by the three Elves, who later formed the Tribunal, the corrupted man founded the Cult Of Ashes.

After defeating the dwarfs, the Tribunal used the artifact for their own cause and turned themselves into gods. The higher divines were not pleased with this kind of mockery, hence they turned the people of the Chimer into today's Dark Elves. The Tribunal declared their whole existence to the protection of their people. In the underground, the Cult Of Ashes infiltrated the Dark Elves dreams to recruit followers in order to fight the Tribunal and to cleanse the land of Dark Elves from foreigners and false gods.

The Saga will show the ascension of three warlords to gods and narrate the slow, but sure transition of the Tribunal from protectors to a menace to their own people.
The EP Cult Of Ashes will feature three acoustic versions of important songs to the Saga and two other tracks that will treat the rise of the Cult Of Ashes and the Tribunal.
The album The Divine Menace will continue the tale of the conflict and the alteration of the Tribunal's role in the culture of the Dark Elves. While the album will contain eleven tracks, five of them will add to the story of the saga. The other six will tell separate epic tales of adventures, godly schemes, tragic fates and glorious heroes!

We all know this feeling: You have contributed to a project and give in to the waiting game, eager to get your hands on the final product. Fear not, beloved friends, for Daedric Tales has thought of an elegant way of making both the time waiting more interesting and offering you a tool to monitoring the progress of the production in real time. By visiting our public Trello-Board, you can observe the workflow and all the tasks that need to be done in the whole process of producing our two CDs. If you are not already familiar with it, you can get a glimpse of our project management and the different phases of recording. Also be on the look out for our frequent video updates on the campaign page!

Photograph by Markus Wetzlmayr / WET-photo

If you truly have read this wall of text, you now know everything about our project. Every bit of help is valuable to us, no matter if it is a simple click on the share button or only one Euro. We hope that we could enthuse you with our epic Saga, so we all can work together on this project. You might not have composed or played the music on Cult Of Ashes and The Divine Menace, but you will literally make it as good as it will be and that makes your role even more important than ours. Together we can pull this off!

Best Regards,
Daedric Tales

story:
(A leírás magyarul az angol szöveg után található)

Magia: how we make magic

My name is Nikolett. I'm from Budapest, Hungary, based in New York for the past 5 years. Throughout this period I’ve been introduced to many different cultures from all over the world. Being away from my country has made me realize how important it is to connect with my roots which inspired the recording of my first studio album.

My producer/arranger, Juancho Herrera has interconnected Hungarian melodies with South American rhythms. I picked songs for the album that had a very important role in my life. We recorded folk songs collected by Bela Bartok, Zoltan Kodaly, melodies made famous by Hungarian actress/singer Katalin Karady and an original composition. All tracks were arranged by Juancho Herrera and myself.

The album's title Magia/Mágia, which means magic in both Hungarian and Spanish, connects the two cultures as we explore each other’s music. I'm going to sing in Hungarian, Spanish and English.

Musicians on my record:
Nikolett Pankovits - vocals
Juancho Herrera - guitar
Jason Lindner - piano
John Benitez - upright bass
Zach Brock - violin
Adriano Santos - drums, percussion
Yayo Serka - drums, percussion
Josh Deutsch - trumpet
Greg Tardy - tenor saxophone
Edward Perez - upright bass

Join me on my journey by:

  • Pre-ordering my album
  • Becoming a sponsor on the physical CD 

Why here?

I would like to sell my album directly to people: 

  • who are interested in Hungarian and South American music
  • who appreciate musical exploration
  • who support live music and recordings with live musicians

Other Ways You Can Help

In case you can't contribute, you can still contact me and help me with:

  • publicity
  • suggesting a venue to play
  • sharing my campaign
Thank you for your support!

____________________________________________________________________________

Mágia: avagy hogyan varázsolunk

Nikolett vagyok Budapestr?l, Magyarországról. 5 éve élek New Yorkban és ez id? alatt számos kultúrát és zenét volt szerencsém megismerni a világ különböz? részeir?l. Az otthonomtól való távollét ráébresztett arra, hogy mennyire fontos számomra a gyökereimhez való kapcsolódás. Ez ihlette az els? stúdióalbumom elkészítését.

Juancho Herrera, aki a lemez producere és hangszerel?je, összefonta a magyar dallamokat a dél-amerikai ritmusokkal. Olyan dalokat válogattam össze, amelyek fontos szerepet játszottak az életem során. A lemezen lesznek népdalok Bartók Béla és Kodály Zoltán gy?jtéseib?l, Karády Katalin magyar színész- és énekesn? által népszer?vé vált dalllamok és egy saját szerzeményem. Minden számot Juancho Herrera és jómagam hangszereltünk.

Az album címe Magia/Mágia, ami varázslatot jelent mind magyarul, mind spanyolul, ezáltal összekötjve és felfedezve a két kultúrát és zenei világot. A lemezen magyarul, angolul és spanyolul fogok énekelni.

Zenészek a lemezen: 

Nikolett Pankovits - ének
Juancho Herrera - gitár
Jason Lindner - zongora
John Benitez - nagyb?g?
Zach Brock - heged?
Adriano Santos - dob, üt?hangszerek
Yayo Serka - dob, üt?hangszerek
Josh Deutsch - trombita
Greg Tardy - tenorszaxofon
Edward Perez - nagyb?g?

Csatlakoz felfedez? utunkhoz:

  • az album el?rendelésével
  • CD szponzorációjával

Miért itt?

Szeretném, ha az album közvetlenül olyan emberekhez jutna el, akik:

  • érdekl?dnek a magyar és a dél-amerikai zene iránt
  • értékelik a zenei kalandorok létezését
  • támogatják az él? zenét és felvételeket él? zenészekkel.

Hogyan tudsz még segíteni?

Abban az esetben, ha más módon szeretnél segíteni:

  • megoszthatod a linket a lemezhez
  • javasolhatsz nekem helyszínt, hogy hol koncertezzünk

Köszönöm a tamogatásotokat!

Az otthonomtól való távollét ráébresztett arra, hogy mennyire fontos számomra a gyökereimhez való kapcsolódás. Ez ihlette az els? stúdióalbumom elkészítését.

Juancho Herrera, aki a lemez producere és hangszerel?je, összefonta a magyar dallamokat a dél-amerikai ritmusokkal. Olyan dalokat válogattam össze, amelyek fontos szerepet játszottak az életem során. A lemezen lesznek népdalok Bartók Béla és Kodály Zoltán gy?jtéseib?l, Karády Katalin magyar színész- és énekesn? által népszer?vé vált dalllamok és egy saját szerzeményem. Minden számot Juancho Herrera és jómagam hangszereltünk.
Az album címe Magia/Mágia, ami varázslatot jelent mind magyarul, mind spanyolul, ezáltal összekötjve és felfedezve a két kultúrát és zenei világot. A lemezen magyarul, angolul és spanyolul fogok énekelni.
Zenészek a lemezen: 
Nikolett Pankovits - énekJuancho Herrera - gitárJason Lindner - zongoraJohn Benitez - nagyb?g?Zach Brock - heged?Adriano Santos - dob, üt?hangszerekYayo Serka - dob, üt?hangszerekJosh Deutsch - trombitaGreg Tardy - tenorszaxofonEdward Perez - nagyb?g?

Csatlakoz felfedez? utunkhoz:




az album el?rendelésével


CD szponzorációjával




Miért itt?

Szeretném, ha az album közvetlenül olyan emberekhez jutna el, akik:



érdekl?dnek a magyar és a dél-amerikai zene iránt


értékelik a zenei kalandorok létezését


támogatják az él? zenét és felvételeket él? zenészekkel.




Hogyan tudsz még segíteni?

Abban az esetben, ha más módon szeretnél segíteni:



megoszthatod a linket a lemezhez

javasolhatsz nekem helyszínt, hogy hol koncertezzünk


Köszönöm a tamogatásotokat!

story:
I was Britpopped... is a souvenir guide to the Britpop era, for anyone who grew up in the nineties (... and for some that didn't). The very first A-Z of Britpop, contains almost 500 categories dedicated to the last great British musical movement that swept the entire nation, including singles, albums, artists, bands and moments synonymous with the time.

“From Popscene to D’yer Know What I Mean and everything In-Between(er)”

Lovingly written by two friends, Tom & Jen, who met through music, together they present this special souvenir collating all things Britpop into a handy book with a short entry on each category, paying homage to each and every item that made Britpop so important. 

And this is your chance to get involved and help make it happen!

Tom was Britpopped in late '95 when trying to impress a girl he asked her who she preferred - Oasis or Blur. The tape of (What's the Story) Morning Glory? soon followed and the rest was history.

"The book is not intended as an exhaustive encyclopedia of the movement or of the time, but rather to be read as one continuous piece, or dipped in and out of as a reference book. Included are stories from the time, published in the music press or captured in documentaries, as well as our own opinions. This was a scene and movement that we were part of and which means something important to us, and can now finally be told due to the twenty years of retrospect that it has achieved. Even if you weren’t there, this book will help you to get a full understanding of what made Britpop the UK’s last great musical movement."

Jen was Britpopped during the Summer of ’95 in GCSE Art class, listening to Oasis’ Live Forever on her friend’s CD Walkman.

“It was such an exciting time for British music, with new music out every week. Whereas previously I had been listening to The Beatles and most of the 60s guitar bands, Britpop came along and changed everything. Suddenly there were bands I could actually go and see.  Bands of my generation. I wanted a souvenir that really captured the whole era, but couldn’t find one. So, an idea was born and I started writing with my good friend Tom. I just imagined this finished A-Z of Britpop lying on my coffee table. When I speak to people about it, they ask if they can have a copy too, once we’d finished... so here we are.”

UK chart data verified by Official Charts Company.

story:
We are Middlesong!

Middlesong will be recording their first album and needs your support!

To be produced by BILLY SHERWOOD, legendary performer and producer with the supergroup YES!

Middlesong is Joe Schneider and Phil Tomczak.

Based in the Buffalo, New York area, Middlesong is about two musical minds coming together in a spirit of collaboration and artistry.

The ringing of a guitar's strings, a soaring voice and timeless melodies remind us of the musical depth in all our souls. This is what Middlesong is about.

Listen now!

LISTEN to a free sample of the demo for "Rain to Sun":



LISTEN to a free sample of the demo for "See This Through":


What We Need & What You Get

Help Middlesong enhance the musical lives of people everywhere!

We require $10,000 to help fund studio rental, production, engineering, and distribution. Initial sessions will include three new singles to be released globally!

Do you like the sounds of guitars, striking vocal harmonies, and innovative keyboards? Add a pinch of timeless art, deep emotion, and a little rock and roll.

If we do not reach our full goal, 100% of all funds received will still go towards making this dream a reality!

We need you

Raising these funds from backers like you will help us to create and finalize our first 3 singles, paving the way for distribution. Your help would be greatly appreciated and will go a long way toward achieving our goals.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute, please help spread the word! Don't forget to use the IndieGogo sharing tool to help tell the world about Middlesong.

Middlesong logo designed by Grace Tomczak
CLICK HERE to Visit Grace Tomczak's Website

story:
Born This Way

Hello! My name is Liana Pearl, and I'm a singer/songwriter/harpist from Melbourne, Australia.

I was born into a musical existence. I began to write songs recreationally since I was a young teenager, and always dreamt of accompanying myself on the harp, my soul instrument. Over the last few years I have turned this dream into a tangible reality and haven't looked back.

I have always envisioned having my sound recorded to share with YOU and THE WORLD! For me, music is a therapeutic healing tool and I use it daily for my own personal growth and self-expression. Over the last few years I have worked as an Occupational Therapist running creative groups for adults who experience mental health issues; this work affirmed to me that music is a catalyst for healing, recovery and connecting to the essence of self.

I aim to undertake further studies in Music Therapy at the University of Melbourne in 2017, and this year am focusing my energies on musicianship, collaboration and giving a true voice to the messages and songs i have written.

This Is Happening !!

Making this EP has been a whole new kind of adventure for me, it has forced me to break out of my shell and do things I've never dared before. 

'Liquid Gold' depicts tales of losing yourself to insanity, finding yourself in the ocean, the irony of humanity, loss and ascension. Some of which manifested through direct life experiences and others, as though messages channelling through me. It is influenced by various genres including rnb/soul, electronic and meditation-style music. This project has enabled me to collaborate with some incredibly inspiring musicians and artists who will have contributed countless hours on creating the soundscape for each song and visual imagery for the overall project. I would love to thank the following co-creators in advance for your encouragement and support: Narada Yaya, Fabian Aravalez, Rob Pallot, Phyllis Vlahakis, Jotham Bonett, Pablo Stipicic, Francisco Holzmann, Omer Haber, Pete Camilleri, Rich Rinaudo, Manuel Vasquez xxx

I Could Use Your Help :)

The songs have already been recorded, and I'm incredibly happy with the results! 

Factoring in production, studio recording, mixing, mastering and printing costs this project exceeds the amount I am pledging for, however will enable me to continue creating music this year, hopefully with some music videos to follow.  I need your help to press the EP and give it as much exposure as possible. In return you get your pick at some exclusive goodies, and the chance to get your hands on the EP before everyone else!

If donations exceed the pledged amount, I aim to donate this to a Mental Health organisation/project within Melbourne, or perhaps facilitate my own therapeutic community music group !

See Some Of My Work

www.lianapearlmusic.com
soundcloud.com/lianapearlmusic
facebook.com/lianapearlmusic

story:
I am very excited to announce my debut solo album, "Lonesome Road,"which contains original music ranging in style from electric rock to acoustic blues. The project features Grammy Award-winning engineer and co-producer Steve Addabbo(Bob Dylan, Shawn Colvin) and is undoubtedly my most ambitious project yet. After three long years of sleepless nights and some of the most fun I've ever had, the writing and recording process is finally complete.

I'm truly proud of the work we've done and beyond grateful for your support of my music over the years. I'm launching this campaign to ask that you join me in the next phase of this journey. The mysterious yet essential step of mastering will be in the hands of world renowned Mastering Engineer, Scott Hull(John Mayer, Steely Dan) and I've teamed up with a group of talented entrepreneurs to design and develop social media. But in order for this project to reach its full potential, I need your help. 

The goal of the campaign is to raise $25,000, which will cover post-production, marketing, promotion, and distribution costs. I've worked extremely hard to produce music I can honestly say I'm proud of, and I'm so eager to take it to the next level. But I can't do it without you. 

In exchange for your donation, you will receive Indiegogo exclusive rewards that include an advance copy of the album, pre-release downloads, private concerts, and VIP access to the official album release party. 

I'm so grateful for the opportunity to make this album and even more grateful to have you along for the ride. 

Thanks for your support. 

Greg

story:
Hello! I'm David Jackson! I'm so glad that you've found your way here! This journey to "Nerissa's Son" will be a fun ride for me and I hope you too! I want to welcome you into one of the greatest adventures of my life! There has been a rhythm to my days that has weaved me through love and loss, hope and hurt, revelation and mystery. All considered, I've come into a true realization of the complexity and divinity of humanity and in that, our connectedness. I am compelled by an overwhelming affection for people. This constant unfolding has moved me toward a deeper conviction to live and create honestly, in love and service. 

Most of my friends and gracious supporters would know my Mother and there will be a number of you who may not be aware of her... Nerissa Elaine Jackson, one of the most transcendently impacting people - her life has birthed worlds of love and creativity in different pockets of the earth. I witnessed passion and poise balanced by consistency and conviction throughout my life. In so many ways I learned foundation and discovered destiny through her life. A little over a year ago Mom passed away from from time and space after a fierce and courageous battle with breast cancer. She jolted through this vicious disease with hope and freedom, defying so many limitations and choosing to use what was supposed to cripple her as a bed of influence. My purpose and my intention in life has always shifted in response to her. Her timber, her smile, her touch, her responses, her consideration around me is painfully intangible these days. This switch in how I experience the world has culminated into the most dynamic season of my life...deepest heartache, truest tenderness and uncapped inspiration.  In the thick of my loss I made a decision to worship through my pain and confusion. I had been moved my King David's life in the scripture...it inspired curated a culture within me. This met with my Mom's timeless celebration of my sound has led to the creative LIFE project that is "Nerissa's Son" - my first solo album! 

A team of dear friends and myself have been venturing through love & creativity and we truly believe that there is a sound to the legacy that I'm living in! I have dreamed and prayed and been inspired to go for it and I need your help! In order for this to become we need money to make it happen! Between the musicians' labor, commitment and travels, studio time, our photographers and videographer, management and promotion we need to raise $30,000. With your support and invitation to your friends for support we can do this! I have unending faith in the life of this album; the legacy of love that is built upon my mom & family, the heart of inclusion for all people, the intention to serve people in love through sound, the freedom in discovery and creativity, the family dynamic of the creative team - it is all unto beauty and embrace and I'm convinced that the world is waiting for us! 

We're kicking the announcement of of this Legacy project with our first single King/Clouds. This song was written in a moment of worship and rest at home a couple years ago. As I was humming the melody my Mom came and sat on my bed, resting her hand on my leg, we shared a moment and she went on her way. Every time I hear this song it reminds me of her joy, her peace, her hope, her beauty. It feels like a little bit of Heaven. I hope you feel the same. King/Clouds is my gift to you! You can download it for free at: http://noisetrade.com/davidjackson/kingclouds and you can stream it online for free at: https://soundcloud.com/davidjacksonmusic/kingcl... !

Join the journey! We'll be keeping you updated! If you want to join my mailing list to have a consistent inside look at how our process in growing this project is going just head over to my site: https://davidjacksonmusic.squarespace.com ! I hope you'll support! Bless you!

story:
Daneen's Story

I was born and raised in San Diego California to a family filled with music.   By the time I was 18, I was in Los Angeles, CA singing lead at the Shrine Auditorium, before 6,000 people, as a contestant in the McDonald's Gospel Fest.  Our group took first place, which resulted in us receiving an invitation to sing at the Hollywood Bowl for the Easter Sunrise Service.  I had no idea what the Hollywood Bowl was.  My career took off fast, however, I made the decision to get married and start my family.  My priority was to be a great mom and I did not see a way that would allow me to meet the needs of my children, and focus on the demands of a career in the music industry at the same time.  I never stopped dreaming though. My investment in my kids was well worth it. They are my greatest supporters. Who knew I would birth my own backup singers! They are now part of the dream.


Stepping out on faith
In 2009, my brother asked me to sing with him on a gig he had just started in San Diego. That gig would be the restart of my career. Terrified, but excited, I stepped out, to great success.  I was so unprepared, but knew in my heart, I could do it.   Soon,  I gained a following of patrons from all over town. They had heard about me, and packed the venue every week.  Before long, I was asked to perform my first, ever, solo concert at 98 Bottles Back Room in San Diego, CA.  The show sold out two weeks in advance.  I was stunned!


MILESTONES-Some amazing and unbelievable times

Opportunity knocked again and I was asked to perform the National Anthem for the San Diego Padres Baseball team.  It was such an honor, and they asked me back three times.   When baseball legend Tony Gwynn #19 passed away in 2014, the Padres requested I sing " Amazing Grace" for his Memorial Tribute Service at Petco Park. The service was televised locally, nationally, on ESPN, and Real Sports with Bryant Gumbel.  I was honored once again, to say the least. Unbelievably, my performance made the headline of the San Diego Union Tribune the following morning with the words; "Amazing Grace." I have gone on to perform with Grammy Award Winning producers and national recording artists.

I am ready to share my music with the world.  I have never felt confident enough to start a campaign like this.  I did not know if people would want to be a part of it, but after all the real love I have felt from everyone, here I go.  I want to do this for all of you as well, since you have been a part of my musical journey. Your donations will enable me to work non-stop to complete this long overdue music project.  It will cover production cost, studio time, musician fees, artwork, etc. 

DREAMS are awakened, and here is where I need your help

I am doing this for everyone who has ever had a dream they thought was never going to happen.  I hope you all feel the passion, and love I am putting into this project and help me by making a donation today. I lovingly invite you to share the campaign with your friends (via FB, twitter, email or the old school 'word of mouth').  This would be a massive help to me.  It has been a long time coming, but it's never too late.

With Love,


Daneen

confident enough to start a campaign like this.  I did not know if people
would want to be a part of it, but after all the real love I have felt from
everyone, here I go.  I want to do this for all of you as well, since you have been a part of my musical journey. Your donations will enable me to
work non-stop to complete this long overdue music project.  It will cover
production cost, studio time, musician fees, artwork, etc. 



DREAMS are awakened, and here is where I need your help
I am doing this for
everyone who has ever had a dream they thought was never going to happen.  I
hope you all feel the passion, and love I am putting into this project and help
me by making a donation today. I lovingly invite you to share the campaign with
your friends (via FB, twitter, email or the old school 'word of mouth').
 This would be a massive help to me.  It has
been a long time coming, but it's never too late.
With Love,

Daneen

story:
This Is Us

Sapta was formed on the 7th of July, 2007 in Paris, France. With Marti Bharath on the Synthesizers and Tapass Naresh on the drums, our band aims at producing only the purest forms of Indian Electronic Music, with a code we follow based on the number '7'.  

We are now in the process of churning out our 7th record, one of the biggest ones we've worked on so far. This is why we need your help to put this out just right. If we can achieve the financial target to produce this record, we can assure you some crazy stuff you've never heard before. Only if this record reaches its top level production quality, will we be able to share this with the world.

Goals

Our goal now is to make the $3,000 we need to finish this record. This includes our production costs such as Recording, Mixing, Mastering, Video Shoot, Merchandising etc. We believe that if you help us, we will be able to create some beautiful music. We have had some underground successes and we are building our own community, making small progress each day. This is our first crowd funding project.

Life Can Be Tough

The deadline to finish the record is the 7th of June, one month before its release which is the 7th of July. We chose the number '7' as it plays an integral part in our music and we have overcome many obstacles in the past to hold the code down. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't financially help us, we still need your support to help spread the word out. You can listen to our music and be there for us in any way you can. We greatly appreciate it. 

Check out soundcloud.com/sapta

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About Me 

Hi!

I'm Amber Crump (now Amber Bowman) and I'm a country / folk / worship, singer-songwriter.  Music has always been my passion for as long as I can remember. It brings me so much indescribable joy deep in my soul and I feel strongly that it is my purpose in life to use my music and my songs for God's glory and to help other people. 

What I Need & What You Get

I would love to create an EP of original songs to share with you all! However, being newly married and a new graduate (woo!) resources are not always easy to come by.  All the money raised will go straight towards making this EP possible. Check out the perks on the side for helping me in this project. Your support means the WORLD to me in so many ways. 

The Impact

There is nothing quite like when you hear a song that speaks to exactly what you are going through in that moment, music can be so powerful and so healing. It is my hope and desire to bring joy and encouragement to others through my music. God has lead me through some hard places in life, which have turned into songs close to my heart. I strive to be vulnerable and authentic in my writing, so that others feel they are not alone. 

Once my EP is complete, for every copy bought I will be donating half of the proceeds to a new organization each month that I am passionate about. The first two months will be towards Type 1 Diabetes and Cystic Fibrosis, as close family and friends of mine who live life fully regardless of both of these diseases, are such strong fighters and inspirations to me. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Wether financially, in encouragement, or in prayer I would so appreciate your help! Thank you so so much in advance. I couldn't do any of this without you all. 


Love of love,

Amber

story:
Summary

Atlas Maior is a progressive, acoustic jazz group based in Austin, TX. We are greatly informed by the music traditions of the MIddle East, Turkey, North Africa, and Latin America. Celebrating 10 years as an active part of Austin’s world music and jazz communities, we were recently named Creative Ambassadors to the City of Austin for 2019. To date we've recorded 5 studio recordings, and has toured internationally in France, Spain, and Turkey. 

 

On May 3rd, 2019 Atlas Maior released the album RIPTIDE after 2 years of diligent work, amidst a series of challenges and financial obstacles . The initial mission was accomplished, but the need for support still exists as we hope to truly fulfill our obligations as Creative Ambassadors to the City of Austin.   

 

Atlas Maior has toured several times in Europe, starting in Turkey, then later in Spain and France. With this year’s Creative Ambassadors award, and the release of album RIPTIDE, we realized that this year is a unique opportunity to have a larger impact overseas, and to truly bridge the gap between the music communities of Angers, France, and Barcelona, Spain; the two cities that Atlas Maior interacts with consistently, and have become the sites of numerous cross-cultural collaborations. These moments of sharing, and learning over the past 3 years have enriched our music, taught us many lessons, and have inspired us to persevere through the many obstacles that accompany a life of full-time professional musicianship. 

 

We still believe that the shoots and ladders that come with this profession are not only worth it, but that our work is perhaps more relevant now than ever. During these trying times, we take great responsibility in being American musicians representing the United States while abroad. We want to continue to share our work with European communities, and develop infrastructure that may allow us the opportunity to bring European musicians from Spain and France to Austin, Texas. 

 

Why We Need Your Help: 

 

We need to fund the release of a vinyl pressing of our recent album RIPTIDE. This is an expense that we just can't do on our own. The vinyl pressing, vinyl mastering, packaging, and shipping of album RIPTIDE will cost $3000. We hope to collect vinyl pre-orders through this fundraiser which we'll ship to fans once they're available. 

 

Atlas Maior needs to cover European transportation costs for the 14 days spanning this September’s tour. 

 

We hope to hire a publicist to further expose fans of world music, and jazz to the sounds of Atlas Maior within the countries of the Unitied Kingdom, Netherlands, Spain, and France. This would allow us to further our reach, and put the group in a closer position to being admitted into upper tier European music festivals. The European album release of RIPTIDE is set for October 4th. The goal is to obtain editorial reviews of RIPTIDE in major credible European publications  such as BBC, The Guardian, El Pais, La Vaguardia, Le Monde, European World Music Charts, Song Lines, and more. 

 

European Album Release Expenses:

 

Publicist for two months of representation, and tour support: $4000

CD Duplication, postage, and mailers to journalists throughout Europe: $540

 

European Tour Expenses:

 

Two round trip tickets, train fairs, hopper flights, bus fees, and daily per diem for food costs for two weeks: $1950

 

Vinyl Album Pressing Expenses:

 

Pressing of the album: $2500 

Mastering and set up fees, with album artwork layouts: $600

 

Total Expenses: $9,590.00

 

Here Are The Perks!

 

We want our supporters to be a part of this journey, and we've put a lot of effort and consideration into perks for funding our campaign. We're including a variety of perks to say thank you, from pre-order vinyl copies of RIPTIDE, to digital postcard video thank you messages from Europe, to private Atlas Maior house concerts. 

 

 

How Else Can I Help, You Ask?

 

We are so thrilled about the opportunities our European journey offers, we want you to help spread the word! Download our facebook tour banners, tour dates and events, post them, along with the link to our Indiegogo campaign, to your personal or organization's Facebook page. Letting your friends and colleagues know about our campaign will be a tremendous help to us!  

 

Stay in Touch! 

These are only some of the tantalizing perks Atlas Maior will offer for supporting our album release and tour in Europe.  Look for more to come by signing up on our mailing list, liking Atlas Maior on Facebook, and following us on Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, SoundCloud and other social media outlets. Stay tuned for project updates.

Sign up on our Mailing List!

 

Follow us:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/atlasmaior/?view_publi...

Twitter: https://twitter.com/atlasmaior?lang=en

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/atlasmaior/

SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/atlas-maior

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCF8Q3VEnKrzlGQ... 

 

 

(Thank you for your support!)

 

Perks-related potential delays:

We are committed to our perks delivery timelines, and have carefully budgeted the costs involved with each perk. For pre-order vinyl copies of RIPTIDE , production-end mixing and mastering delays do occur in the music business, but we are confident we will deliver this perk by the target date. We will make our sincerest efforts to stay in touch about the process and keep you informed about the status of all the project perks!

story:
"MONK ON JUNK"

"Monk On Junk" is the 2nd album by the Cigar Box Serenaders, recorded on all homemade instruments constructed from upcycled materials. You'll hear a vibraphone made from aluminum piping, cigar box guitars, a bass made from a dresser drawer, and a found sound percussion drum set.

This album is a tribute to the great Black American composer and pianist, Thelonious Monk. The album will contain 15 of Monk's original compositions arranged for this unique instrumentation. I've been hard at work creating the instruments and arranging the band, and now it's time to make the album! We need a little more help, so I've created this album pre-order where I can help fund the process by building instruments, wind chimes, and more for you!

"This Band Sounds Like Garbage!"

The Cigar Box Serenaders have been performing in New Orleans, LA for 3 years, summoning musical tones and rhythms out of upcycled materials, thrift shop treasures, and long lost relics. We play every year at the Samantha Fish Cigar Box Guitar Fest (formerly the New Orleans Cigar Box Guitar Festival), the Green Project's Salvations Auction and Gala and in-house events, and Monday Night Swing at the Dragon's Den as well as other special events in New Orleans. We recorded our first album two years ago and can't wait to finish this one!

Meet The Trashtruments

All of our instruments are homemade by band leader Brett Gardner using upcycled or recycled materials. Here is a quick tour of what you will hear on the album!

Pipepraphone:

Named after the Thelonious Monk composition, "Ugly Beauty" is a 2 octave, chromatic, 25 key metallophone. Complete with a dampening system and resonators, it sounds like a mix between a vibraphone and wind chimes. 

Ingredients: electrical conduit piping, shower curtain rods, aluminum cans, recycled wood, yoga mat, eye hooks, paracord, shock cord, bouncy balls

Dresser Drawer Upright Bass:

This three stringed bass feels like playing a mix between a double bass and an electric bass. It is tuned E, A, D and can be amplified.

Ingredients: dresser drawer, recycled wood, recycled bass strings, recycled acoustic guitar pickup, recycled tuners, bike inner tube 

Trash Kit:

The Trash Kit is a fully functional drum set guaranteed to make the dancing start! It sounds like garbage.

Ingredients: crate, 5 gal water jug, coffee cans, aluminum HVAC pipe, beads, pot and pan, chopsticks, pvc pipe, tennis ball, chair frame, beans, metal serving tray

Cigar Box Guitar:

The cigar box guitar is a classic. This one has four strings and is tuned like the top four strings of a guitar: D, G, B, E.

Meet The Artist: Amzie Adams

The album cover for "Monk On Junk" will feature original art by the awesome Amzie Adams of New Orleans, LA! Amzie is also a builder of unique, handmade instruments and cigar box guitars. Check him out! amzieadams.com

Here is some of his other work:

Meet NOLA Recording Studios

I met Mike Harvey through playing with his band Mike Harvey's Hot Club and later found out that he runs of the baddest studios in the city. Mike is Grammy Nominated and was recently awarded Best Studio Sound Engineer at the 2018 The Best of the Beat Business Awards. We can't wait to capture the best sounds from these homemade instruments!

How Your Contributions Help

$500 for renting studio to record

$600 for paying musicians

$300 to master the audio

$300 to hire a videographer to document the session

$500 to distribute album

This still doesn't include the mixing and album design, which I will cover for myself. 

As you can see, this campaign will not cover all costs, but will certainly help!

Get Free Stuff!

In exchange for your generosity, I'll be working hard to make you things! Over the last few years, I've been fascinated by DIY and homemade instruments. I've spent my free time researching and building what I can, and now it's my time to share them with you. As well as a digital or physical copy of the album, you can receive:

One-string canjo and "Easy Way To Play Canjo" book with 20 play-by-numbers songs

Cigar box guitars, wind chimes, bottleneck slide canjos, and cigar box sitars

Check out the right side of this page for our perks!

Thank You!

Here is an album cover of Monk's. We will be performing two compositions from it: "We See" and "Locomotive".

Zoom in to the top left-hand corner of the album and...

Looks like a homemade stringed instrument to me...

story:
About The Jungle

Happy-hour or a workout?
Stop choosing.

Support local bands while you give it your all on an exercise bike! After your workout, grab a beer or a smoothie and salad at the bar, make new friends, and build a community in the concrete jungle. 

After 8pm we offer a traditional rock club experience with local bands and musicians of all genres performing their original music. Participate with the community in different activities Sunday through Thursday from 5pm to 8pm. Cycling while a cover band performs is available on Monday and Thursday. Visit on Wednesday for Open Mic Night or Sunday for group music lessons.

See more at https://www.thejunglemusicclub.com/

Local independent business, owned and operated by a Somerville resident and renter.

 

Come visit the club to appreciate the work of these builders and artists:

Construction - New Wave Construction
Architecture & Project Management - Don Warner, Bob Nelson
Engineering - Zade Associates
Stage & Sound - Wendy Dodd
Art - Vanessa Silberman, Kat Sadikova
Website - Kat Sadikova, Tasia Dedenbach
Graphic Design & Logo - Tasia Dedenbach
Photography - Joshua Pickering

 

A message from our next door neighbor, CAAS, a nonprofit organization:

Since 1981, Community Action Agency of Somerville (CAAS) has worked to end poverty where we live.  Your neighbors are striving for a better future. Many face significant obstacles:

The parent of a toddler who wants her child to get a good start…
Our Head Start program is here to make that happen

The working family struggling to stay in its home…
Our Homelessness Prevention Program will advocate for them

Low and moderate income households who want to file their tax returns correctly…
Our Volunteer Income Tax Assistance program prepares and files returns for free, maximizing refunds for those most in need

All those in need of a knowledgeable and skilled guide to the community’s resources…
We connect residents to the organizations and services that will meet their needs

story:
Huh?

Oh, hello again. So like I said, this campaign is to fund the recording and production of my new album, Flower/Weed. My previous albums were all recorded on a friend's laptop in their bedroom with broken equipment and quickly finished before they had to leave for their graveyard shift at Arby's. But this time it will be different!

We have already completely finished two songs from the album, and they are available for your listening pleasure for FREE right now:
 


 

 

Silver Lining is an upbeat Lucinda-esque ode to codependency that's guaranteed to be the next "summer anthem" at the mental hospital.

Flower/Weed is the mellow companion piece to the aforementioned track. With tragically melodic vibes that call to mind Elliot Smith, it's guaranteed to be the next "laying on your bed alone at 4am unable to move" anthem of the summer!

There are still eight more hits to be recorded: Butterfly, Downtown, Changes, New Feelin, Turn Around, Drank All Night, Want it Back, He Held On To Me... and we need your help to do it!

 

Why?

Silver Lining was recorded with a full backing band at Excello Recording in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. For this track we wanted the sound of a bunch of people playing together in one room. It's fun, it's upbeat, and it turned out exactly the way we wanted it to! It was the most fulfilling recording experience I've ever had. I'm so grateful to all the musicians and my producer for helping me make my dreams a reality. Hiring great musicians, rehearsing, recording, and mixing/mastering all ended up costing about 1,500 buckaroos... that's for one song!

This is why we're asking for your help. We have prepared a budget of around $1,200 per song to complete the album. This money will go toward covering studio costs, paying my producer Keith Xenos, and hiring the right musicians for each track. As you can see, we've come up with some fun "perks" for all your generous contributions. I promise this is going to be an incredible album! The two songs we've completed so far are just the "tip of the ol' iceberg!"

 

And?

Make sure to check out the video on top of the page. It's a good time and a real "glimpse into my twisted mind!" (hehe) I'll be making periodic updates and posting more fun celebrity endorsement videos on my Instagram @EmilyFrembgen

All contributors receive a free digital copy of the album!
story_txt:
Huh?
Oh, hello again. So like I said, this campaign is to fund the recording and production of my new album, Flower/Weed. My previous albums were all recorded on a friend's laptop in their bedroom with broken equipment and quickly finished before they had to leave for their graveyard shift at Arby's. But this time it will be different!
We have already completely finished two songs from the album, and they are available for your listening pleasure for FREE right now: 

 

 
Silver Lining is an upbeat Lucinda-esque ode to codependency that's guaranteed to be the next "summer anthem" at the mental hospital.
Flower/Weed is the mellow companion piece to the aforementioned track. With tragically melodic vibes that call to mind Elliot Smith, it's guaranteed to be the next "laying on your bed alone at 4am unable to move" anthem of the summer!
There are still eight more hits to be recorded: Butterfly, Downtown, Changes, New Feelin, Turn Around, Drank All Night, Want it Back, He Held On To Me... and we need your help to do it!
 
Why?
Silver Lining was recorded with a full backing band at Excello Recording in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. For this track we wanted the sound of a bunch of people playing together in one room. It's fun, it's upbeat, and it turned out exactly the way we wanted it to! It was the most fulfilling recording experience I've ever had. I'm so grateful to all the musicians and my producer for helping me make my dreams a reality. Hiring great musicians, rehearsing, recording, and mixing/mastering all ended up costing about 1,500 buckaroos... that's for one song!
This is why we're asking for your help. We have prepared a budget of around $1,200 per song to complete the album. This money will go toward covering studio costs, paying my producer Keith Xenos, and hiring the right musicians for each track. As you can see, we've come up with some fun "perks" for all your generous contributions. I promise this is going to be an incredible album! The two songs we've completed so far are just the "tip of the ol' iceberg!"
 
And?
