All contributors receive a free digital copy of the album!

story:
Summary

Hi there! I'm Nick. I grew up in Grimsby, ON, and now make my home in Toronto. I am a jazz double-bassist and electric bassist, and I'm very fortunate to have a great band of musicians playing my original compositions - The Nick Arseneau Sextet.

We need your help to record and produce our first album! The songs selected for the recording represent the essence of my creative jazz work over the past eight years, from youth to adulthood. I am calling this album To Niagara, With Love. For me, this record is a personal statement of coming-of-age, and I couldn't think of a better place to dedicate the album to than where I grew up.

The music I strive to write is melodic, engaging, interactive, and dynamic. The wonderful musicians I work with mirror this philosophy, and this is as much an expression of my own artistic spirit as it is for each musician involved. Please help us achieve our goal to share this music with the world!

What We Need & What You Get

After applying to the Ontario Arts Council for funding to produce this album, we unfortunately didn't make the cut. Still, I decided that this music needed to be shared with the world, so I made up my mind to fund the record out of my own pocket. However, I quickly realized that this is no easy feat. Artists' fees, studio rental, engineering fees, mixing, mastering, promotion and pressing the recording to CD - it takes a lot of time, money, blood sweat and tears to produce an album. We are asking for your generous support of $3,500 to help offset these costs.

There are some unique perks to contributing; all campaign donors will be featured in the album liner notes in a special thank-you section. I will also personally sign each CD redeemed through donation. If you would like to get a behind-the-scenes look at my compositions or want to play along with my tunes, I am offering a PDF download pack or signed paper copies of all lead sheets and scores featured on the recording. Lastly, if you would like something extra special, you can redeem a private concert with some or all members of the group, or a custom-written jazz tune which you get to name, of which you will receive all original sheet music parts and a demo recording.

Every single dollar raised will go directly to funding this recording, whether or not the goal is met.

The Nick Arseneau Sextet is:

Marie Goudy - Trumpet

John Nicholson - Tenor Sax

Patrick O'Reilly - Guitar and Effects

Josh Smiley - Keyboards

Nick Arseneau - Upright and Electric Bass

Harry Vetro - Drums

 

More Album Personnel

Stuart Mein - special guest drummer

Mike Tompa - Audio Engineer, Mixing & Mastering

Brittany Brooks - Album Art

story:
DG Solaris is born

Danny and Leana Green and friends have made an expansive, progressive pop album. 

We need your help to get it to your ears.

Danny: I have been a songwriter since my early teens and have been making music with my band, Laish for over 10 years. I’ve travelled the world, sharing my songs to people across the UK, Europe and the States, making four albums which received widespread plays on BBC6Music and some pretty ecstatic reviews from the press, such as:

“Wondrous folk pop ballads” – Rolling Stone

"Beguling songs of Love" - MOJO

"A great pop record" Steve Lamacq, BBC 6Music

"Beautiful and hypnotic" Tom Robinson, BBC 6Music

"One of the finest songwriters inside and outside of British borders - Ondarock

Last year I met Leana and my life took a new turn. We got married in December and spent the first half of 2019, on a once in a lifetime trip across South America. While we travelled, we wrote and recorded many songs, making demos in nature with a laptop, a small keyboard and an acoustic guitar. When we returned to London, we went immediately to Bella Union Studio and finished the album with some amazing musicians and a fantastic producer.

The 12 songs of the album are mixed and mastered, and I feel that this is the best work that I have produced. This is also the first musical offering by Leana Green, who co-wrote all of these songs and sings, plays piano, synth and flute. 

What We Need 

We are asking for £10,000. 

Here is our breakdown:

Musician fees - £685

Recording and mixing costs £3228

Mastering £720

Vinyl manufacture £1200

Cd manufacture £1000

Radio plugging agent £1500

Postal costs, crowd funding fees, extras £2167

The Impact

Reaching the initial target of our campaign will enable us to pay for the recording and manufacturing costs and to employ a radio plugger to build on my previous successes on BBC Radio with Laish. We are also planning live shows, both exciting full band shows and intimate solo/duo shows. If we raise over £10k, we would spend additional money on music videos, a press agent, photography, advertising and support for touring expenses.

What You Get

Every contribution above £10 will receive 4 brand new songs from the album today and then the digital album prior to the release date. Signed cd and vinyl are available along with house concerts, cover songs, original songs, demos, songwriting and guitar lessons, original drawings and handwritten lyric sheets. 

Risks & Challenges

The album is already finished and produced to the highest quality with the best musicians and an excellent producer. I have previously delivered and marketed four albums with Laish so I am confident in being able to present this in the most professional way possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to financially contribute at this stage, then sharing this page with your friends on your social media would be very helpful. Words of encouragement, listening to our music, sharing it and talking about it all helps.

Our Team

Danny Green - songwriter, singer, guitarist, project manager

Leana Green - songwriter, singer, flute, piano, synths

Matt Canty - bass guitar

Tom Chadd - hammond, synths

Jools Owen - drums 

Matt Hardy - drums

Iggy B- Producer

James Pegrum - Viaduct Radio plugging

Seth Hodder - Budde Music Publishing

Davide Hang the DJ - bookings Italy

Chris Ponzi - Photography

Mariano Peccinetti - Album art

James Ockelford at Refold Design - cd and vinyl template

AWAL - digital distrubution

Listen to our first song, Total Understanding

story:
Hello, we are Imprints!

We've come a long way from our sleepy fishing town beginnings in Falmouth. In the last seven years we've gone from strength to strength, moving to Bristol, expanding the band, exploring every nook and cranny of the folk-rock genre and playing some incredible shows for you wonderful people. You've helped shape us into the folk-rock-shanty explosion you know and love. 

Our debut album ‘Flagship’ is reaching completion and because we wouldn't be where we are without you, we thought we'd let you get your filthy mitts on some delicious merch before anyone else. There'll be signed CD's, Vinyls*, T-shirts and all manner of other goodies, including limited runs of a lyric and chord book. 

The reasoning behind this IndieGoGo campaign is to treat you beauties early to all these wonderful items at some incredible prices. This, in turn, allows us to carry on making, perfecting and touring the music you all love. It also enables us to put together some incredible shows in November, support the venues we play at and local bands we'll be playing with. Lastly, with your help we can keep on the road throughout the tour and long into the future, as currently our beloved band van Pam isn't very well; she must be replaced!

Thank you for your ongoing support. We look forward to partying with you soon,

Big love
Imprints x

 

 

 

*Disclaimer for orders containing vinyl: Due to turnaround times on getting these printed, there is a chance that the vinyl may arrive after the album release date at the beginning of November. We will make sure you have any other goodies you order before hand and if you're just ordering the vinyl, we'll get your download code emailed across to you pre-release so you won't be missing out on hearing the new songs before anyone else!

story:
About Me

Hello! My name is Eric Monkhouse. I am a yoga teacher, somatic psychotherapist, bodyworker and musician. I’ve been teaching yoga for over 20 years and have become a connoisseur of music and sounds conducive for enhancing the meditative flow state. 

In this time of challenge and transition on our planet, I feel we must create not only for expression's sake, but for healing and transformation. Since a teenager it’s been a dream to produce an ambient album for deep relaxation.

What's The Sacred Sound Ceremony?

This year I offered several Sacred Sound Ceremonies for my community to gather and attune to the ancient rites of drinking cacao, activating breath, prayer and meditation. 

I live loop the didgeridoo, flute, harmonium, voice and live field recordings to  create a multi-layered indigenous and techno-ambient soundscape to induce expanded states of consciousness.

I need your help to professionally produce my first full length album based on the inspiration that was revealed in these sacred ceremonies.

What You Get

The album will be recorded at Pyramind Studios (SF), in the highest quality in order to capture the entire harmonic overtone frequencies of the didgeridoo. 

Ideally you will listen to it with good quality headphones to gain the spacial effects and I would recommend either sitting or lying down to induce a deep, peaceful stillness. While listening to this album, I would like you to close your eyes and enter a kaleidoscopic alchemy unifying mind, body and soul. To discover the oneness in all things visible and invisible. If you suffer from a lot of stress or find it difficult to meditate this album will be incredibly healing for your nervous system.

Whilst listening, enjoy other art forms too, such as painting, gardening, massage, yin yoga etc.

The recording is complete - the final mixing and mastering is due to begin this week.

By the end of June  2018, the album will be finished and you will receive a download link of the album along with any other extra rewards - and there are some awesome high value ones on offer! Those that are able to attend the Album Launch party in Berkeley will receive their copy a week earlier.  

The costs of the album including artwork and professional studio recording, mixing and mastering at Pyramind Studios with Greg Gordon will be around $5K. 

If the time is not right for you to contribute financially, you can still support the campaign by sharing it on social media and with friends and family. 

Thank you for believing in me, believing in this project, and for being a part of it. 

With love and gratitude,

Eric

story:
Short Summary

About The Band:

Strange Breed are a 4 piece, all queer, all female garage rock band based out of Vancouver, BC. Sounding like every 90’s riot grrrl fans’ feminist wet dream with an unexpected modern rock twist – Strange Breed has been described as a “Grittier B52’s”, or what a collaboration between Veruca Salt, Paramore, Bikini Kill and Hole would sound like.

They are currently in the studio with industry veteran Darren Grahn working on their first studio album, and are slowly taking over their local music scene one show at a time. Strange Breed constantly has individuals of all different backgrounds reaching out and expressing how much they appreciate seeing queer representation in accessible music, and hearing “good, catchy tunes with an actual message”.

Strange Breed is all about promoting positive change through the messages in their music and in their general interactions with the world and online – be it political, social, or based around physical/mental health. They have been a part of raising money for vital local organizations like Music Heals BC, Girls Rock Camp Vancouver, The Downtown Eastside Women’s Centre and WISH! Drop In Centre Society.

 

About The Director:

Lindsay Hitchcock is a director and camera operator based out of Vancouver BC. Graduating with ​honours from Capilano University’s Bachelor of Motion Picture Art Degree Lindsay has a wide range of experience, from directing short independent films to working in the camera department on union features. With a love for experimentation and research of technique, Lindsay enjoys utilizing filmmaking as a storytelling medium to reveal and discover essences that simply cannot be replicated in non-visual platforms.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This campaign is important to us, because this video for "Closer" will be our first professional music video! That is a cause to celebrate! That said, we are also simultaneously working hard on finishing our first professional, studio album and frankly... that costs big $$$. We understand that our listeners want exciting content, and that involves more than just releasing new singles or playing another show.

We are at a pivotal point in our career as a band where something like a polished music video that truly encompasses our energy and values as a band will help us break the glass ceiling to the next level - not only for ourselves, but so that we can have more to offer our community and our listeners. We want this video to be filled with people we love and admire - local talent that we want to support as much as possible. That is where the money factor comes in, and that is where we need your help!

The Impact

In supporting this project, you are supporting female, queer and LGBTQ+ artists all over the world with an easy click. How? 

As we mentioned before, what we do is not just for us. We LOVE what we do, and we do it BECAUSE we love it. But, we also are we are as a band to demand more attention and space in the world for queer and female artists. Especially when it comes to modern rock music, which is typically monopolized by white, straight, cis-gendered males making "macho rock" and typically contributing to a culture that's about women to the back of the room or in the bedroom - and queers? Get out. We want visibility! When do we want it? NOW!

We're unapologetically who we are, and we know that our music helps people of all identities find a sense of community and connection - and it will only do so more, the more that we gain traction. We plan to give back to as many queer, female, non-binary, POC artists in our community as possible through this project, and many more!

 

“…The positive atmosphere they created did not, however, disguise the seriousness of the issues addressed in some of their songs — “The C Word,” an homage to consent, and “Gun Control,” a challenge to the hypocrisy of the NRA. (-Written by Hannah Toms for Discorder Magazine” — Read the whole article here)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We Need & What You Get

Based on quotes we've received from the artists we'll be working with and our calculations of all expenses, here is the breakdown of the $2500 we need to make this video a success:

  • $1000 - Section Four Productions -  This covers our director / team of camera operators, lighting, and post production of the video.
  • $700 - Crane Studios Rental - This covers a 10 hour day at a professional photography/film studio. This 2500 sq ft space includes change rooms, makeup area, kitchen, washrooms, backdrops and some lighting as well. 
  • $300 - Choreography - This covers the fees of professional local Burlesque Artist, Lilac Luste for her work choreographing the dance/acting segments of the video. 
  • $250 - Makeup / Hair - This covers the fees of makeup and hair services on site during the shoot. 
  • $250 - Dancers / Community Extras - This covers half of the fees we will be using to compensate the dancers and community extras we will be having featured in the video - the rest we will match out of pocket <3 

If our entire goal of $2500 is not reached, we will still be aiming to split the funds that we DO raise as equal as possible to reflect the percentages of what needs to be covered as relayed above. For example, if we raise $1000 by the campaign deadline, then we would still be putting 40% of the budget towards the film crew ($400), as we would be if we received the full amount, and so on and so forth. 

Our plan for covering the rest of the budget would simply be to come out of pocket and to continue to contribute from our shows, merch sales, music sales etc. This however, might push out the expected release of the video from this spring to later this year, or possibly next year! But it will certainly not stop the video from happening. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Your generous donation will reward you with any one of the perks found to the side! This includes some of our popular merchandise and also an exclusive, "zine" inspired, one-of-a-kind Strange Breed Print designed by Vancouver local non-binary artist, Lindsay Macphee (Insta - @ghostpoems). 

 

Risks & Challenges

Like any creative project, there are always some challenges involved. For us, the main hurdle to overcome has been funding this project - and that is why we've reached out to our amazing community (you!). 

We are always being proactive and consistently applying for grants and contests, but frankly when you're a "newer" band like we are, it can be hard to make yourself stand out against the many hundreds / thousands of other applicants who may have more of a track record. So you always have to have a plan B....and C, and D, and E and....

We plan to make this video regardless of any financial or other miscellaneous challenges that may come our way. What it comes down to, is that it will ultimately be more difficult to execute the vision for the video (as described in our Campaign Video above) without the funds we are trying to raise. It will also be harder for us to compensate our team and our fellow artists fairly who are involved in the creation of this project, and that is extremely important to us. 

We want to convey who Strange Breed is and what we are about in the fullest form through this video, so we stand a better chance at having a stronger voice for our community, and being a part of the movement to create more queer visibility in modern rock music!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally get that money can get tight. Obviously - otherwise we would not be here now would we! 

We appreciate your time visiting us here, listening and considering making a donation. If it is just not a good time for you to do so, there are many other ways you can help out!!

  • Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, Spotify - the works!
  • Share this Indiegogo Campaign with your community of friends and family who you think might be interested!
  • Stream our tunes on all your favourite platforms, and share with anyone and everyone!
  • Come on out to a show, we have free hugs! 

Thank you so much for being so amazing! We love you endlessly, and your support means more than we can possibly convey here. <3

Strange Breed are a 4 piece, all queer, all female garage rock band based out of Vancouver, BC. Sounding like every 90’s riot grrrl fans’ feminist wet dream with an unexpected modern rock twist – Strange Breed has been described as a “Grittier B52’s”, or what a collaboration between Veruca Salt, Paramore, Bikini Kill and Hole would sound like.
They are currently in the studio with industry veteran Darren Grahn working on their first studio album, and are slowly taking over their local music scene one show at a time. Strange Breed constantly has individuals of all different backgrounds reaching out and expressing how much they appreciate seeing queer representation in accessible music, and hearing “good, catchy tunes with an actual message”.
Strange Breed is all about promoting positive change through the messages in their music and in their general interactions with the world and online – be it political, social, or based around physical/mental health. They have been a part of raising money for vital local organizations like Music Heals BC, Girls Rock Camp Vancouver, The Downtown Eastside Women’s Centre and WISH! Drop In Centre Society.
 
About The Director:
Lindsay Hitchcock is a director and camera operator based out of Vancouver BC. Graduating with ​honours from Capilano University’s Bachelor of Motion Picture Art Degree Lindsay has a wide range of experience, from directing short independent films to working in the camera department on union features. With a love for experimentation and research of technique, Lindsay enjoys utilizing filmmaking as a storytelling medium to reveal and discover essences that simply cannot be replicated in non-visual platforms.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This campaign is important to us, because this video for "Closer" will be our first professional music video! That is a cause to celebrate! That said, we are also simultaneously working hard on finishing our first professional, studio album and frankly... that costs big $$$. We understand that our listeners want exciting content, and that involves more than just releasing new singles or playing another show.
We are at a pivotal point in our career as a band where something like a polished music video that truly encompasses our energy and values as a band will help us break the glass ceiling to the next level - not only for ourselves, but so that we can have more to offer our community and our listeners. We want this video to be filled with people we love and admire - local talent that we want to support as much as possible. That is where the money factor comes in, and that is where we need your help!


The Impact
In supporting this project, you are supporting female, queer and LGBTQ+ artists all over the world with an easy click. How? 
As we mentioned before, what we do is not just for us. We LOVE what we do, and we do it BECAUSE we love it. But, we also are we are as a band to demand more attention and space in the world for queer and female artists. Especially when it comes to modern rock music, which is typically monopolized by white, straight, cis-gendered males making "macho rock" and typically contributing to a culture that's about women to the back of the room or in the bedroom - and queers? Get out. We want visibility! When do we want it? NOW!
We're unapologetically who we are, and we know that our music helps people of all identities find a sense of community and connection - and it will only do so more, the more that we gain traction. We plan to give back to as many queer, female, non-binary, POC artists in our community as possible through this project, and many more!
 
“…The positive atmosphere they created did not, however, disguise the seriousness of the issues addressed in some of their songs — “The C Word,” an homage to consent, and “Gun Control,” a challenge to the hypocrisy of the NRA. (-Written by Hannah Toms for Discorder Magazine” — Read the whole article here)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What We Need & What You Get
Based on quotes we've received from the artists we'll be working with and our calculations of all expenses, here is the breakdown of the $2500 we need to make this video a success:


$1000 - Section Four Productions -  This covers our director / team of camera operators, lighting, and post production of the video.

$700 - Crane Studios Rental - This covers a 10 hour day at a professional photography/film studio. This 2500 sq ft space includes change rooms, makeup area, kitchen, washrooms, backdrops and some lighting as well. 

$300 - Choreography - This covers the fees of professional local Burlesque Artist, Lilac Luste for her work choreographing the dance/acting segments of the video. 

$250 - Makeup / Hair - This covers the fees of makeup and hair services on site during the shoot. 

$250 - Dancers / Community Extras - This covers half of the fees we will be using to compensate the dancers and community extras we will be having featured in the video - the rest we will match out of pocket <3 

If our entire goal of $2500 is not reached, we will still be aiming to split the funds that we DO raise as equal as possible to reflect the percentages of what needs to be covered as relayed above. For example, if we raise $1000 by the campaign deadline, then we would still be putting 40% of the budget towards the film crew ($400), as we would be if we received the full amount, and so on and so forth. 
Our plan for covering the rest of the budget would simply be to come out of pocket and to continue to contribute from our shows, merch sales, music sales etc. This however, might push out the expected release of the video from this spring to later this year, or possibly next year! But it will certainly not stop the video from happening. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Your generous donation will reward you with any one of the perks found to the side! This includes some of our popular merchandise and also an exclusive, "zine" inspired, one-of-a-kind Strange Breed Print designed by Vancouver local non-binary artist, Lindsay Macphee (Insta - @ghostpoems). 
 

Risks & Challenges
Like any creative project, there are always some challenges involved. For us, the main hurdle to overcome has been funding this project - and that is why we've reached out to our amazing community (you!). 
We are always being proactive and consistently applying for grants and contests, but frankly when you're a "newer" band like we are, it can be hard to make yourself stand out against the many hundreds / thousands of other applicants who may have more of a track record. So you always have to have a plan B....and C, and D, and E and....
We plan to make this video regardless of any financial or other miscellaneous challenges that may come our way. What it comes down to, is that it will ultimately be more difficult to execute the vision for the video (as described in our Campaign Video above) without the funds we are trying to raise. It will also be harder for us to compensate our team and our fellow artists fairly who are involved in the creation of this project, and that is extremely important to us. 
We want to convey who Strange Breed is and what we are about in the fullest form through this video, so we stand a better chance at having a stronger voice for our community, and being a part of the movement to create more queer visibility in modern rock music!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We totally get that money can get tight. Obviously - otherwise we would not be here now would we! 
We appreciate your time visiting us here, listening and considering making a donation. If it is just not a good time for you to do so, there are many other ways you can help out!!

Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, Spotify - the works!
Share this Indiegogo Campaign with your community of friends and family who you think might be interested!
Stream our tunes on all your favourite platforms, and share with anyone and everyone!
Come on out to a show, we have free hugs! 


Thank you so much for being so amazing! We love you endlessly, and your support means more than we can possibly convey here. <3

story:
OUR GOAL

As a band and as artists, it is such a rewarding and fulfilling feeling when we witness how people identify and relate to our music, lyrics, and rhythms. Therefore, our goal is to make people feel happy, confident, hopeful, and positive through our music. At the same time, we strive for people who let music invade their senses and simply give in to sing and dance.  We believe in our art and in our project, and if you are reading this, we know you believe in us too. That's why we feel the need to make YOU part of our vision and build a positive support system to one another as a community that we are through this magical energy called Music.

[Español] NUESTRA META Como banda y como artistas, es un sentimiento tan gratificante y satisfactorio cuando somos testigos de cómo las personas se identifican y se relacionan con nuestra música, letras y ritmos. Por lo tanto, nuestro objetivo es hacer que las personas se sientan felices, confiadas, esperanzadas y positivas a través de nuestra música. Al mismo tiempo, nos esforzamos por que las personas dejen que la música invada sus sentidos y simplemente se rindan a cantar y a bailar. Creemos en nuestro arte y en nuestro proyecto, y si estás leyendo esto, sabemos que tú también crees en nosotros. Es por eso que sentimos la necesidad de hacer que USTED sea parte de nuestra visión y construir un sistema de apoyo positivo entre nosotros como una comunidad que somos a través de esta energía mágica llamada Música.

 

"Grupo Rebolu is one of the hottest bands in New York City and incredible ambassadors for the continuity of Afro-Colombian culture in the US and beyond! Ronald, Morris and Johanna are electrifying performers, cooking up a groove that is impossible to sit still for"

 

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL HELP US ACHIEVE 

Rebolu is launching this campaign as an opportunity for everyone to support a very valuable cause that is creating music for the world to enjoy. With your monetary support we will be able to accomplish finishing and completing the recording of the songs, mixing, and mastering of Tiempos Buenos - a compilation of 10 original songs composed and arranged by Ronald Polo, who has put all his heart and soul into the creation of Rebolu’s third album to give you and the world the best of Afro-Colombian music with that New York City touch. The album was inspired by the many stories of immigrants that one day decided to leave their families, their people, and their homeland behind looking for a better and brighter future. In this album our music will bring hope, enchantment and optimistic messages about love, life, and staying true to yourself while fulfilling your dreams. Your heart-felt contribution will help us achieve so much! We will  forever be grateful for your trust in helping us succeed in spreading our music, our art, and our message.

[Español] REBOLU está lanzando esta campaña como una oportunidad para que todos apoyen nuestra causa de crear música para que el mundo la disfrute. Con su apoyo monetario podremos completar la grabación, la mezcla y la masterización de Tiempos Buenos - una compilación de 10 canciones originales compuestas y arregladas por Ronald Polo, quien ha puesto todo su corazón y alma en el creación del tercer álbum de Rebolu para brindarle al mundo lo mejor de la música afro colombiana pero incluyendo ese toque de sabrosura y diversidad que tiene la ciudad de Nueva York. El álbum se inspiró en las muchas historias de inmigrantes que un día decidieron dejar a sus familias, su gente y su tierra natal en busca de un futuro mejor y más próspero. Nuestra música traerá esperanza, encanto y mensajes optimistas sobre el amor, la vida y el mantenerse fiel a uno mismo mientras cumples tus sueños. ¡Su contribución nos ayudará a lograr tanto! Siempre estaremos agradecidos por su confianza en ayudarnos a tener éxito en la difusión de nuestra música, nuestro arte, y nuestro mensaje.

"Highly recommend this band to anyone looking for an incredible Afro-Colombian performance. They played at my best friend’s wedding and tore the house down"

 

WHO WE ARE 

Ronald Polo

A composer, Gaitero, and musician at heart, Polo has been composing since the early age of seven and currently has more than eighty songs inspired by family, love, life experiences, tradition, culture, and of course music itself. Polo has also collaborated in many different projects with other well-known composers and musicians throughout New York City.  His interest is to take both his culture and musical notes to every corner of the world

[Español] Compositor, gaitero y músico de corazón. Polo ha estado componiendo desde la temprana edad de siete años y actualmente tiene más de ochenta canciones inspiradas en el amor, la familia, su experiencias de vida, la tradición, la cultura, y por supuesto la música en sí. Polo también ha colaborado en muchos proyectos diferentes con otros compositores y músicos conocidos en toda la ciudad de Nueva York. Su interés es llevar su cultura y sus notas musicales a todos los rincones del mundo.

Moris Cañate 

A talented drummer coming from a modest family with a lineage of legendary Afro-traditional musicians and dancers. Cañate is the nephew of the late Paulino Salgado (Batata III), the single most accomplished Afro-Colombian folkloric percussionist of all time. Cañate is considered by many to be among the top five Tambor Alegre players in the world. He has performed around the globe proudly representing his Afro-descendent roots and Colombia's Caribbean coast.

[Español] Un talentoso tamborero que viene de una familia modesta pero con un linaje de músicos y bailarines afro-tradicionales legendarios. Cañate es el sobrino del difunto Paulino Salgado (Batata III), el percusionista folklórico afrocolombiano más exitoso de todos los tiempos. Cañate es considerado por muchos como uno de los cinco mejores tocadores de Tambor Alegre en el mundo. Se ha presentado en todo el mundo representando con orgullo sus raíces afrodescendientes y la costa caribeña de Colombia.

Johanna Castañeda

Castañeda hails from the capital city of Bogota and also comes from a modest home full of artistic traditions. She developed her interest in dancing at an early age, and with the support of her family she started her artistic career. But shortly after, her family decided to migrate to the US looking for better times. It was in a foreign land where Castañeda found herself more drawn into her Colombian traditional roots, in terms of both culture and music. In 2009, Castañeda becomes a key member of Grupo Rebolu bringing not only her voice, but also her musical knowledge.

[Español] Castañeda es de la ciudad capital de Bogotá y también proviene de una casa modesta llena de tradiciones artísticas. Desarrolló su interés por el baile a una edad temprana y con el apoyo de su familia comenzó su carrera artística. Pero poco después, su familia decidió emigrar a los Estados Unidos en busca de tiempos buenos. Fue en tierras lejanas donde Castañeda se encontró más atraída por sus raíces tradicionales colombianas, tanto en términos de cultura como de música. En 2009, Castañeda se convierte en un miembro clave de Grupo Rebolu, aportando no solo su voz, sino también sus conocimientos musicales.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

So here is the breakdown of how the funds will be distributed for the making of Tiempos Buenos:

[Español] Aquí está el desglose de cómo se distribuirán los fondos para la realización de Tiempos Buenos:

* Inidegogo Fee $500

* Production $1,500

* Musicians $ 1,000

* Recording and Mixing $ 1,000

* Printing and Merch $ 2,000

* Marketing and PR $2,000

* Showcases, trips and festivals $ 2,000

* Mastering $ 1,000

As a "Thank You" for your contribution, you will receive:

  • exclusive perks such as uniquely designed T-shirts with the Tiempos Bueno and Rebolu logo
  • A brand new, fresh-off-the-oven copy of Tiempos Buenos autographed by Ronald, Johanna and Moris.
  • A private 1-hour Tambor Alegre drum lesson with our master percussionist Moris Canate
  • An "Hora Loca" performance at your party!
  • And many more surprises to come...

We are true believers that we can reach our goal with your support and contribution.

[Español] Como forma de agradecimiento por su aporte monetario, usted recibirá:

  • Beneficios exclusivos como camisetas de diseño único con el logotipo de Tiempos Bueno y Rebolu.
  • Una copia de Tiempos Buenos autografiada por Ronald, Johanna y Moris.
  • Una clase privada de Tambor Alegre de 1 hora con nuestro maestro percusionista Moris Cañate
  • ¡Una actuación de "Hora Loca" en tu fiesta!
  • Y muchas más sorpresas por venir...

Somos fieles creyentes de que podemos alcanzar nuestra meta con su apoyo y contribución.

 

“Rebolu breathes in the powerful indigenous, European, and African traditions and shouts Colombia. Rebolu is a full-on experience from star to finish; authentic and traditional yet entirely original"

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Rebolu is where it is today thanks to our fans and supporters that have been with us all these years. That is why we feel a strong need to share our journey with you.

This band was founded in 2004 by Ronald Polo (composer, Gaitero) and Moris Canate (percussion); two best friends from Barranquilla who trained together in music and dance school since the age of five. Young Ronald and Moris toured internationally with some of Colombia’s best-known folkloric groups. But it was in New York City where they set their ground and founded Rebolu.

Johanna Castaneda joined the band as female vocalist in 2009. At the same time, Johanna took the role of "Manager" of Rebolu which helped in giving structure and direction to the band. The three together lead Rebolu, and want to take their sound all over the world.

New York City has been a great home base for Rebolu; this city offers many opportunities for musicians and bands, but it also offers many challenges. And add to that the life challenges that sometimes makes us disconnect from what we really want to do, which is Music. All the members of this band have their own stories to tell, but in the end of the day we are trying to succeed in this business. We all share the same passion and love for the art, and it is this love and dedication that makes us connect beautifully when playing together, and we feel this energy is well expressed on stage.

No matter the circumstances in life, we in Rebolu know what we want, and that is to continue bringing a positive message to the world full of Afro-Colombian rhythms and our very own "sabrosura".

[Español] Rebolu está donde está hoy gracias a nuestros seguidores que han estado con nosotros todos estos años. Es por eso sentimos una gran necesidad de compartir nuestro emprendimiento con ustedes.

La banda fue fundada en 2004 por Ronald Polo (compositor, Gaitero) y Moris Cañate (percusionista); dos mejores amigos de Barranquilla que entrenaron juntos en la escuela de música y danza desde los cinco años. En su juventud, Ronald y Moris fueron parte de giras internacionales con algunos de los grupos folclóricos más conocidos de Colombia. Pero fue en la ciudad de Nueva York donde establecieron su terreno y fundaron Rebolu.

Johanna Castañeda se unió a la banda como vocalista femenina en 2009. Al mismo tiempo, Johanna asumió el rol de "Gerente" de Rebolu, que ayudó a dar estructura y dirección a la banda. Ahora los tres lideran a Rebolu, y quieren llevar su sonido a todo el mundo.

La ciudad de Nueva York ha sido una gran base para Rebolu; Esta ciudad ofrece muchas oportunidades para músicos y bandas, pero también ofrece muchos desafíos. Y agregue a eso los desafíos de la vida que a veces nos desconectan de lo que realmente queremos hacer, que es la música. Todos los miembros de esta banda tienen sus propias historias que contar, pero al final del día estamos tratando de tener éxito en este negocio. Todos compartimos la misma pasión y amor por el arte, y es este amor y dedicación lo que nos hace conectar maravillosamente cuando tocamos juntos, y sentimos que esta energía se expresa bien en el escenario.

Sin importar las circunstancias de la vida, en Rebolu sabemos lo que queremos, y eso es continuar trayendo un mensaje positivo al mundo lleno de ritmos afro-colombianos y con nuestra propia sabrosura.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We believe in the power of word-of-mouth! And because we know how much you love and support this project, we simply ask you to share this campaign away...with your friends, your family, co-workers, la vecina! We need all the support we can get to make Tiempos Buenos a reality. We want you to have this creation in your hands and be able to listen to our songs. Feel free to share this campaign in social media. We look forward to seeing you in Tiempos Buenos album release party, which we hope to be able to have a date and announce it once we meet our campaign goal.

From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for helping us make our dream possible.

[Español] ¡Mi gente, ayúdenos a pasar la voz! Una forma de apoyar este proyecto es simplemente compartir esta campaña por todas las redes sociales… asi que avisale a tus amigos, tu familia, compañeros de trabajo, la vecina! Necesitamos todo el apoyo que podamos conseguir para hacer de Tiempos Buenos una realidad. Queremos que todos tengan esta creación en sus manos y puedan escuchar nuestras canciones. Dios mediante nos vemos en la fiesta de lanzamiento de este álbum, la cual esperamos poder anunciar esa fecha una vez que alcancemos nuestro objetivo de campaña.

Desde el fondo de nuestros corazones, les agradecemos infinitamente por ayudarnos a hacer posible nuestro sueño.

Somos fieles creyentes de que podemos alcanzar nuestra meta con su apoyo y contribución. “Rebolu breathes in the powerful indigenous, European, and African traditions and shouts Colombia. Rebolu is a full-on experience from star to finish; authentic and traditional yet entirely original" RISKS & CHALLENGESRebolu is where it is today thanks to our fans and supporters that have been with us all these years. That is why we feel a strong need to share our journey with you.This band was founded in 2004 by Ronald Polo (composer, Gaitero) and Moris Canate (percussion); two best friends from Barranquilla who trained together in music and dance school since the age of five. Young Ronald and Moris toured internationally with some of Colombia’s best-known folkloric groups. But it was in New York City where they set their ground and founded Rebolu.Johanna Castaneda joined the band as female vocalist in 2009. At the same time, Johanna took the role of "Manager" of Rebolu which helped in giving structure and direction to the band. The three together lead Rebolu, and want to take their sound all over the world.New York City has been a great home base for Rebolu; this city offers many opportunities for musicians and bands, but it also offers many challenges. And add to that the life challenges that sometimes makes us disconnect from what we really want to do, which is Music. All the members of this band have their own stories to tell, but in the end of the day we are trying to succeed in this business. We all share the same passion and love for the art, and it is this love and dedication that makes us connect beautifully when playing together, and we feel this energy is well expressed on stage.No matter the circumstances in life, we in Rebolu know what we want, and that is to continue bringing a positive message to the world full of Afro-Colombian rhythms and our very own "sabrosura".[Español] Rebolu está donde está hoy gracias a nuestros seguidores que han estado con nosotros todos estos años. Es por eso sentimos una gran necesidad de compartir nuestro emprendimiento con ustedes.La banda fue fundada en 2004 por Ronald Polo (compositor, Gaitero) y Moris Cañate (percusionista); dos mejores amigos de Barranquilla que entrenaron juntos en la escuela de música y danza desde los cinco años. En su juventud, Ronald y Moris fueron parte de giras internacionales con algunos de los grupos folclóricos más conocidos de Colombia. Pero fue en la ciudad de Nueva York donde establecieron su terreno y fundaron Rebolu.Johanna Castañeda se unió a la banda como vocalista femenina en 2009. Al mismo tiempo, Johanna asumió el rol de "Gerente" de Rebolu, que ayudó a dar estructura y dirección a la banda. Ahora los tres lideran a Rebolu, y quieren llevar su sonido a todo el mundo.La ciudad de Nueva York ha sido una gran base para Rebolu; Esta ciudad ofrece muchas oportunidades para músicos y bandas, pero también ofrece muchos desafíos. Y agregue a eso los desafíos de la vida que a veces nos desconectan de lo que realmente queremos hacer, que es la música. Todos los miembros de esta banda tienen sus propias historias que contar, pero al final del día estamos tratando de tener éxito en este negocio. Todos compartimos la misma pasión y amor por el arte, y es este amor y dedicación lo que nos hace conectar maravillosamente cuando tocamos juntos, y sentimos que esta energía se expresa bien en el escenario.Sin importar las circunstancias de la vida, en Rebolu sabemos lo que queremos, y eso es continuar trayendo un mensaje positivo al mundo lleno de ritmos afro-colombianos y con nuestra propia sabrosura.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPWe believe in the power of word-of-mouth! And because we know how much you love and support this project, we simply ask you to share this campaign away...with your friends, your family, co-workers, la vecina! We need all the support we can get to make Tiempos Buenos a reality. We want you to have this creation in your hands and be able to listen to our songs. Feel free to share this campaign in social media. We look forward to seeing you in Tiempos Buenos album release party, which we hope to be able to have a date and announce it once we meet our campaign goal.From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for helping us make our dream possible.[Español] ¡Mi gente, ayúdenos a pasar la voz! Una forma de apoyar este proyecto es simplemente compartir esta campaña por todas las redes sociales… asi que avisale a tus amigos, tu familia, compañeros de trabajo, la vecina! Necesitamos todo el apoyo que podamos conseguir para hacer de Tiempos Buenos una realidad. Queremos que todos tengan esta creación en sus manos y puedan escuchar nuestras canciones. Dios mediante nos vemos en la fiesta de lanzamiento de este álbum, la cual esperamos poder anunciar esa fecha una vez que alcancemos nuestro objetivo de campaña.Desde el fondo de nuestros corazones, les agradecemos infinitamente por ayudarnos a hacer posible nuestro sueño.

story:
Who are we?

As one of the most successful and surprising stars of the East European female fronted heavy metal stage, Scarlet Aura goes wild on breaking barriers of the music industry. Proving first to themselves that anything is possible, Scarlet Aura is bringing hope into young bands’ hearts that there can be professionalism if you have enough passion and dedication in the metal music industry.

They won an international music contest as they astounded the public with their songs, bike on the stage, innovative props and, last but not least, with their winged vocalist. The band has toured with Tarja Turunen, Rhapsody Reunion, had been the first band to tour for 26 shows in China, released 4 albums, 2 singles, 1 live DVD and also the first fantasy book from an enchanting trilogy called “The book of Scarlet”.

This is only a short story of what these courageous Scarlets accomplished in less than 5 years and now they are ready for the next step in their adventure – creating their own record label!

“All we do is for the public! Our music, the stories, the books, the videos, our social media exposure. And because of that we also want to make sure that the public has the best musical experience and that’s why we decided to make our own record label. We will directly make sure that the albums are distributed in their countries, in their towns, or digitally in a correct and responsible way. For that we have decided to utilize an innovative technology – a blockchain platform – that will ensure secure, fast and transparent distribution of music, protect artists rights and also artists revenues. We love the music and we are 100% dedicated to our heavy metal life and we had to understand that if we love the music, we have to accept the industry and now by doing this step we’re not only accepting it, we’re being part of it, we’re making it. What we want to accomplish by that is the perfect understanding of the music business so we can do it properly and legit. And as we’ll gather this experience, we’ll support young bands in releasing albums, properly invest in a production, PR or marketing campaign and distribution and give the best services we all like to receive to touch our goals, having always the public in the first place. This step will also prepare us for signing with the top record labels and will put Scarlet Aura on the list of best heavy metal bands.” 

 

Our goal... 

... is to create a new exclusively Rock/Metal Record label – Silver City Records, go wild with its first release  – our "Hot'n'Heavy" album and sign new bands. 

To get the costs covered (album production, manufacturing, distribution, marketing, PR, setting up the record label and purchasing the sold perks),  we would need your help  to reach 15000€.

(From the funds we raise we need to pay 19% VAT tax + the IndieGoGo fee.)

 

Want to be a part of creating something new? Become a Scarlet ...

... and help us to make this real! We have put a great amount of perks here for you to choose from. Lots of the perks are available only for this campaign and you can't get them anywhere else. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Join our mailing list.
  • Tell your friends about Scarlet Aura
  • Follow us on Facebook, YouTube and Instagram and share the updates.
  • If you are a band or know a band that might be interested to be signed by our label – drop us a line

Thank You!

story:
What is Maker Park Radio?

Free streaming Community Radio! We rent a space inside the Staten Island Makerspace in the Stapleton neighborhood of Staten Island, NYC!

Maker Park Radio began in July of 2017. In just one and a half years, we have broadcast to over 200,000 people around the world! It was started in order to bring people together through arts and music programming. Co-founders Tom & Kristin are life-long music fans, Tom works as a harbor pilot and Co-founder Kristin is a music producer and DJ who spent many years in the music business. They were inspired to build a radio station when they felt that so much music is chosen by an algorithm and wanted to create a place where curated playlists were created by people in love with their music genre. They also wanted to create a place that built a community of music lovers and artists, and served to give a voice to music that does not get as much airplay, as well as to local artists and entrepreneurs to highlight all that we have to offer here.

Community Radio is a community builder! 

    Maker Park Radio has brought together the community in a huge way. We have radio shows that represent our local community and music communities. It is great to see people be able to relate as music fans and champions of the station.

    Presently we have music shows that focus on:

    Jazz and World Music, Neo-Soul, Rap and Hip Hop, Metal, Hardcore, Gospel, Soul, Blues, Proto-Metal, Ska, R&B, Techno, Rock, Psychedelic Rock, New Indie, Electronic, Rockabilly, Doo Wop, EDM, Freestyle, Dance music from the 60's through today, Disco, House Music, Funk, Indie, Alternative, Salsa, Reggaeton, African, Meringue, Traditional Sri Lankan music, Folk, Soulful House, Motown, Reggae, Music from Films and Broadway Female fronted bands and singers and Post-Punk.

    As well as talk radio shows that focus on:

    Female artists and entrepreneurs, theater talk, brewing, farming, addiction & recovery, literary shows in both Spanish and English, graphic novels and comic books, interview shows that interview local artists and entrepreneurs, a local sports show and a national sports show!

    Your help will help us stay on the air, and help us get these amazing shows out to more listeners. 

    We need your support!

    Maker Park Radio is a 501(c)3 non-profit, and we can only run with support of our listeners and our community. We do not sell anything, nor charge our DJs to play, nor charge our listeners. Our App is free to download and we do many community events without payment. 

    The radio station needs help with:

    • Streaming Fees on both our audio and video platforms
    • Royalty Fees, we pay for everything we play
    • Overhead: Rent and Internet
    • Studio Upgrades: Soundproofing, stools, Air Conditioner
    • Studio Equipment: Upgraded turntables, mixer, microphones, headphones
    • Live event assistance: PA, gas & tolls, a sound person 
    • Android app cost and monthly web data storage and web-site maintenance.

    We are hoping to raise $1,000 from our listeners/viewers who love our station and want to see us do well. MakerPark Radio survives solely on grants and donations and a few local business sponsors. This is the first time we are asking listeners directly for support. 

    With your help, we can improve our sound and keep the airwaves open with so many amazingly produced music shows! 

    If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds donated here will go directly towards our studio upgrades, and our yearly hefty streaming license fee due in January!

    Your contribution makes a difference!

    Your contribution will make a difference to the 90+ DJs and show guests who depend on Maker Park Radio as an outlet for their art and to get the word out about local event listings. It will make a difference to the 20,000+ listeners we reach each month. It will keep us on the air and able to take on more programming.

    Help us give a voice to under-played music and new and emerging artists! Help us give a voice to local makers, artists and entrepreneurs in Staten Island. 

    In just a year and a half we have grown to 40+ hours of programming a week, as well as had a successful block party at our one year anniversary, as well as hosted many guest DJs, guest artists. Maker Park Radio has been invited to play events such as a series at the Ace Hotel, The Bronx Museum of Art, The Queens Museum, The World Maker Faire in Queens, NY, a series at Governor's Island. And we also streamed live events such as a local basketball game, a Gospel Choir event, a Salsa dance night, local fundraisers, a Hip Hop event, and a behind the scenes music video production night.  

    We contribute to our community by helping to bring people together, and to elevate the voices of those who have something to say and have history to share. Thank you so much for your donation!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Donate records to the radio station! (e-mail: MakerParkRadio@gmail.com)

    Volunteer at the station! (music nerd? great!)

    Donate goods or services! (have a business and want to contribute your product or have a service that you think we could use? e-mail: MakerParkRadio@gmail.com)

    Please don't forget to share this campaign!
